loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: Teresa es un señora de 72 años de edad, ella recide en una comunidad de la provincia del Carchi. Teresa tiene 8 hijos pero todos son mayores de edad y se didican a trabajar, Teresa vive con su esposo que se dedica a la agricultura. Teresa se dedica a la crianza de animales animales y tambien tiene un nagocio de vanta de balanceado, morochillo y otros productos que son alimento para animales. Teresa tiene 15 años su negocio y solicita el dinero del credito para comprar productos alimenticios para animales. Teresa aspira que su negocio mejore, vender mas productos y que sus ganancias aumentes para cubrir los gastos de alimento, salud y mas necesidades diarias.
texts.en:
Teresa is a 72-year-old woman who resides in a community in the province of Carchi. She has eight children, all of whom are grown and devoted to their jobs. Teresa lives with her husband, who is a farmer. She raises animals and also manages a business where she sells balanced feed, corn, and other products that can be fed to animals. Teresa has been in business for 15 years and is requesting a loan in order to buy more animal feed products.

She aspires to improve her business, sell more products, and increase her earnings so that she can cover expenses such as food, health care, and more important daily needs.

loans.use: to buy animal feed to sell.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y frijol, cuenta con 10 años de experiencia en la actividad agrícola,  comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su casa, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. en mochilas rociadoras así como las que muestra en la fotografía para poder tener un mejor producto y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Margarita is 39 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband and their two children. She works in agriculture, growing corn and beans. She has ten years of experience in farming. She sells her products in the different markets that are close to her house. She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, manure, plague control, etc. in spray backpacks, like the one shown on the photograph, in order to have a better product and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure, plague control, etc.

loans.name: Ana Beatriz

texts.es: Con 24 años de edad Ana se siente feliz ya que hace varios años logro construir su vivienda en un terreno propio en donde vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 6 y 3 años de edad. Para ganarse la vida y estar pendiente de sus hijos Ana se dedica a la elaboración y venta de platillos típicos desde hace 4 años, por lo que se siente feliz de poder brindar lo mejor que está en sus manos a su familia, además su compañero de vida le brinda su apoyo con las ganancias de su trabajo. Ana ha iniciado la construcción de un baño, pero aún le falta instalar puertas y ventanas al mismo, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: puertas y ventanas para instalar al baño de su casa y de esta manera mejorar cada día sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: At 24 years of age, Ana feels happy, because a few years ago she was able to build her house in her own land, where she lives with her domestic partner and their two children, who are 6 and 3 years old. To earn her living and support her children, Ana has worked for four years making and selling typical dishes, for which she feels happy of being able to give the best from her hands to her family. Also, her partner gives her support with the income from his job. Ana has started building a bathroom, but she still needs to install doors and windows for it. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to FUSAI to invest in: doors and windows to install to the bathroom of her house, and in this way to improve her life conditions every day.

loans.use: to invest in: doors and windows to install in the bathroom of her house.

loans.name: Madinah

texts.en: Madinah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children and all of them go to school. She takes care of one additional family member. She sells used clothes on a retail basis by moving from door-to-door. She has been in this business for the last 10 years.  She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy bales of second hand clothes. Her major challenge includes seasonality of the used clothes. Her goal and aspiration is to build permanent business premises. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Maria Cecilia

texts.es:
El trabajo del campo es una de las labores más difíciles hoy en día por el gran esfuerzo que se debe hacer para progresar, pero Maria es una mujer que nunca se ha rendido a pesar del clima o las circunstancias que puedan pasar, ella siempre está dispuesta a conseguir los recursos para su familia.

Se levanta desde primera hora de la mañana para cumplir con sus obligaciones laborales. 

Este es la venta de leche que obtiene de sus propias vacas.
 
Ella desea aumentar su capital de trabajo para garantizar el sostenimiento de sus negocios y es esta la razón que la lleva a solicitar un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de una vaca lechera que le de un buen impulso a su negocio.
texts.en: Work in the fields is one of the hardest jobs these days because of the great effort one must do to progress, but Maria is a woman who has never given up. Despite the weather or the circumstances that can happen, she is always ready to get resources for her family. She gets up very early in the morning to meet her work obligations. One of these is the sale of milk that she obtains from her own cows. She wants to increase her work capital to ensure the sustainability of her business, and this is the why she is requesting a loan to invest in buying a milk cow that will give a good boost to her business.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow to give a good boost to her business.

loans.name: Joice

texts.pt:
A senhora Joice é comerciante tem 44 anos, casada mae de 3 filhos dos quais 1 maior de idade e 2 a frequentar o ensino secundario  vive  na casa própria 
Com o valor do empréstimo diz que vai comprar refrescos, cervejas, vinhos,  carnes, wisks frangos, batatas e sumos para reforcar o seu negocio.
O projecto para o futuro crescer no negócio, ampliar o seu negocio satisfazendo as necessidades de seus cliente.
O seu maior desafio e a insuficiência de fundos, oscilacao dos precos no mercado tem influenciado no seu rendimento e aumento da competividade no mercado mas diz que irá solicitar mais empréstimos para tal vai pagar pontualmente.
texts.en:
Joice is a vendor. She's 44 years old and married. She has three children, one of whom is an adult and two are in secondary school. She lives in a house that she owns.
She states that with the amount of the loan she'll purchase refreshments, beer, wine, meat, whisky, chicken, potatoes and juice to stock her business.
Her project for the future is to make her business grow and expand it by meeting her customers' needs.
Her biggest challenge is the lack of funds. The fluctuation of prices in the market has been affecting her profits, and competition has been increasing. However, she states that she'll apply for more loans, and to that end she'll make the repayments in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to purchase refreshments, beer, wine, meat, whisky, chicken, potatoes and juice.

loans.name: Lola

texts.en: Lola is a kind woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1973. She is living in a small city near a reservoir. She is divorced and has three children.  She is a generous, responsible and hardworking person. For almost five years, she has done a business with sheep. Her sons are helping her to keep the livestock. She knows her activity well and takes care of her livestock in order to gain a profit from selling them. She is planning to enlarge her business and buy additional sheep. She hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders and asks for a loan to buy sheep.

loans.use: To buy sheep

loans.name: María Estebana

texts.es:
María de 48 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, está casad y su esposo se dedica a la pesca, tiene 2 hijos pero solo uno vive con ella.

María se dedica al comercio de mariscos, su esposo y su hijo van a pescar a la laguna y ella vende el producto, además apoya a su esposo en los trabajos agrícolas lo cual es un ingreso extra.  

Este crédito le servirá a María para comprar arena, cemento y ladrillos para el mejoramiento de su vivienda. 

Ella sueña con seguir mejorando su casa y seguir con su negocio de mariscos.
texts.en: María is 48 years. She studied until sixth grade. She is married and her husband works in fishing. She has two children, but only one lives with her. María works selling seafood. Her husband and son go to fish in the lagoon and she sells the product. She also supports her husband with farming jobs, which is an extra income. María will use this loan to buy sand, cement and bricks to improve her house. Her dreams are to continue improving her house and to continue with her seafood business.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement and bricks to improve her house.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 34-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of five children. Her husband owns a clothing business and his practice is to buy uniforms from wholesalers and sell them from his shop. He has many contacts with the various schools; their students like to buy uniforms from his shop.

The customer demand is increasing day by day but he does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy more uniforms. Therefore, Razia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner’s BRAC Pakistan so that her husband will be able to buy more uniforms to fulfill the demand.
She is a repeat loan client and has been showing an excellent repayment behavior. She has already been taking loans from BRAC and investing in the business. Her dreams are for the bright future of her children, establishment of the business and for better living standards for her family.

She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of school uniforms for her husband.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 37-year-old married woman from Samtredia district. She has a school-aged daughter and a husband who is an operator and gets 300 GEL monthly. Mariam is a librarian and gets a small fixed salary. She is eager to start her own business and requested a loan. She received the credit in the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, the Startup Program that gives people the chance to start or re-start businesses. The loan of 900 USD will be a great support to this motivated woman to develop a trading business. In particular, she will purchase stock of clothing and various home products and sell in her community at increased prices. Mariam will be able to generate additional income and meet all family costs more effectively. 

She is a very enthusiastic and hardworking person with a great desire to ensure her daughter has a good education for progressing in life.  This credit will be a great support for the family. Mariam is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving her a chance to make a private income.

loans.use: To sell clothing and other home products

loans.name: Parizat

texts.ru: Паризат, 62 года, замужем, есть 7 детей. У Паризат среднее образование, она на пенсии, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорству, целеустремленности и трудолюбию Паризат, на сегодняшний день у нее есть: 2 коровы, 6 овец и земельный надел мерою 1,33 ГА, где она выращивает пшеницу и картофель. Ежемесячный доход от бизнеса составляет около 12,000 сом (KGS). Паризат обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) для закупки 6 овец и кукурузы в качестве корма для скота. Паризат намерена свои доходы от кредита направить на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Parizat is 62 years old, married, with 7 kids. Parizat has secondary education, she is now retired. 

Parizat is cultivating crops and raising livestock providing the main income source for her family. Thanks to her determination, ambition and hard work, Parizat now owns 2 cows, 6 sheep, and a land lot of 1.33 ha where she cultivates wheat and potato. Her monthly income from this business is 12,000 som (KGS). Parizat contacted the Bai Tushum Bank requesting a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy 6 sheep and corn to feed her livestock. Parizat is planning to invest the income gained with the help of the loan to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy 6 sheep and corn to feed her livestock

loans.name: Deisy Yurany

texts.es:
Deisy, una campesina muy amorosa y de gran pasión por la naturaleza, trabaja con animales, pero no sacrificándolos ni vendiéndolos, trabaja con la leche de las vacas.

Es madre de 1 hija, trabaja enseñándole la pasión por el campo, por amar la naturaleza y el amor por los animales. 

Pensando en su vivienda y en su hija la señora Deisy quiere expandirse y por tal motivo tiene un dinero juntado para comprar una vaca lechera por lo que requiere un crédito para ajustar el total del dinero para la compra de la vaca. 

Con la ayuda de esta vaca tendrá más producción lechera garantizando una vida económica estable para el futuro de ella y su hija. 

Sueña con tener una finca con mucho ganado rodearse de estos mamíferos que le ayudan a llevar el sustento a su familia.
texts.en: Deisy is a very lovely farmer, with great passion for nature. She works with animals, but she does not kill them nor sell them: she works with the milk from cows. She has a daughter, and she works teaching her the passion for the countryside, to love nature and to love animals. Thinking of her house and of her daughter, Deisy wants to expand, and for this reason she has saved some money to buy a milk cow. She needs a loan to add to her savings to buy a cow. With the help of this cow she will have more milk production ensuring a stable financial life for her future and that of her daughter. She dreams of having a farm with lots of cattle and surround herself with these mammals that help her bring subsistence to her family.

loans.use: to buy a cow that will allow her to have better production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to be treated in a medical clinic

loans.name: Zaida

texts.pt:
A  senhora Zaida é operaria agrícola, solteira tem 26 anos de idade desde cedo perdeu sua mãe vitima de doença e não sabendo do paradeiro de seu pai algures na Africa do Sul viu se na obrigação de sustentar sua irmã e um sobrinho que vivem com ela na casa  própria deixada pela sua mãe.
Com o valor do  crédito irá comprar material eléctrico  para fazer a instalação e pagar o contracto de energia.
Tem como planos futuros  ampliar a sua casa  e mobilar, formar sua familia casando se e fazer filhos.
Diz que com os  empréstimos anteriores remodelou sua casa que era de material precario para o convencional e que irá pagar nas datas pré-estabelecidas e solicitar mais empréstimos para concretizar os seus planos.
texts.en:
Zaida is a farm worker. She's 26 years old and single. She lost her mother to illness at a young age. Then, since her father's whereabouts in South Africa were unknown to her, she felt compelled to support her sister and a nephew. They live with her in a house that her mother left to her.
With the amount of the loan she'll purchase electrical supplies for installing electrical wiring and pay for electricity.
Her plans for the future are to enlarge and furnish her house and start a family of her own by getting married and having children.
She states that with the previous loans she remodeled her house, which was poorly built and is now more solid. She also states that she'll repay the loan in the scheduled dates and apply for more loans in order to achieve her plans.

loans.use: to purchase electrical supplies for installing electrical wiring and to pay for electricity.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Being so thankful and appreciative of the loan support that was granted to her previously, Alma is really working hard to improve her current business, a sari-sari store (variety store). The income she gets from this is what she uses to support her family every day. 

To further continue her business operations, she is asking for a 50,000 PHP loan to purchase more goods and other grocery items for her store. With a hopeful heart, she looks forward to your consideration regarding this. It will be a big help for her and for her family if you do. 

As to today, she is really aspiring to grow her business and have more strength and blessings. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase more goods and other grocery items for her store.

loans.name: Faiza

texts.en:
Faiza is a 32-year-old married woman who is living along with her three children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been troubleshooting transformers at small firms. He is the sole earner for the entire family. His income is very low; therefore, he decided to increase the source of income in the form of an electrician shop. He wants to troubleshoot transformers and other electrical goods at his own shop. Now he has become very expert in his profession and can do the full affairs of an electrician’s shop. 

Faiza wants to buy the initial electrical goods and repair tools to set up a newly opened electrician's shop for her husband. For this reason, she contacted Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan so her husband can buy the initial stock such as sockets, bulbs, tube lights, switches and repair tools.

Faiza hopes the lenders of Kiva will warmly participate to help her. She is very thankful to Kiva, Kiva's lenders and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to establish an electrician's shop for her husband by purchasing sockets, bulbs, tube lights, switches and repair tools.

loans.name: Maria Juana

texts.es:
María, de 50 años de edad, no estudio, es madre soltera de dos hijos, de ella depende una hija y su nieto, que son quienes viven junto a ella. 

María, trabaja en la elaboración de hamacas de ceda y de poli seda desde que estaba pequeña, este trabajo lo realizaba junto a su madre, que fue quien le enseño como realizar dicha artesanía, las hamacas las vende en la comunidad y también en los lugares cercanos por encargo.

El crédito que está solicitando es para comprar 25 libras de hilo de seda y de poli seda, esto le ayudara para poder seguir con su negocio de elaboración de hamacas y poder tener los ingresos económicos necesarios para su hogar.

El sueño de María, es poder hacer su vivienda de adobe, ya que en la que actualmente vive es de bahareque y el techo es de plástico y lámina, es una vivienda muy humilde y no es muy segura; en época de invierno pasa muchas dificultades con la lluvia.
texts.en:
María is 50 years old and never studied.  She is a single mother to two children, and one child and a grandchild live with and depend on her. 

María has worked making hammocks of silk and polyester since she was young.  She used to do it with her mother, who taught her the art.  She sells the hammocks in the community and also by order in nearby places.  

The loan she is requesting is to buy 25 pounds of silk thread and polyester to thread, which will help her to continue her business of hammock making and be able to have the necessary income for her home.  

Maria's dream is to be able to build a home of adobe, as her current home is made of mud wall, with a plastic and sheet metal roof.  It is a humble home and isn't very secure, and there are many difficulties with rain in the winter.

loans.use: to buy 25 pounds of silk thread and polyester to make hammocks.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.pt:
O senhor Samuel é motorista tem  39 anos de idade,casado, pai de 03 filhos todos a estudar
01 ensino secundário, e os restantes no primário, não sustenta mais ninguém além de seus filhos vive na casa própria.
Com o valor do crédito irá comprar cimento, ferro, areia, pedra para dar a continuidade a sua obra, concluir a varanda e 02 quartos .
Projetos para o futuro são terminar a obra, anelar a sua esposa , adquirir uma viatura para aluguer.
Diz que irá solicitar mais empréstimos para concretizar o seu sonho. O maior desafio é a insuficiência de fundos e tem uma conta onde faz depósitos como forma de poupar.
texts.en:
Samuel is 39 years old and a driver. He's married and has three children, all of whom study.
One of his children is in secondary school and the others are in primary school. He doesn't support anyone else other than his children. He lives in a house that he owns.
With the amount of the loan he'll purchase cement, iron, sand and rocks so he can continue the construction work and finish the porch and two bedrooms.
His projects for the future are to finish the construction work, marry his wife and buy a vehicle for renting out.
He states that he'll apply for more loans in order to accomplish his dream. His biggest challenge is the lack of funds, and he has a deposit account as a way of saving money.

loans.use: to purchase cement, iron, sand and rocks.

loans.name: Noemy Cristina

texts.es:
Noemy de 40 años de edad, no cuenta con ningún nivel académico, es madre soltera y solo vive con uno de  sus hijos de 19 años de edad el cual se dedica a la pesca artesanal y albañilería.


Noemy se dedica a la venta de antojitos típicos en la comunidad, esta actividad la realiza desde que tenía 21 años de edad cuando sus hijos se encontraban pequeños y necesitaba mayores ingresos para mantenerlos, hasta la fecha es una labor que realiza periódicamente y el hijo que vive con ella le ayuda siempre que puede.

Noemy utilizará el dinero del crédito para comprar productos como arroz, aceite, azúcar frijoles entre otros para la elaboración de antojitos típicos.

Noemy tiene como objetivo mejorar su vivienda  para mayor seguridad y que su negocio siga siendo rentable.
texts.en:
Noemy is 40 years old and has no academic experience.  She is a single mother and lives with one son, a 19 year old who works in artisanal fishing and bricklaying.   

Noemy makes a living selling typical snacks in the community.  She has done this since she was 21 years old, when her children were young and she needed more income to support them.  Today, it is a task she does periodically, and the son that lives with her helps when he can.  

Noemy will use the money from the loan to buy products like rice, oil, sugar and beans, among others, to make the snacks.  

Noemy would like to improve her home for better security and to ensure that her business continues to be profitable.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, oil, sugar, beans and other to make typical snacks.

loans.name: Yamileth Areli

texts.es:
Yamileth, de 21 años de edad, creció con sus padres y estudio bachillerato opción contador, se casó hace dos años, su esposo trabaja en la agricultura y como jornalero, de ella depende su hijo y un hermano a quien actualmente está apoyando en los estudios.

Yamileth, trabaja en los oficios domésticos y también es empleada del CDI (Centro de Desarrollo Infantil) en la comunidad donde vive, trabaja de lunes a viernes cuidando niños, también trabaja en la crianza de especies menores y tiene una pequeña pecera junto con su esposo, para ayudarse mutuamente con los gastos del hogar. 

El crédito que está solicitando Yamileth, es para comprar concentrado para los peces y para el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que no se encuentra en muy buenas condiciones.

El sueño de Yamileth, es ir poco a poco mejorando su vivienda, para poder darle a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida y hacer crecer el negocio de los peces.
texts.en:
Yamileth is 21 years old, grew up with her parents and studied through high school with a specialization in accounting.  She married two years ago and her husband works in agriculture and as a laborer. One child and one brother depend on her, and she is helping the brother with his studies.  

Yamileth works in household chores, and is also an employee of the CDI (Center for Infant Development) in the community where she lives.  She works Monday to Friday caring for children.  She also works in raising small animals and has a small fishery with her husband, to mutually contribute o the household costs.  

The loan that Yamileth is requesting is to buy feed concentrate for the fish, and to make improvements to her house, as it is currently not in good condition.  

Yamileth's dream is to little by little improve her house to be able to giver her son a better quality of life, and to grow her fishery business.

loans.use: to buy feed concentrate for fish and to make improvements to her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a strategic place. She describes her biggest business challenge to be changes in fashion. She will use the KES 95,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. This will enable her to increase her profits. She hopes that in the future, she will be a successful business lady. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Grupo Agrícola Tzamjuyup Sector 3 Group

texts.es:
Manuela es una mujer de 42 años de edad, es soltera cuenta con una linda familia de dos hijos de las edades entre 9 y 16 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Manuela (es la primera del lado derecho de la fotografía de blusa verde) con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y mantener a su familia, se dedica al cultivo de café, ella eligió esta actividad, pues es a lo que se dedica toda su familia, tiene ya 6 años de ejercer esta labor.
Manuela por ser una mujer de mucha experiencia, ahora se ha dado cuenta que es muy necesario que le de mantenimiento a su cultivo de café, aunque una de las dificultades que ella tiene es que no cuenta con el capital suficiente para comprar fertilizantes y pagar la mano de obra para la limpieza, pero manuela es una mujer de liderazgo por lo que organizo a un grupo de personas para juntos solicitar juntas un crédito para dar en marcha  el mantenimiento de su cultivo.
Manuela sueña con poder conseguir el crédito para poder mejorar sus ingresos y construir su casa para que tengan donde vivir con sus hijos.
texts.en: Manuela is a 42 year old woman. She is single and has a beautiful family of two children, who are 9 and 16 years old. This humble family lives in a community of Sololá. Wishing to obtain earnings and to support her family, Manuela (she is the first one on the right side of the photo, wearing a green blouse) works cultivating coffee. She chose this activity, because this is what her whole family does for a living. She already has six years working in this job. Being a woman with a lot of experience, Manuela has noticed that it is very necessary to give maintenance to her coffee crops. However, one of the difficulties she has is that she does not have enough capital to buy fertilizers and to pay for hand labor for the cleaning; but Manuela is a leader so she organized a group of people to request together a loan to start the maintenance of her crops. Manuela dreams of obtaining the loan to improve her income and to build a house so she has a place to live with her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay for hand labor.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be honest. 

She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a competitive area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. 

She will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to own a big exhibition shop within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. She will use the anticipated profits to add more stock.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Mukhtiar

texts.en:
Mukhtiar is a 31-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a very hardworking and loves his family very much. He tries to make sure that his family does not have any needs left. 

He is involved in his own business to have a regular income in the family. He is involved in manufacturing and selling furniture, such as single beds, tables, etc. He started this business in his young age, but now he has grown older.  

Today, he has many regular customers and also takes orders from other cities. This business yields a good income for him, but  the family's needs are increasing day by day and it's time to generate more money to afford household expenses. 

Now, Mukhtiar wants to buy more wooden raw materials for her husband for making furniture in order to expand the business. This is why she came to BRAC Pakistan and wishes to obtain a loan, so that her husband can buy raw materials for marking furniture. 

She hopes that this loan will prove beneficial and productive for the business as well as for the family. Mukhtiar thanks to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for this honorable support.

loans.use: help her husband in purchasing wooden raw material for making furniture.

loans.name: Rachide

texts.pt:
O senhor Rachide é segurança, tem 31 anos de idade,casado e pai de 05 filhos dos quais apenas vive com 01 ainda menor, sustenta 02 enteados que vivem com ele na casa própria.

Com o valor do credito irá  comprar açúcar, feijão ,amendoim, óleo, para reforçar o seu negócio que é feito no mercado local pela sua esposa.

Tem como planos para o futuro concluir a construção de sua casa, mobilar e crescer no negocio diversificando  os produtos como forma de satisfazer as necessidades de seus clientes.

Diz que irá honrar com o acordado no contrato do empréstimo no que se refere as datas de pagamento e solicitar mais para concretizar o seu plano.
texts.en:
Rachide is a security guard. He's 31 years old and married. He has five children, only one of whom is underage and lives with him. He supports two stepchildren who live with him in a house that he owns.

With the amount of the loan he'll purchase sugar, beans, peanuts and cooking oil. That way he'll stock the business that is run by his wife at the local market.

His plans for the future are to finish building his house, furnish it, and make his business grow by diversifying the merchandise as a way of meeting his customers' needs.

He states that he'll honor the loan agreement in terms of the scheduled repayments, and he'll apply for more loans in order to achieve his plan.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, beans, peanuts and cooking oil.

loans.name: Blanca Arely

texts.es: Blanca de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre, su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella posee una tienda desde hace 11 años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda terminando de construir el cuarto que muestra en la fotografía, pero como ya no tiene de suficiente capital por esa razón solicita a INETGRAL un crédito para la compra de todos los materiales de construcción como cemento, arena, ladrillos, hierro y pago de mano de obra para darle una vivienda segura y digna su familia.
texts.en:
Blanca is 40 years old and lives in her own home with her mother, her husband and their two children. She has had a store for 11 years and with what she gets from her sales she manages to pay for some of their household expenses. 

She wishes to improve her dwelling by finishing the construction of the room shown in the photograph, but as she doesn't now have sufficient capital for that purpose, she is requesting a loan from Integral for the purchase of all the construction materials, such as cement, sand, bricks and rebar, as well as to  pay for labor, so that she can provide secure and decent housing for her family.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand, bricks, rebar and pay for labor.

loans.name: El Buen Pastor Group

texts.es: Este es el nuevo grupo “El Buen Pastor”  conformada por 10 socios entusiastas. Este el caso de Ana de 44 años de edad separada con 02 hijos dependientes. Con los deseos de superarse Ana emprende el negocio de venta de ropas, la cual se viene desempeñando hace más de 17 años.  Con perseverancia y esfuerzo ha mejorado su vivienda. El crédito solicitado lo destinará para la compra de polos, blusas y pantalones.  Mejorar su negocio es su siguiente meta. El grupo “El Buen Pastor” está agradecido por la ayuda brindada. Ana  es la primera del lado derecho y viste polo color amarillo a cuadros.
texts.en:
This is the new group "El Buen Pastor", ["The Good Shepherd"] composed of 10 enthusiastic members. Ana is 44 years old, separated, with two dependent children. With the desire to improve, Ana takes on the business of clothing sales, which she has been doing for over 17 years. With perseverance and much effort, she has improved her home.

This loan will be used to purchase polo shirts, blouses, and pants. Improving her business is her next goal. The group "El Buen Pastor" is grateful for the support. Ana is the first from the right, standing, and wearing a yellow plaid polo.

loans.use: to buy polo shirts, blouses, and pants.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.pt:
De 45 anos, casada, máe de 05 filhos, dos quais 02 a estudarem no ensino primario, 03 ja maiores de idade a trabalharem, sustenta um primo que vive com ela na casa propria .
Com o valor irá comprar  acucar em sacos e embalagem , Cervejas , Bolachas, Refrescos, Vinho para sua barraca que esta na sua casa
 Tem planos de adquirir uma viatura para facilitar o seu negocio, crescer no negocio respondendo as necessidades de seus clientes.
Afirma que seu maior desafio e a  insuficiencia de fundos e para supera - los tem feito um pequeno xitique, ira pagar pontualmente e solicitar mais emprestimos .
texts.en:
Lidia is 45 years old and married. She has five children, two of whom attend primary school and three are already adults and in the workforce. She supports a cousin who lives with her in a house that she owns.
With the loan she'll purchase bags and packs of sugar, beer, crackers, refreshments, and wine for her stall located at her house.
She plans on buying a vehicle to facilitate her business. Another plan is to make her business grow by meeting her customers' needs.
She states that her biggest challenge is the lack of funds, and to overcome that she's been using a small rotating credit. She states that she'll repay the loan in a timely fashion and apply for more loans.

loans.use: to purchase bags and packs of sugar, beer, crackers, refreshments, and wine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase certified seeds and insecticides so as to get a better harvest and meet the demands of clients and his family needs.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with 2 children and all go to school. She takes care of one additional family member. 

She sells used shoes at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 5 years. She works seven days a week. 

She has requested for a loan of 300,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy a bale of used shoes. Her major challenge includes seasonality and transportation.

Her goal and aspiration is to build a permanent business premises. She lives in rented house and the family has no access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used shoes, so that eventually she can build her own home

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman with eight children, four of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of buyers taking too long to pay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity, but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mbeyu operates a grocery vegetables selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes and onions for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm tools and inputs to expand her agricultural sector

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm inputs and certified seeds for high production, to pay for her children's higher education.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is thankful that her recent loan has helped her so much in her business. Through the loan assistance amounting PHP 30,000, she was able to supply her store with more supplies. In result, she was able to gain increase in her profit which she used for supporting her family's needs. Because of this, she wants you to know that she really appreciate your kind hearts. 

She is asking again if you would allow her to borrow another PHP 45,000 for the maintenance of her business. She would use the said amount for purchasing more meat products such as beef, chicken, pork and vegetables to sell. She is confident that using the income she will get from the business, she will be able to cover their daily expenditures. In addition, Delia also has a water business where she gets additional income at hand.

As of now, she is looking forward to see her children become professionals someday and be successful in their lives. That's her only dream. This is the reason why she is working so hard to build them today for a better education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for beef, chicken, pork and vegetables to resell, to pay for her children's higher education

loans.name: Kanze

texts.en:
Kanze is a married woman. She has 6 children. She describes herself to be sincere. She operates a retail business where she sells flour, cooking oil, sugar, soap and other items. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a good area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. 

She will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy more stock of flour, sugar, cooking oil, soap and other items. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of flour, sugar, cooking oil, soap and other items

loans.name: Sumomei Group

texts.en: These members are part of the group called Sumomei, which consists of four members and has been operating for more than 15 years. They are from Teshie, Accra in Ghana and are selling groceries, kenkey (cooked corn paste) fried fish, fresh fish and cosmetics. Charlotte, the featured borrower of the group, is 41 years old and sells kenkey (cooked corn paste) and fried fish in a car station. Charlotte is married to a fisherman and they have two children. The members of the group have received two loans from ID Ghana previously and have repaid them on time. These loans have helped them improve their lives. Charlotte and her group are requesting a loan to purchase corn dough and firewood to prepare kenkey and other commodities. This loan will help Charlotte to buy more corn dough and firewood to prepare kenkey and fish to sell to customers.

loans.use: To buy more corn dough and firewood to  prepare kenkey and fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Usman Luka

texts.en: Usman Luka is a Babban Gona farmer from Mayere Madaki Dutse village. Usman Luka joined Babban Gona to improve the lives of his family and children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Usman Luka will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the average Nigerian farmer's yield. With Babban Gona's support and the opportunity to increase his yields and income, Usman Luka is confident that he will grow his farm and acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more supplies, such as fish, meats, seafood, rice, beans, fruits, juices, water, among other things.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
Soledad is deeply grateful for the loan that you extended to her recently. The assistance that you gave has greatly helped her in business operations. Through the PHP 50,000 loan, she was able to acquire more quantity of supplies and clothing products resulting in a higher income at a hand. 

Wanting and dreaming enough to expand her business, this time, she wants to ask again for another PHP 50,000 to buy additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business. This will become great ease for her and for her family if she utilizes the amount wisely. 

Anyhow, she would like to say her thanks for being kind and considerate. You are indeed a great help for the realization of her dreams. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a single man. He operates a retail business where he sells body lotions, soap, hair food and other products. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a marketable place and his primary customers are regular. He describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. 

He will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stock of  body lotions, soap, hair food and other products. He hopes that in the future, he will have a big business. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of  body lotions, soap, hair food and other products

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline is a married woman. She has one child. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a marketable place and her primary customers are regular. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. Her business goal is to own a boutique within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Jason

texts.en:
Jason has faithfully paid back his previous loan, which he used for his business. He has been operating his own computer shop for several years, and his earnings from this are good. Having a bigger family requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for his two children. He had to work hard, with the determination to have a better income, to provide his children with a better education. 

To improve sales, Jason would like to apply for a new loan to buy additional computers, spare parts and supplies. With 50,000 PHP, he could already start to improve his business. He sincerely lets you know his heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Jason hopes to improve the general living conditions of his family and expand his business. As of now, he wants to dedicate more of his time for the Lord and understand His word more deeply. He meets every week with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional computers, spare parts and supplies.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Seeing a brighter future ahead, Eugenia is more than thankful to you for sharing your blessings with her. With the recent PHP 15,000 that you extended to her, she was able to add up the supplies of merchandise products for her store. In result, she had an opportunity to gain higher income than usual. 

With this, she would like to avail another PHP 15,000 loan that she will use to purchase more products like biscuits for repacking. Your kindness and generosity will definitely help Eugenia support her family through the higher cost of profit she will acquire from the inventory. 

She wishes someday to have her own store for her business. She is also striving now for her youngest child's education. You can now have her dream come true as you help her through this loan assistance. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy more quantities of biscuits for repackaging and selling.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a married woman who is staying with her husband and two children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past six years, she has operated a charcoal-selling business. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. 

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a single man. He operates a retail business where he repairs electronics. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a marketable place and his primary customers are regular. He describes his biggest business challenge to be power outages. 

He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy electronic spare parts and other repair tools. His business goal is to he will have a big shop for electronics within 5 years. 

This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to open another business outlet.

loans.use: to buy electronic spare parts and other repair tools. He hopes to have a big shop eventually

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Having been granted a loan worth PHP 20,000 previously, Leila just wants to extend her gratitude to those who have willingly supported her through the loan assistance. This has greatly helped her in assisting her family in providing for the daily necessities and expenses. 

To further improve business, she would like to take out again another loan amounting to PHP 25,000. She is sure that through this amount, she will be able to buy more clothing products, like ready-to-wear clothes enough for garnering more sales and income. However, aside from this inventory, she also runs a food stall where she gains additional income. 

She is very optimistic that someday all her dreams would come true. In due time in the future, she will see her business expanding and more blessings will come. 

Today, she is praying for more strength from God to surpass all challenges.  She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

-------------------------------------

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food stall business and purchase items of clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase his revolving fund needed in his business that he is using to buy recyclable materials from customers.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with one kid, who is still young to attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Fatuma operates a grocery vegetables selling stall at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes and onions for resale.

loans.name: A/casis Daahir

texts.en:
A/Casis is 27-years-old and he lives in Hargiesa. He finished his University in 2012 and he studied MIS. 

A/casis is recently married but does not yet have any children. He works in his own photocopying and shop businesses.

He needs to expand his business and he requested a loan of $1000 from Kaaba and now he is on the wait list. Kaaba will provide the goods as a loan, and A/Casis will then make monthly repayments. 

In the future A/Casis wants to expand his shop to store.

loans.use: To expand his shop and photocopying business

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina  is a single woman and has been running her own beauty parlor in her street. She is doing her job passionately; she knows the techniques of makeup and hair design and serves her customers by providing bangles, jewelry etc. She is a well-known beautician in her town. She has slowly but surely improved her business through the support of Kashf Foundation. 

Now she has requested a loan of 45000 PKR  to buy more beauty products for her beauty parlor, including lotions, makeup kits and lightening creams to cater to a large number of customers efficiently to earn good amount of income for bearing her everyday expenditures.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products for her beauty parlor, including lotions, makeup kits and lightening creams to cater to a large number of customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of rice, sugar, cereals and other items for sale in his shop

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is a single woman, with 1 child. She describes herself to be humble. She operates a retail business where she sells flour, cereals, soap, sugar and other household items. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a good area for business and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. 

She will use the Kes 120,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, soap, cereals and other items. Her business goal is to have a big and successful business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be prosperous. 

This is her sixth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully. she will use the anticipated profits to meet her family needs.

loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, flour, soap, cereals and other items

loans.name: Naheed

texts.en:
Naheed  is 36 years old and is a single woman.  She deals in the business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 35000  to purchase more animals to inflate her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a 35 years old, married woman. She is a mother of 3 children. She has been doing a business of animal sale and purchase for many years. She is keen to provide her family with the better standard of living. 

Now, she has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount  to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. She desires to improving her standard of living thorough all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market, to improve her family's standard of living

loans.name: Shabeena

texts.en:
Shabeena is a 37 years old married woman and a mother of 9 children. In order to support her husband in taking care of the family she began the business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. 

She has requested for a loan of 45000 PKR  to purchase another buffalo to improv her sales by generating more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales by generating more income from milk sales

loans.name: Sobia

texts.en:
Sobia is a 26 years old, married woman doing a business of animals’ purchase and sale with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is the mother of 2 children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. 

She has requested a loan of 30000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers and generate more revenue

loans.name: Oscar Cayetano

texts.es:
Oscar, está solicitando un nuevo crédito para tener todo listo cuando llegue el momento de sembrar nuevamente, comprara abono, insecticidas, herbicidas y semilla de maíz para continuar trabajando en la agricultura, alimentando a su familia y cancelando sus deudas.
El financiamiento anterior le ha servido para que sus cosechas sean más abundantes permitiéndole tener ingresos estables y mejores condiciones de vida familiar.
texts.en: Oscar is requesting a new loan so that he can have everything ready when it is time to seed again. He will buy manure, insecticides, herbicides, and corn seeds to continue working in agriculture, feeding his family and paying off his debts. The last loan served him to have more abundant crops allowing him to have a stable income and better conditions in his family life.

loans.use: To buy manure, insecticides, herbicides, and corn seeds to continue working in agriculture.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is 29 years old; she is a married woman. She has a business selling animals. She buys baby goats and calves at low prices, raises them and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate extra income. 

Asia needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more animals to increase her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and raise her income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cereals and condiments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair the fishing boat, because it is their indispensable working tool.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 23 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la reparación y venta de accesorios para bicicletas desde hace 8 años, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por su buen trabajo, el joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de llantas, cadenas, parches, pedales, etc. todo por mayor y así poder seguir ayudando en su casa con los gastos y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The young man whose face is blurred is 23 years old and lives in a high-risk area. He has been repairing and selling bicycle accessories for 8 years, and his business is located in his home.  He has many customers because of his good work. He lives in his own home with his family. 

He is requesting a loan in order to buy tires, chains, patches, pedals, etc. at wholesale, so that he can continue helping with the household expenses and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy tires, chains, patches, pedals, etc. at wholesale.

loans.name: Faysa Jibril

texts.en:
Faysa is 35 years old and lives in Hargeisa City, Somalia. She is married and has 4 children. For the past 2 years she has been working hard to manage her pharmacy and cold drinks market.

To help expand her pharmacy and market, Faysa has requested a loan of $1,000 USD. She will use the loan to buy more medication and cold drinks, which will help not only increase her working capital but also generate greater profits. 

In the future, Faysa will be able to either open up another branch or expand her existing pharmacy and cold drinks market.

loans.use: to purchase more medication and cold drinks for her pharmacy and market.

loans.name: Santos Felicito

texts.es:
Santos, de 27 años de edad, no estudio, se casó cuando tenía 19 años de edad, tienen dos hijos, uno estudia en la comunidad y el otro no estudia, su compañera de vida trabaja en los oficios domésticos y cuida de sus hijos, mientras el sale a trabajar a tempranas horas de la mañana.

Santos, trabaja en la agricultura desde pequeño, este trabajo lo aprendió gracias a un programa que desarrollo la comunidad hace algún tiempo, actualmente trabaja en la siembra de hortalizas como pepino, tomate y chile; de esa manera garantiza su alimentación diaria y la de su familia.- Además, trabaja en las fincas de café que cultivan en la zona.

El crédito que Santos, está solicitando le ayudará para comprar fertilizantes, foliares, entre otros para sembrar maíz y frijoles, de esa manera podrá obtener una buena cosecha y pagar el alquiler de la tierra donde sembrará.

Santos, sueña con poder seguir ayudando a sus hijos en sus estudios y que puedan terminarlos satisfactoriamente, además sueña con construir un invernadero artesanal, para cultivar sus hortalizas.
texts.en:
Santos is 27 years old, and didn’t go to school. He married when he was 19 years old, and has two children. One of them goes to school in the community and the other isn’t in school. His life partner takes care of the household chores and their children while he goes out to work in the early hours of the morning.  

Santos has been working in agriculture since he was a boy. He learned this work thanks to a program developed by his community some time ago. Currently, he is growing vegetables such as cucumbers, tomatoes and peppers. In this way he ensures his family’s daily sustenance. In addition, he works on the coffee farms that grow in the area.

The loan Santos is asking for will help him to buy fertilizers and leaf treatment products, among others for planting corn and beans. In this way he can ensure a good harvest and pay the rent for the plot of land he will cultivate. 

Santos dreams of continuing to help his children in their studies, and that they can finish in a satisfactory manner. He also dreams of building his own greenhouse to raise his vegetables.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and leaf treatment products, among others for planting corn and beans.

loans.name: Reshma

texts.en:
Reshma is a 53-year-old, married mother of 7 children. She has been running an animal buy-and-sell business for many years with the support of her husband, who is also shown in the photo. 

Reshma is motivated to provide her family with the basic necessities of life. Now, she has requested a loan of 60,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan to purchase more cattle to resell in the market. 

Reshma hopes to improve her standard of living through all of her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to resell in the market.

loans.name: Gulmirahon

texts.ru: Гулмирахон, 30 лет, замужем. Имеет 3 детей школьного и дошкольного возраста, живет с родителями супруга. У Гулмирахон среднее образование, она шьет вещи на заказ (платья, пальто), также занимается сельским хозяйством. Она успешный фермер своего небольшого хозяйства, в котором у нее имеется: 20 овец. Также у нее есть 0,95 Га поливной земли, где Гулмирахон выращивает картофель, пшеницу для реализации. Бизнес Гулмирахон на сегодняшний день приносит ежемесячную прибыль в размере около 20,000 сом (KGS). Она решила обратиться в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 6 овец, кукурузу и жмыха в качестве корма для скота. Она хочет и дальше увеличивать поголовье скота.
texts.en: Gulmirahon is 30 years old and married. She has 3 school- and preschool-age children and lives with her husband's parents. Gulmirahon has a secondary education. She sews clothing (dresses, coats) to order and is also involved in agriculture. She is a successful farmer on her small farm that contains 20 sheep. She also has 0.95 hectares of irrigated land, where Gulmirahon grows potatoes and wheat for sale. Today Gulmirahon's business yields a monthly profit in the amount of about 20,000 som (KGS). She decided to request a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to buy 6 sheep, corn and livestock feed. She wants to continue increasing her livestock headcount.

loans.use: to buy 6 sheep, corn and livestock feed

loans.name: Lal  Khaton

texts.en:
Lal Khaton is a 51-year-old widow who has been running her milk sales business for many years to support her family. She sells the milk from her buffalos to customers in her area. 

Lal Khaton has 4 children, and her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. 

Lal Khaton has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation in the past. But now she is requesting a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase an additional buffalo to increase both milk production and sales. She wants to earn a good income so she can fulfill her dream of providing her children with better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase an additional buffalo and increase her milk production and sales.

loans.name: Emmaculate

texts.en:
Emmaculate is a married mother of 3 children. She describes herself as loyal. She operates a retail business where she sells beauty salon products. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. 

Emmaculate's business is located in an area with potential, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. She will use her 30,000 KES loan to buy more inventory of beauty products. 

Emmaculate's business goal is to have increased sales within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will have a stable business. 

This is Emmaculate's fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more inventory of beauty products.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is a 49-year-old married woman. She works in hand embroidery, and she makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are very much in demand, and she has managed to build a clientele whose business allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

To help her to continue her operations, Sajida has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy packets of beads, sequins, and stones for decoration, as well as spools of thread in different colors. The additional supplies will allow her to consistently cater to more customers. 

She hopes to increase her income by targeting more customers. She both dreams for a bright future and desires to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy packets of beads, sequins, and stones for decoration, as well as spools of thread in different colors.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 44 ans, Afi est une femme mère de trois enfants. Afi habite à Adamavo et vend des produits d’alimentations générales dans son cafétéria afin de gagner sa rentabilité. Pour arriver à ses fins, Afi s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché local. Pour commander des bidons d’huile, des bols de farine et d’arachide, Afi demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et disposer d’un revenu afin d’aider son mari dans l’éducation de leurs enfants.
texts.en:
Afi is 44 years old, married and mother to three children.  She lives in Adamovo and earns her living by selling general foodstuffs in her shop.  

She buys new supplies four times a month from the local market.  This loan will buy drums of oil, bowls of flour and peanuts.  Afi's earnings help her husband provide for the education of their children.

loans.use: to buy 2 drums of oil, 20 bowls of flour and 2 of peanuts for resale.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Agée de 56 ans, Ablavi  est une femme mariée et mère de cinq enfants. Pour exercer ses activités, Ablavi vit à Adamavo et vend de la pâte bandée dans son quartier pour ainsi gagner son revenu. Ablavi s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché local. Pour commander des sacs de maïs, Ablavi demande ce crédit pour réaliser son achat et trouver le gain nécessaire pour aider son mari à soutenir les charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Ablavi is 56 years old, married and mother to five children.  She lives in Adamovo and earns her living selling maize mash in her neighbourhood.

She buys new supplies once a month from the local market.  Her loan will buy sacks of maize and Ablavi will use her profits to help her husband provide for the expenses of their family.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of maize for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Akoua

texts.fr: Akoua une femme de 27ans a 01 enfant de 04ans en charge. Son conjoint est dans le domaine de l'informatique. Elle est revendeuse de produits d'alimentation générale  et s'y plait bien dans son activité. Son second prêt l'aidera à acheter des marchandises pour répondre aux besoins des clients. Elle souhaite assurer le bien être de la famille et avoir une meilleure activité.
texts.en:
Akoua is 27 years old and has a four-year-old child.  Her husband works in computing and Akoua is happy selling general foodstuffs.  

This will be her second loan and it will buy food to satisfy the demands of Akoua's customers.

Akoua would like to provide for the well-being of her family and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy general foodstuffs for resale.

loans.name: Ayélé

texts.fr: Ayélé vit à Adamavo et est âgée de 33 ans. Mariée, Ayélé est mère de trois enfants et œuvre dynamiquement pour favoriser leur éducation. Ayélé vend de la bouillie accompagnée de beignets pour avoir son revenu pour leur subsistance. Ayélé s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Pour commander quelque sac de farine de blé et de maïs pour préparer la bouillie, Ayélé demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et tirer sa rentabilité nécessaire.
texts.en:
Ayélé is 33 years old, married and mother to three children.  She lives in Adamovo and works hard to provide for the education of her children.  She earns her living selling maize porridge and fritters.

She buys new supplies once a month from the market.  Her loan will buy some sacks of wheatflour and maize to prepare food for sale.

loans.use: to buy 1 sack of maize and 1 sack of wheatflour for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Sabira

texts.ru: Сабира, 48 лет, замужем, 4 детей. Сабира ведет свой бизнес. Стартовав в 20 лет назад с суммы в 30,000 сомов (KGS), благодаря упорному труду Сабиры, в хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы, а также земельная доля размером 0,41 ГА, на которой он ежегодно выращивает картофель. Ежемесячный доход составляет до 17,000 сомов (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Сабира обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 коров для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Сабира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и постройку дома.
texts.en: Sabira is 48 years old, married and has 4 children. Sabira runs her own business. Having started the business 20 years ago with 30,000 som (KGS), thanks to Sabira's hard work, today she has 2 cows and 0.41 hectares of land, where she annually grows potatoes. Her monthly income amounts up to 17,000 som (KGS). To continue developing her business, Sabira requested a loan in the amount of 70,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to buy 2 cows for fattening up and resale. Sabira plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing her livestock headcount and building a house.

loans.use: to buy two cows for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cereals, meat and other food ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en: Azra is a 46-year-old woman who has been running a school for many years. There are over 170 students enrolled in her school, more than half of whom are girls. She believes that girls should be placed on an equal footing with boys from an early age, and education is one way this can be achieved. She wants all her students to have the opportunity to follow their dreams, and she wants to give them a good education to help them be successful. She requires a loan of PKR 110,000 to build a computer lab in her school.

loans.use: to build a computer lab in her school.

loans.name: Saki

texts.en:
Saki is a single woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is household consumables.

For the past six years, she has operated a business weaving mats for sale, selling door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding and establishing a poultry business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase paints and sewing materials. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase paints and sewing materials

loans.name: Iliya

texts.en: Iliya is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Iliya joined Babban Gona to improve the life of his family. Prior to joining Babban Gona, Iliya had faced difficulties in paying for his children's education due to insufficient income. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Iliya will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the average Nigerian farmer's yield. This will increase his income considerably. With Babban Gona's continued support, Iliya has grand plans to grow his farm and acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs  that will increase his yields

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm tools and implements for farming

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es:
Concepción, de 74 años de edad, creció juntos a sus padres, quienes le apoyaron en sus estudios para que pudiera graduarse como enfermera, no se casó, pero tuvo cuatro hijos, todos tienen sus propios hogares, dos de ellos están en Estados Unidos y los otros dos residen en El Salvador.

Concepción, trabajó 34 años de enfermera, luego se jubiló y actualmente se dedica a la crianza de especies menores y a la agricultura, pues necesita siempre tener ingresos económicos en su hogar, para cubrir las necesidades que se le presente.

Concepción, está solicitando el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas, para el cultivo de maíz y frijol y el resto para donarlo a la iglesia de la comunidad. 

Ella, sueña con apoyar a sus dos nietos en sus estudios y también poder hacer crecer su negocio de crianza de pollos de engorde e iniciar la crianza de cerdos.
texts.en:
Concepción is 74 years old and grew up with her parents who supported her education so that she could become a nurse. Concepción never married but had four children. All now have their own homes; two are in the United States while the other two still live in El Salvador.

Concepción spent 34 years working as a nurse. She then retired and now makes a living breeding small animals and in farming as she needs an income for her household in order to cover expenses.

Concepción is applying for a loan in order to buy farming supplies to grow crops and beans, and to donate to the remainder to the local church.

Concepción dreams of supporting her two grandchildren with their education and of expanding her chicken-breeding business. She would also like to start raising pigs.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies to grow crops and beans, and to donate to the remainder to the local church.

loans.name: Oscar Alberto

texts.es:
Oscar de 30 años de edad, pudo estudiar hasta 5° grado de educación básica, está acompañado y tiene dos hijos que dependen de él.
	
Oscar se dedica a la pesca artesanal desde hace muchos años, con el correr del tiempo ha venido adquiriendo experiencia, lo cual le ha ayudado a generar ingresos a su pequeño hogar,  después de que él saca el pescado lo vende en el mercado municipal de su comunidad.

Él necesita el crédito para comprar pintura para su lancha y mejorarla, también para comprar redes.

Él espera que su negocio sea más rentable para cubrir las necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
Oscar is 30 years old.  He was able to study until 5th grade. He is married and has two children that depend on him.

For many years, Oscar has earned a living in artisanal fishing. Over time he has gained experience which has helped him to earn an income for his small home. He sells what he catches in the local market of his community.

He needs a loan to buy paint for his boat and to improve it and also to buy nets.

He hopes that his business will be more profitable in order to cover his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy paint for his boat and to improve it and also to buy nets.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor, se dedica a  vender en su pick up diferentes productos como: agua, golosinas, gaseosas, etc., anteriormente laboraba como ayudante en un car wash, buscando la manera de tener mejores ingresos decidió tener su propio negocio, su horario de trabajo es de seis de la mañana a cinco de la tarde, sus productos los vende al mayoreo en todo el oriente del departamento.
Comprará jugos,  gaseosas, jugos, agua, golosinas, etc., al mayoreo para poder distribuir su mercadería en las tiendas de la zona, surtirá el inventario de su negocio para atender las necesidades de los clientes, aumentar sus ventas e ingresos.
Sueña con trabajar con capital propio, ampliar su negocio, tener nuevos clientes y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Victor earns a living selling different products from his pick up truck such as: water, sweets, etc. He used to work as a car wash assistant but he decided to start his own business to improve his income. He works from 6 in the morning until 5 in the afternoon. He sells his products in bulk throughout the east of the region.

He will buy juice, soft drinks, water, sweets, etc., in bulk in order to be able to distribute his merchandise in the shops of the area. He will stock up his inventory in order to meet the needs of his customers and increase his sales and income.
He dreams of working with his own capital, expanding his business, having new customers and getting ahead in life with his family.

loans.use: to buy juices, sot drinks, water, sweets, etc., in bulk in order to sell his products in shops in the area.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María, es propietaria de un taller de sastrería, su negocio está funcionando aproximadamente desde hace 16 años, lo realiza para cubrir las necesidades de su familia, ella vive con su compañero de vida y dos hijos.
Está buscando apoyo con un crédito para comprar zippers, hilos, telas, botones, etc., para finalizar las prendas de vestir que le han encargado sus clientes, con la inversión espera continuar trabajando para que a su familia no les falte el alimento diario y cancelar con buena calificación su crédito.
Sus aspiraciones son lograr comprar una máquina de coser, terminar de pagar su vivienda y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
María owns a sewing workshop. Her business has been going for around 16 years. She does this to meet the needs of her family. She lives with her partner and her two children.

She is looking for support with a loan in order to buy zippers, thread, fabric, buttons, etc., in order to finish clothes that her customers have ordered from her. With this investment she hopes to continue to work so that her family have food to eat everyday and to pay her debt back well.
She hopes to be able to buy a sewing machine, finish paying for her home and expand her business.
