loans.use: to buy zippers, thread, fabric, buttons, etc., to finish clothes that her customers have commissioned from her.

loans.name: Natividad De Jesús

texts.es: En su taller de confecciones con una amplia experiencia de 28 años de funcionamiento, Natividad diseña prendas a la vanguardia con excelentes acabados y calidad.  Su idea de negocio surgió a raíz de tener una familia muy numerosa, lo que le exigía generar ingresos para ayudar al sustento de su hogar.  Como tenía habilidades para confeccionar,  desde la comodidad de su hogar adecuó un espacio para poner en marcha su negocio,  con el beneficio de no descuidar las otras labores del día a día.  Su vivienda está ubicada en un barrio del municipio de Barranquilla y sus principales clientes son vecinos, amigos y familiares a quienes les confecciona blusas, pantalones, vestidos y hasta uniformes de colegios. Natividad tiene 63 años de edad y es madre de tres hijos de 43, 36 y 34 años y una hija de 41 años de edad, a quienes educo con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación, hoy en día desea continuar trabajando para independizar el negocio de su casa, con la finalidad de estar en un espacio más adecuado.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en la compra de una maquina plana y telas, hilo, agujas, entre otros.  Esta inversión genera mejoras en los diseños y con ello la satisfacción del cliente
texts.en:
In her sewing shop, where she has 28 years' of vast experience, Natividad designs avant garde clothing with excellent finishes and quality.  Her idea for a business was the result of having a very big family which required her to generate an income to help support the household.  Since she had the ability to sew, she set up a space in the comfort of her own home to start her business, with the advantage of being able to attend to the other daily chores.

Her home is located in a neighborhood of Barranquilla and her main customers are neighbors, friends and relatives for whom she makes blouses, pants, dresses and even school uniforms.  

Natividad is 63 years old and has three sons, ages 43, 36 and 34, and a daughter, age 41.  She has educated them with much effort and dedication.  Now she wants to continue working to separate her business from her house so she can have a more proper space.  She is currently applying for a CrediKiva loan, her first through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, to buy an overlock sewing machine, fabrics thread, needles, etc.  The investment will make improvements in her designs as well as in customer satisfaction.

loans.use: To buy an overlock machine, fabrics, needles, etc.

loans.name: Elvira Elizabeth

texts.es: Elvira de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella trabaja como empleada en una empresa privada desde hace 3 años, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda cambiando el piso entre otras cosas pero como no tiene suficiente capital está solicitando un crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción como cemento, arena, cerámica, entre otras cosas para poderle dar a su familia una vivienda más digna.
texts.en: Elvira, 35, lives in her own house with her husband and son.  She has been working for a private company for three years.  Elvira wants to remodel her home by changing the flooring.  Since she does not have enough money for the project, she is requesting a loan to buy construction materials such as cement, sand, tiles, etc. in order to give her family a more dignified living space.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand, tiles, etc.

loans.name: Sonia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Sonia, se ha decidido por un nuevo crédito por la facilidad de pago que le ofrece la institución, en esta oportunidad comprara ropa interior, blusas, faldas, pantalones, vestidos, etc., renovara su inventario para mantener a sus clientes satisfechos.
Al invertir el préstamo anterior en su negocio de venta de ropa y tortillas sus utilidades son mayores y está cumpliendo con sus compromisos.
texts.en:
Sonia has decided to request a new loan because of the easy payment terms offered by the institution.  On this occasion she will buy lingerie, blouses, skirts, pants, dresses, etc. to renovate her inventory and keep customers satisfied.

By investing her previous loan in her clothing and tortilla businesses she is earning more profit and meeting her commitments.

loans.use: To buy lingerie, blouses, skirts, pants, dresses, etc. to renovate her stock and keep customers satisfied.

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es:
María de 36 años de edad,  es madre soltera de un niño que estudia 2° grado en la escuela, vive junto a su madre y dos hermanas más. 
 
María se dedica a la venta y elaboración de pupusas, lo hace todos los fines de semana y el resto de días lava y plancha ajeno, esto lo ha hecho por más de 15 años pues no ha podido lograr mejores oportunidades de trabajo.

Este crédito le servirá a María para comprar maíz, quesillo, chicharrón, frijoles y aceite y gas para la elaboración de pupusas.  
 
Ella sueña con sacar adelante a su hijo apoyarlo hasta que sea profesional y  exitoso.
texts.en:
Maria, 36, is a single mother with a son in second grade.  She lives with her mother and two sisters.

Maria makes and sells pupusas (stuffed tortillas) every weekend and the rest of the week she takes in laundry and ironing.  She has been in business for 15 years because she has not had better job opportunities.

This loan will allow Maria to buy corn, cheese, pork, beans, oil and gas to make pupusas.  She dreams of being able to support her son until he becomes a successful professional.

loans.use: To buy corn, cheese, pork, beans, oil and gas to make pupusas.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es: Leonor es una mujer emprendedora, goza de la compañía de su gran familia conformada por su esposo Guillermo y sus 4 hijos. Leonor se dedica a la cría de animales de granja y a la agricultura eventualmente, dependiendo de que sea una buena temporada para que su cultivo este en optimas condiciones climáticas. Actualmente desea sembrar lechuga orgánica, desea el micro crédito para poder comprar realizar la siembra y comprar fertilizantes orgánicos que ayuden a obtener una lechuga de calidad. En el futuro espera poder darles a sus hijos una buena educación y que estos sean grandes profesionales de ingeniería.
texts.en:
Leonor is an enterprising woman who enjoys the company of her large family, consisting of her husband Guillermo and their four children.  Leonor raises farm animals and works in agriculture from time to time, depending on whether or not it is a good crop season.

She now wants to plant organic lettuce and is requesting a loan to buy organic fertilizers to produce quality lettuce.  In the future she hopes to give her children a good education so they can become successful engineers.

loans.use: To plant organic lettuce.

loans.name: Utulivu B Group

texts.fr: Bisente est commerçante, membre de la banque communautaire «Utulivu B», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un chômeur, âgée de35 ans, mère 7 enfants dont 1 étudie et 6 n’étudient plus manque de moyen financier. Elle commença son business avec de fonds  reçu de ses parents. Elle est vendeuse de la boisson locale (Mandale) dans le bidonville depuis son jeune âge. Elle va s’approvisionner en ingrédients pour brasser sa boisson (maïs, soja, farine de manioc, bois de chauffe, etc.). Elle compte construire sa maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Bisente is a storekeeper, member of the community bank "Utulivu B", client of IMF Hekima and married to an unemployed man.  She is 35 years old and is the mother of 7 children; 1 is in school but the other 6 are not because of a lack of money.  She started her business with funds received from her parents.  She has been selling a local drink (Mandale) in the town since she was young.  She will stock her ingredients to mix her drink (corn, soy, manioc flour, firewood etc.). She hopes to build her house, send her kids to school and feed them.  To finish, she thanks Hekima for the support that they bring to entrepreneurs who cannot get loans at banks.

loans.use: to stock ingredients for making a local drink (corn, soy, manioc flour, firewood)

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, certified seeds, herbicides and insecticides to have a better harvest, thus to support her family

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
Irine is a creative and hard-working young woman who is dedicated to her family. Anyone watching her at work will admire her for the determination and dedication that she puts into each one of her tasks. Farming has been the key to her success. Nandihills is a rain-fed area popularly known for maize, tea and dairy farming. 

With the help of her beloved husband, Irine runs a successful rural enterprise, capitalizing on her small piece of land. The farm consists of her home, a cow, poultry, and trees. Irine is planning to grow her farm business, but the only way she can do this is having to purchase more land. 

Irine is kindly seeking a loan to purchase more land. Through the loan she will be able to plant more different crops which will result in more income. Money generated from the increased sales in farm products will be used to settle the loan debt and pay part of their children's education expenses. 

Irine's vision is to provide for her family and to meet their needs as best as she can.

loans.use: To purchase land to expand her farm to make funds for her children's education

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos, de 35 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado en la escuela de la comunidad, creció trabajando junto a sus padres, luego se casó y tiene 3 hijos, su esposa le ayuda en la administración de una tienda  y también se encarga de los oficios domésticos. 

Carlos, trabaja como ayudante de albañil y también trabaja en la agricultura sembrando maíz y frijol, con esto garantiza su alimentación y la de su familia.- También tiene una tienda de productos de primera necesidad, donde vende todos los días de la semana sin horario establecido.

El crédito que está solicitando es para comprar fertilizantes, abonos y otros productos para la preparación de la tierra, con esto garantizará obtener una buena cosecha y poder seguir generando ingresos para su familia.

El sueño de Carlos, es poder apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios, para que puedan graduarse y ser unas personas de bien en la sociedad, también sueña con mejorar su vivienda y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carlos is 35 years old. He went to school up to the second grade in a community school. He grew up working with his parents and later he married and had three children. He wife helps him by running a store and also by taking care of the housework. 

Carlos works as an assistant bricklayer and also in agriculture, growing corn and beans. With this, he can guarantee that he and his family are fed. He also has store that sells staple products. It is open every day of the week with no set schedule.  

The loan he is asking for is to buy fertilizer, compost and other products to prepare the soil. With this, he will guarantee a good harvest and be able to continue earning income for his family. 

Carlos' dream is to be able to help his children with their education so that they can graduate and be upright members of society. He also dreams of improving his home and giving his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, compost and other products to prepare the soil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve his workshop business by equipping it with the necessary machines

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a cow for milk production and meet the demands of customers in his region.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac lives on a hilltop in Chuka, Kenya with his beautiful wife and their five children.  Thanks to the income he earns through practicing mixed farming he has been able to support his family. Isaac passionately loves poultry farming. 

Because of his immense farming knowledge, he wants to start keeping dairy goats. He is kindly seeking a loan to buy good quality breeds of dairy goats. Goat farming is one of the easiest types of dairy farming, and therefore good for farmers in Chuka. Goats do not require one to own a lot of land to rear them, and they are less expensive to buy as compared to cattle. He believes that through the loan he will get dairy milk, which has a ready market and will translate to improved income levels. 

Through the loan he will also benefit from goat skin that he will sell to the industry that deals with hides and skin. Through the loan he will be able to improve his living conditions and be able to secure the future of his children. 

Having gone through training with Juhudi Kilimo, he is confident that the skills he acquired will help him increase his business and enable him to pay back the loan. Isaac is confident that if you invest in his dream, you will be impacting the life of his family and children.

loans.use: To buy some dairy goats in order to expand his farming activities for the betterment of his family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve his sugarcane growing for high production and also to improve his family's health care

loans.name: Frank

texts.en:
Frank is a final year student at the University of Cape Coast and studying for a Bsc in Marketing. The loan is to help pay for his school fees.

His parents have always been his source of inspiration since childhood because they never gave up in their  quest to offer a better future for his younger siblings and himself to acquire skills that would help them become self reliant.  Marketing cuts across all facets of life and it teaches you new things and he is the kind who loves to challenge himself to new ideas everyday thus choosing this profession.

He desires to be a marketing consultant in the next five to ten years to come.  Without the help of this loan he would have to defer his program to next year which would sadden him a lot.

“Education is the key to success so everybody should pursue the cause and all should endeavor to help support students whenever necessary”, he says.

loans.use: To pay his final year tuition fees for a degree in marketing, which will enable him to be self reliant

loans.name: Juventina

texts.es:
Juventina, es casada, tiene dos hijos y la familia vive junta, para tener más recursos económicos familiares desde hace 7 años se dedica a vender productos de revista y variedad de ropa, el oficio se lo enseño una amiga, su negocio ha ido progresando por el buen uso de las ganancias y excelente servicio que brinda a sus clientes, sus labores las realiza de ocho de la mañana a cinco de la tarde.
Necesita ofrecer una amplia variedad de productos por lo que está solicitando un crédito para comprar lociones, cremas corporales, mascarillas, labiales, rubores, etc., tendrá nueva mercadería para tener un negocio competitivo, pretende aumentar su clientela, las ventas y ganancias.
Sus aspiraciones son contribuir a que su familia tenga una vida más confortable y cancelar sus deudas.
texts.en:
Juventina is married and has two children. The family lives together. In order to have more family resources she has been selling catalogue products and a variety of clothing for 7 years. She was taught the trade by a friend. Her business has progressed because she has used her profits well and gives her customers excellent service. She works from eight in the morning until five in the afternoon. 

She needs to offer a wide variety of products and that is why she is asking for a loan to buy lotions, body creams, masks, lipsticks, blushes, etc. She will have new merchandise to have a competitive business. She intends on increasing her clientele, sales and earnings. She aspires to contributing to her family having a more comfortable life and to pay paying off her debt.

loans.use: to buy lotions, body creams, masks, lipsticks, blushes, etc., to have new merchandise for a competitive business.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Julio de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, el se dedica al cultivo  de maíz y maicillo desde hace 15 años, vende sus productos a los comerciantes que están en el mercado municipal, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, entre otras cosas para poder tener una buena producción y asi tener mejores ganancias para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Julio is 41 years old and he lives in his own home with his wife and child. He has grown corn and sorghum for 15 years. He sells his products to the merchants who are in the municipal market. With what he obtains from his sales, he is able to pay for some household expenses. He is asking for a loan to buy agricultural materials such as fertilizer, compost, pest control and more. This will make him able to have good production and thus better earnings for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural materials such a fertilizer, compost, pest control, and more.

loans.name: Magna Jeaneth

texts.es: Magna de 32 años de edad vive en casa con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica  a la siembra maíz y frijol, tiene 6 años de experiencia inicio su actividad con capital propio, vende sus productos a los comerciantes que vende cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias logra solventar los  gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, semillas, pesticidas, entre otros y también para el pago de alquiler de la parcela ya que no cuenta con una propia y así poder seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Magna, 32, lives in a house with her family. She grows beans and corn and has a 6-year experience. She started this business with her own money. She sells her products to local businesspeople. With the profits she makes, she manages to cover the home expenses.

Magna is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides, herbicides, and seeds, among other things, and to pay the rent of the land where she works, since she does not have land of her own. This will help her to continue working and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides, herbicides, seeds, and pay the rent of the land she works.

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es: Carlos de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus cuatro hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos y jocotes en el cual es ayudado por sus dos hijos mayores, tiene 28 años de experiencia el cual inicio con capital propio, cliente saca sus cosechas de diciembre a marzo y los vende en los mercados que están cerca de su casa, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía para poder seguir con sus cultivos y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Carlos is 49 years old. He lives in his home with his four children. He grows basic grains and jocotes and is helped by his two oldest children. He has 28 years' experience and started with his own capital. He harvests from December to March and sells in the markets that are close to his house. He is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, compost, and pest control to improve the land shown in the photograph so he can continue with his crops and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, compost, pest control, and improve the land.

loans.name: Varisto

texts.en:
Varisto is a married man who lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. He sells produce and supplements his income with livestock rearing and crop growing. 

With this, he has been able to earn some income to sustain his family. His plan is to grow his business into wholesale. He however has a challenge of price fluctuation of agricultural produce.

He is asking for a loan to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell and become a wholesaler

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, certified seeds, herbicides and insecticides, to improve yield with better profit

loans.name: Galaciano

texts.en: Galaciano is 27 years old with two children, 6 and 3, living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He deals in general merchandise which he supplements with the proceeds from a hair cutting salon. He started this business to enable him to look after his family. His business dream is to expand his business into new markets and open up other outlets in the nearby centers despite the challenge of bad debtors and price fluctuation. Galaciano has asked for a loan to buy sugar, cooking oil, salt and others to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking oil, salt and others to sell.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman and staying together with her husband and four children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and water. 

For the past seven years, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale, which will boost her business

loans.name: Alba Salvadora

texts.es:
Alba, es una mujer que atiende su hogar como es debido y además ayuda con los gastos, ella se dedica a vender variedad de cosméticos, productos de primera necesidad y antojitos (enchiladas, yuca frita, pastelitos, etc.), el negocio lo desempeña sola debido a que su esposo tiene otra actividad económica como lo es ofrecer el servicio de transporte en su propio vehículo, Alba vive con su pareja y dos hijas que están estudiando y son dependientes.
Para ofrecer otro tipo de productos a sus clientes solicita un crédito para comprar cosméticos y calzado, le será de ayuda para que el negocio sea más competitivo, espera lograr mayor demanda de sus productos y atraer nuevos clientes para generar nuevas ganancias.
Su prioridad es mantenerse trabajando como hasta ahora para que su familia tenga menos necesidades.
texts.en:
Alba is a woman who takes good care of her home and contributes to the family’s economy. She sells different cosmetic products, personal products, and snacks (enchiladas, fried cassava, pies, etc.). She works alone, since her husband works transporting people in a vehicle he owns. Alba lives with her husband and two daughters who go to school and depend on their parents.

She wants to have a wider variety of products to offer, which is why she is requesting a loan to buy cosmetic products and shoes. This will make her business more competitive. She hopes that the demand for her products increases and that she can attract more customers in order to make more profits.

Her priority now is to continue working as she has been doing so far, so that her family can live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products and shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, certified seeds, herbicides and insecticides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a cow so as to increase the number of litres of milk supplied to his clients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for a tractor to increase speed and quality of transportation service.

loans.name: Ramon Antonio

texts.es: Ramón de 58 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, los dos mayores ya son independientes, el se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos  y trabajar como jornal, posee más de 20 años de trabajar en la agricultura, cosecha en los meses de diciembre a enero y los comercializa en los alrededores de la zona, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abono, controles de plagas, etc. y ai continuar con sus siembras para darle a su familia un mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ramón, 58, owns a house where he lives with his wife and son. He has two more children, who are independent. Ramón grows grains and works as a day laborer. He has worked for more than twenty years in agriculture, and harvests from December to January. He sells his produce to local businesspeople.

Ramón is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, etc., in order to continue growing vegetables and improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and herbicides to harvest more for high income gain

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a forty year old married man living in Masindi Uganda. He deals in fish selling and works very hard to sustain his business. 

He used the old loan very well and he bought a motor cycle to help him in transporting his fish. 

He is grateful to the Kiva funders for that support. He wants a loan to buy more fish for selling.

loans.use: to buy more fish for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase certified seeds and insecticides so as to get a better harvest and meet the demands of clients and family needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add more stock of vegetables to sell, in order to help educate her children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hybrid seedlings, fertilizers and new equipment for farming to earn funds for her children's education

loans.name: Malika

texts.en:
Malika is married, and has one child who attends school. She has owns a house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has a poultry farming business which earns her a source of income. She sells to restaurant operators and local neighbours. Her major challenges are high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the Ksh 50,000 she wants to  purchase chicks and chicken feeds. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feed and thus the living standards for her family

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius lives in Hoima Uganda. He is a hardworking married man who started his business dealing in spare parts alongside operating a bar to earn more income. 

He hopes to grow and expand his business by opening up outlets in the neighboring centres to move his services nearer to people. 

Julius complains of inadequate capital to purchase enough stock to sell. He is seeking for credit to buy tyres for sell.

loans.use: to increase capital needed for buying tyres to sell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman and has been blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a fish selling business for over ten years, selling from her home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces major challenges of seasonality and perishability which lead to losses.

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy timber for selling.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet lives in Hoima Uganda. She deals in produce mainly buying and selling of maize, rice, beans among others supplemented by incomes from farming. 

She dreams of expanding and developing her business to also rearing cattle to earn more income. However, price fluctuations and weather changes especially the dry season affect her desires. 

She will use the loan facility to buy more maize for sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize for sell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter lives in Hoima Uganda. He is aged 29, married with 4 children, of which 2 attend school. 

He sells clothes like shirts, skirts among others supplemented by farming of cassava, beans and rice to make income. 

He hopes to grow and pay school fees for his children however much bad roads and weather changes affect his business. He will use the loan facility to buy clothes for selling.

loans.use: to increase his stock of clothes for selling.

loans.name: Mwanaulu

texts.en:
Mwanaulu is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mwanaulu operates a grocery vegetables selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale, so as to boost her business

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman; she has four children, all of whom attend school. Mwanasiti owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanasiti has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a stiff competition from other firewood operators in her business.
 
With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale, in order to boost her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a cow to increase the number of litres of milk supplied to his clients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food ingredients for his hotel and thus the life of his family

loans.name: Ihambiro Tweyambe Group

texts.en:
Grace is the lady on the right hand of the group photo and a member of IHAMBIRO TWEYAMBE GROUP located at Ihambiro village, Nyarushanje subcounty, Rukungiri district. She has 5 children and 1 child who still goes to school. She is widow and the burden to look after the family is on her alone.

She is an agriculturalist and gets income mainly from selling matooke (plantains).  Her husband was a teacher and she therefore gets pension to help her meet the family expenses. 

These incomes are little so she decided to join Ihambiro Tweyambe Group to acquire a loan of 600.000 which she will use to pay school fees for the daughter. The whole group is greatful to Ugafode and Kiva funders.

loans.use: To sell matooke (plantains) and thus to pay tuition for her daughter

loans.name: Lawan

texts.en:
Lawan is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Mayere Ba'awa village. Lawal joined Babban Gona to provide a better livelihood for his family. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Lawal will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the average Nigerian farmers yield. This will allow him to increase his income considerably. 

With his increased yield and earnings, Lawal's primary goal is to ensure that his children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields and enable him to pay for his children's schooling

loans.name: Siboniso

texts.en: Siboniso is applying for a third loan to support his studies through to his graduation in December 2015 at the Maharishi Institute. He has provided the following update on his progress since receiving the second loan: “Ever since my second loan I have been able to come to school everyday and have been able to attend my classes at MUM (Maharishi University of Management).”

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Saiad

texts.en:
Saiad, who is 48 years old from village Kvemo Bolnisi, lives with his parents and wife. The main source of income for family is from agricultural activity. Particularly, they own a plot of agricultural land, where they harvest beans, maize and potatoes and also has a vineyard and produce grapes. Saiad sells the harvested products at the local market. It is a seasonal income.

Saiad started to work as an artisan and gets small income from this private activity. He finds it hard to make financial stability for his family and decided to start trading business with cars, that is profitable in Georgia. 

Saiad has been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. He will purchase damaged cars and after repairing will sell at a good price at the local cars' market.

The loan will greatly assist Saiad and he will be able to improve his economic situation and give his family a better style of life.

loans.use: To start repairing cars which have been damaged and then sell them at the car market

loans.name: Rogers

texts.en:
Rogers is aged 39,a married man with 4 children and all attend school in Hoima Uganda. 

He deals in produce mainly buying and selling of dried cassava, maize and beans. He ventured into crop growing as a way of supplementing his incomes. 

He hopes to grow and expand his business; however, bad roads and price fluctuations affect his business. He will use the loan facility to buy more coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy more coffee for sale

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a weaver from Mexico who specializes in handwoven rugs. She would like to invest in a bulk purchase of wool and hire additional weavers for her workshop.

Irene has been selling through NOVICA since 2011. This is her story:

"I grew up in Teotitlan del Valle, home of the legendary Zapotec rugs," says Irene. "I wasn't able to finish school due to financial difficulties. I don't use any chemicals because I want to contribute to the preservation of the environment. I make colors from leaves, seeds and flowers to dye the virgin wool.

"Thank you for supporting true artisans and the families who depend on the fruits of their work."

Use the link below to view Irene's handwoven rugs on the NOVICA site:

http://www.novica.com/kiva/7962

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of wool and hire additional weavers for her workshop

loans.name: Kakyindo Tukorere Hamwe Group

texts.en:
Cleophas is a new client in the institution who is applying for a loan through the group.  Cleophas aged 37 years is married with 3 children and works as a pastor of a local church in Bugangari subcounty, Rukungiri district. 

Cleophas’ future dream has been to invest more money in his coffee trade in order to get higher returns. However he did not have enough money to do that so he formed a group where he joined with 5 members to acquire a loan. They approached the branch for a loan and after getting the loan he went a happy man because his dream came true. 

Group members thanks UGAFODE for that tremendous financial support and making his dream come a reality

loans.use: To boost the coffee trade by buying coffee that he will sell

loans.name: Zanele

texts.en: Zanele is applying for a third loan to support her studies through her graduation in December 2015 at the Maharishi Institute. She has provided the following update on her progress since receiving the second loan: “Kiva has helped me with my transport money and also to pay my accommodation. Since I got Kiva I come to school everyday and I no longer have financial stresses.”

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Lia

texts.en:
Lia, who is 34 years old, lives in village Khashmi with her husband, who works as a security and gets 400 GEL monthly. Lia is a tailor and works on a private orders. The family has small income and finds it hard to make financial stability. 

Lia wants to start agricultural activity and sell products locally. According to above mentioned situation, Lia lacks the access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting business, as they require stable income and business experience. 

The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled her to get a loan of 3200 GEL. She will purchase a milk cow with the requested amount. After the cow is purchased the family will start producing dairy products: cheese and yogurt for selling. They also use the milk products for feeding the family.
 
The family's living conditions will significantly improve, and the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market, in case of need. Lia and her husband rely on the good will of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow and start an agribusiness to provide a regular income

loans.name: Enoka

texts.en:
Enoka lives in Hoima Uganda. He deals in produce mainly buying and selling of maize and beans. He is a hard working married man with 2 children. He supplements his incomes with farming where he grows crops like cassava, rice, and beans among other items. 

He hopes to own a fully stocked produce store that can supply his customers all the time, even after the season has ended. 

Enoka is seeking for credit to buy more beans for sale.

loans.use: to buy more beans for sale.

loans.name: Tiego

texts.en: Tiego is applying for a third loan to support her studies through her graduation in December 2015 at the Maharishi Institute. She has provided the following update on her progress since receiving the second loan: “Since my second loan, my studies have improved because my loan helped to pay my studies and helping me with my transport. I am always at school and I don’t have an excused of not coming to school because every month I  get monthly allowance that helps me with transport. I have improved my studies since receiving Kiva loan.

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Zanele

texts.en: Zanele is applying for a third loan to support her studies through her graduation in December 2015 at the Maharishi Institute. She has provided the following update on her progress since receiving the second loan: “This loan helped me by being able to have transport money to come to school each and everyday. It has also helped me to pay to rent here in Johannesburg. It has also helped me to buy formal attires because we have to wear formal here at school.”

loans.use: to pay for one year tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Thabang

texts.en:
Thabang is applying for a third loan to support her studies through her graduation in December 2015 at the Maharishi Institute. She has provided the following update on her progress since receiving the second loan: 
Since my second loan I have been able to come to school everyday,complete my school work on time without any worry of transport,I managed to pass all my courses. I am grateful with Kiva `s loan support.

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Katleho

texts.en: Katleho Tsotesti is applying for a third loan to support his studies through her graduation in December 2015 at the Maharishi Institute. He has provided the following update on his progress since receiving the second loan:Kiva loan helped me a lot with my tuitions fee,before Kiva I used to worry a lot about my fees and this had an impact on my studies.But since I got Kiva I perform well because all my tuition fees are covered.

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en: Jacob is applying for a third loan to support his studies through his graduation in December 2015 at the Maharishi Institute. He has provided the following update on his progress since receiving the second loan: “I have been to attend school everyday because of the stipend that I have received, travelling has been easier. My studies have improved and I look forward to completing my degree.”

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Nthabiseng

texts.en: Nthabiseng is applying for a third loan to support her studies through her graduation in December 2015 at the Maharishi Institute. She has provided the following update on her progress since receiving the second loan: “I was born to be a leader and indeed I am putting my leadership skill into my studies, academically I am doing well and I am granted other opportunities as well outside the institute and I am grateful for that Kiva has helped me financially and I am proud to say, I will bring change in my country and community.”

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Brian

texts.en: Brain is applying for a third loan to support his studies through his graduation in December 2015 at the Maharishi Institute. He has provided the following update on his progress since receiving the second loan: “I use the money to buy my train ticket so that can come to school everyday on time. I also used some my stipend to buy lunch at school so that I can be focused in class with a full stomach.”

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Lethiwe

texts.en: Lethiwe is applying for a third loan to support her studies through her graduation in December 2015 at the Maharishi Institute. She has provided the following update on her progress since receiving the second loan: “My studies have improved since my second loan, in a way that, I can be able to pay my fees. I feel comfortable in class because I have good feelings that my school fees are paid. Also in my family it helped a lot, I can be able to buy food.”

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Yei Paola

texts.es: Yei Paola de 24 años de Edad,  desde la comodidad de su hogar ofrece servicios de café internet, negocio que inició hace dos años motivada por su cónyuge, quien le propuso iniciar éste negocio, puesto que le permitiría generar ingresos y estar más tiempo con su hija de cinco años de edad, quien por su corta edad requiere de mucho cuidado y dedicación.  Adecuaron en su vivienda un espacio e hicieron un local comercial; habilitaron con divisiones, escritorios y computadoras, cubículos para la comodidad y discreción del servicio, así mismo también colocaron una vitrina con golosinas y ofrecen minutos y recargas.  Sus principales clientes son vecinos y familiares del sector quienes pueden acceder al servicio de navegación desde las 8 a.m. hasta las 10 p.m., además de tener disponible servicio de transcripción, impresión y demás.  Yei Paola está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en planes de minutos, recargas y materiales de construcción para ampliar el local.  Esta inversión permitirá mejorar los tiempos de espera y con ello la productividad de su negocio, puesto que muchos clientes deben esperar a que se desocupen computadoras para poder acceder al servicio. Yei Paola sueña con tener su casa propia y continuar creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Yei Paola, 24 years old, offers internet cafe services from the comfort of her home, a business which she began two years ago motivated by her spouse who suggested that she begin this business since it would allow her to generate income and be with her five-year-old daughter for more time, who, due to her young age needs a lot of care and attention. They outfitted a space in their house and made a commercial space. They installed dividers, desks and computers, cubicles for comfort and privacy with the service, and also they installed a display case with candies and offer minutes and cell phones top-ups. Their primary customers are neighbors and family members in the area who can access the navigation service from 8 am to 10 pm. In addition, they have transcription, printing and other services available. Yei Paola is applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,
to invest in minute plans, phone top-ups and construction materials to enlarge the space. This investment will allow her to improve the wait times and with that, the productivity of her business, since many customers have to wait until a computer becomes available to be able to access the service. Yei Paola dreams of having her own house and to continue growing her business.

loans.use: to invest in minute plans, cell phone top-ups, and construction materials to enlarge the space.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, soft drinks, and juice.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 21 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol tiene 5 años de de dedicarse a esa actividad, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su casa, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante, la joven vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc.  y así poder tener junto con su esposo una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
The young woman's face is blurred because she is 21 years old and lives in a area of high risk.

For 5 years she has been making a living from growing corn and beans. She sells her products in various markets close to her home. With what she makes from her sales, she has been able to improve her living.

The young woman lives in her own house with her husband. She is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, pesticides, herbicides, and so on, so she and her husband are able to have a better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, pesticides, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru:
26 летняя Шахноза проживает  в городе Кайракум. У нее прекрасная семья: любимый муж и двое замечательных  детей в возрасте 3 года и 6 месяцев. Ее муж занимается водителем в фирме «Бахор». Сама Шахноза обладает мастерством кройки и шитья. Уже на протяжении 7 лет она занимается пошивом женских платьев национального стиля. 
Шахноза любить свою деятельность и хорошо справляется с ней. По ее словам ей удобно шить на дому, так как она дополнительно может делать работу по домашнему хозяйству и присматривать за детьми. Ей в этой работе нравится ежедневный доход, а так же она обожает шить и кроить. 
Шахноза просит кредит для купли новую швейную (вышивочную) машинку, чтобы улучшить и расширить деятельность.
texts.en:
26-year-old Shahnoza lives in the town of Kayrakum. She has a wonderful family: a beloved husband and two wonderful children aged three years and six months old. Her husband is a driver for the Bakhor company. Shahnoza herself is skilled in cutting and sewing. For the last seven years she has sewed women's dresses in the national style.

Shahnoza loves her work and does it well. According to her, it is convenient to sew at home since she can additionally do the housework and look after the children. She likes the daily income from this work, and also loves to cut and sew.

Shahnoza is asking for a loan to buy a new sewing (embroidery) machine in order to enhance and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing (embroidery) machine.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: Teresa de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo cuenta con 20 años de dedicarse a esa actividad su padre fue quien le enseño ese trabajo y su esposo es quien le ayuda en las siembras, vende sus productos en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su casa, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con sus cultivos y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Teresa, 38 years old, lives in her own house with her husband and her daughter. She works growing corn and sorghum and has 20 years of working in this activity. Her father was the one who taught her this work and her husband is who helps her with the crops. She sells her products in the different markets that are near her house and she is asking for a loan to purchase fertilizer, manure, pesticide, herbicide, etc. and improve the land that is shown in the photo, to be able to continue with her crops and have better income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, manure, pesticide, herbicide, etc. and improve the land.

loans.name: Melba Esperanza

texts.es:
Melba, vive con su familia, tiene una hija menor de edad, su esposo y ella comparten los gastos familiares, sus actividades económicas son la venta de ropa y platillos típicos como atoles, enchiladas, enredos, etc., trabaja con un horario de seis de la mañana a dos de la tarde, las ventajas son que en ocasiones su producto se vende en totalidad y pues también tiene temporadas malas para las ventas, su esposo es empleado en la ciudad.
Utilizará el préstamo para comprar prendas de vestir, tomates, repollo, aceite, condimentos, etc., brindará mejores productos a buenos precios, espera que al invertir en su negocio pueda tener mayor rentabilidad y contar con más clientes satisfechos.
Sus proyectos son mejorar su negocio, tener estabilidad económica y darle a su hija un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Melba lives with her family, including her young daughter. She and her husband share the household expenses. Her earning activities include selling clothes and traditional food such as atoles (a corn drink), enchiladas, enredos etc. She works from 6 am to 2 pm. The advantage is that sometimes her products completely sell out, but then sometimes she has bad seasons for sales. Her husband is employed in the city.

She will use the loan in order to buy garments, tomatoes, cabbage, oil, condiments etc. She will offer better products to her customers at good prices, and she hopes that by investing in her business she will have better profitability and more satisfied customers. Her goals are to improve her business, have better economic stability and give her daughter a better future.

loans.use: buy clothes, tomatoes, cabbage, oil and condiments.

loans.name: Orlando Alberto

texts.es:
Orlando de 33 años de edad, estudió hasta 9° grado, está soltero y vive con su madre y sobrinos, su madre le ayuda a atender una pequeña tienda y los sobrinos van a la escuela.

Orlando tiene una tienda desde hace 6 meses, él decidió ponerla porque en su zona casi no hay tiendas, su madre es quien le ayuda a administrarla, además Orlando trabaja en ocasiones como motorista de una comercial.
    

Él solicita este crédito para comprar golosinas, dulces, bebidas y alimentos para surtir su tienda.

Él sueña con que su tienda crezca de gran manera y apoyar siempre a su madre.
texts.en:
Orlando, 33 years old, went to school up to the 9th grade. He is single and lives with his mother and nephews. His mother helps him tend his store and the nephews go to school.

Orlando has had a store for the past 6 months. He decided to undertake it because in his area there are almost no stores. His mother is the one who helps him run it. In addition, Orlando sometimes works as a driver in a business. 

He asks for this loan to purchase sweets, candies, drinks, and food to stock his store.

He dreams of his store growing greatly and always supporting his mother.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, candies, drinks and food to stock his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel and iron to build a room for the corn mill.

loans.name: Paquip Group

texts.en:
On average, a Friendship Bridge client earns less than $2 a day, has had approximately three years of formal education, cannot read or write and is unlikely to speak Spanish, the official language of Guatemala. The “Microcredit Plus” Program of Friendship Bridge, that combines loans and education, allows for increased productivity, increased sales and higher income for the families of the clients.

The Friendship Bridge Trust bank “Paquip” is made up of nine determined women who share the common goals of raising the standard of living for their families and seeking ways to leave poverty behind. 

María is a 39 year old member of the group who buys and sells organic fertilizer, as well as sugar and corn at the wholesale level. She is requesting a loan to purchase bags of organic fertilizar, as well as large quantities of sugar and corn to sell in her rented market locale. Her goals are to increase the income of her family and support the educational needs of her four children who are all enrolled in school.

The Trust Bank meets monthly with a Friendship Bridge Facilitator. After the women transact business on their loans, the Facilitator shares important information with them on a variety of relevant subjects in their own language. The ladies learn to manage their loans as they learn about effective business practices (planning, budgeting, pricing, marketing, customer service, accounting), health, hygiene and the use of medicinal plants, as well as setting goals, realizing dreams and self esteem. 

Quoting a client “Life seems less difficult to me since I found Friendship Bridge. They trust me, and they give me the chance to have a business using my own skills.” In funding loans for Maria and her friends, KIVA investors are greatly valued and appreciated. Thank you for your generosity!

loans.use: to purchase bags of organic fertilizar, as well as large quantities of sugar and corn to sell in her rented market locale

loans.name: Salvador Ernesto

texts.es: Don Salvador de 62 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo  tiene muchos años de experiencia en la actividad agrícola, su hijo le ayuda en las siembras, su cosecha la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía y los comercializa en los meses de diciembre a febrero con las ventas que realiza es como logra salir adelante, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semilla, fertilizantes, abono, controles de plagas, etc. y asi poder seguir con su trabajo para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Salvador, 62 years old, lives in his own house with his son. He works growing corn and sorghum and has many years of experience in this agricultural work. His son helps him with the crops, he stores his harvest in the granaries which are shown in the photo and sells them in the months of December to February. With the sales that he makes, is how he manages to get ahead. He is asking for a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, manure, pesticide, etc. and in this way be able to continue with his work to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, manure, pesticide, etc.

loans.name: Martin De Jesus

texts.es: Don Martin de 62 año de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos y a la crianza de ganado de engorde, tiene mas de 20 años de dedicarse a esa actividad de la cual a podido salir adelante comercializa sus productos durante todo el año, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas, etc. y para la compra de 2 vacas y así poder continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en: Martin, 62 years old, lives in his own house with his wife. He works growing basic grains and raising cattle to fatten. He has been working for more than 20 years in this activity, from which he has been able to get ahead. He sells his products year-round and is asking for a loan to purchase agricultural supplies such as manure, fertilizer, pesticide, etc. and to purchase 2 cows and in this way be able to continue with his work which generates good income for him.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies such as manure, fertilizer, pesticide, etc. and to purchase 2 cows.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen es una mujer de 41 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida, su hijo de 17 años de edad que se encuentra estudiando, pero además muestra su bondad albergando en su vivienda a una señora de 80 años de edad a la que cuida sin interés alguno. La elaboración de productos artesanales como petates y canastas de tule, lo cual le permite sostener la economía del hogar, apoyada también por su compañero de vida y su hijo que le apoyan en la elaboración convirtiéndose en un negocio familiar. Carmen desea ampliar su vivienda, ya que siente que es demasiado pequeña sobre todo porque en ella elabora sus productos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos y alambre para ampliar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Carmen, 41 years old, lives in her own home together with her life partner and her son who's 17 and currently a student, but also, showing her kindness, she has living at home an 80-year-old woman whom she cares for, with no personal interest.

She works creating artisan products such as petates (woven bedrolls) and tule baskets, and this allows her to support the household economy. She is helped in the production by her partner and son, making this a family business.

Carmen would like to expand her home. She feels it is  too small, particularly since it is also her work place. Therefore, she is requesting the loan from FUSAI to buy galvanized metal sheets, wood, nails and wire, so that she can expand her home.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized metal sheets, wood, nails and wire, to expand her home.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
Gerardo, se está preparando para llevar a cabo la próxima siembra de maíz y necesita de un nuevo préstamo para poder comprar insumos agrícolas con los que preparara la tierra y su cultivo estará protegido contra plagas.
La ayuda del crédito anterior ha sido muy importante para obtener cosechas abundantes y mejores ingresos, su familia tiene mejor alimentación, vestuario y salud.
texts.en:
Gerardo, is preparing to undertake the next corn planting and needs another loan to be able to purchase agricultural supplies with which to prepare his land and so that his crop will be protected from pests.

The help of the previous loan has been very important to get abundant harvests and more income. His family has better food, clothing and health.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies with which he will prepare the land and his crops will be protected from pests.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is applying for a third loan to support her studies through her graduation in December 2015 at the Maharishi Institute. 

She has provided the following update on her progress since receiving the second loan: “Since my second loan, my studies have improved because my loan helped to pay my studies and stopped helping me with my transport. I am always at school and I don’t have an excuse of not coming to school because every month I  get ZAR 425 that helps me to transport. I have improve my studies since I’m always present and I’m always on time."

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Kifiloe

texts.en:
Kefiloe Seripe is applying for a third loan to support her studies through her graduation in December 2015 at the Maharishi Institute. 

She has provided the following update on her progress since receiving the second loan: "The money I received from  Kiva is helping me a lot,it has been helpful when it comes to transport money as I no longer become absent at school and also it assist me with lunch money as I can now concentrate better in class without any stress of having money to come to school."

loans.use: to pay one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Higinio

texts.en:
Higinio is an artisan from Mexico who specializes in Huichol art. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of glass beads and wax, as well as hire additional artisans to work at his workshop.

Higinio has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:

"I was born in a Huichol indigenous community in the Mexican sierra," Higinio says. "I have followed my family tradition of beaded artwork. I make my masks over paper-mache figures, and my wife and I place the beads one-by-one on an adhesive coating of beeswax. The designs are completely improvised and are inspired by our reflections and feelings at the moment that we're working.

Do not expose these pieces to direct heat or light, as it could soften the adhesive and loosen the beads.

"Thanks for supporting us as we share our wonderful culture and traditions with the world."

Use the link below to view Higinio's Huichol art on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/1547

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of glass beads and wax, as well as to hire additional artisans to work at his workshop

loans.name: Edith Orbelina

texts.es:
Edith de 31 años de edad, estudió hasta 8° grado, ella está soltera y vive con su madre y su hermano; su madre se dedica a la venta de tamales y su hermano a la agricultura. 


Edith se dedica a la venta de tamales, esto lo hace con su madre pues de ella fue que aprendió, también cultiva la tierra con su hermano; además 3 días de la semana trabaja limpiando pescados en una empresa, toda su vida ha trabajado pues es la única forma que le permite superarse.    

Ella solicita este crédito para comprar puertas nuevas y ponerlas en su casa, pues se encuentran en mal estado y necesita sentirse segura.


Su sueño más grande es tener una casa en perfectas condiciones, además le gustaría tener su propio negocio y sabe que todo es posible con esfuerzo.
texts.en:
Edith, 31, studied up to 8th grade. She is single and lives with her mother and brother. Her mother works selling tamales and her brother works in agriculture.

Edith works selling tamales with her mother, as it was her mother who taught Edith. She also works in the fields with her brother, and she also works 3 days a week cleaning fish for a company. She has worked all her life since it is the only way she can better herself.

Edith is asking for this loan in order to buy new doors to put in her home, as they are in a bad state and she needs to feel safe. Her biggest dream is to have a house in perfect condition, and she would also like to have her own business. She knows that everything is possible with effort.

loans.use: buy new doors for her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick and iron to build a cement room on her house.

loans.name: Luis Felipe

texts.es:
Luis de 62 años de edad, vive solo con su esposa ya que sus hijos viven aparte, ellos están alquilando casa desde hace muchos años, Luis estudió hasta 5° grado y actualmente trabaja como motorista de un bus y su esposa se encarga de los oficios domésticos.


Luis trabaja de motorista de buses que transportan empleados de una empresa de limpieza de pescado, ya tiene dos años en dicho trabajo, labora de lunes a sábado en la mañana y luego hace turno de noche.
    

Él solicita el crédito para comprar ladrillos, cemento y arena para construir su propia casa en un terreno que le han regalado.

Su sueño principal es ver construida su casa ya que todo este tiempo ha vivido alquilando.
texts.en:
Luis, 62 years old, lives only with his wife since his children live on their own. They have been renting their house for many years. Luis went to school up to the 5th grade and currently works as a bus drive and his wife is in charge of the household tasks. 

Luis works a a driver of the buses which transport the employees of a fish cleaning business. He has been in this job for two years, and works from Monday to Saturday in the morning and then takes the night shift. 

He asks for the loan to purchase bricks, cement, and sand to build his own house in a land that has been given to him.

His primary dream is to see his house build since all this time he has been renting.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, cement and sand to build his own house.

loans.name: Víctor Manuel

texts.es:
Victor de 64 años de edad, estudió hasta 2° grado, está casado y su esposa es ama de casa, todos sus hijos ya formaron sus propios hogares por lo tanto solo la esposa depende de Victor.
 

Él se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos, ha hecho esto desde hace 40 años, este negocio lo aprendió de sus padres que eran muy buenos en la actividad, para llegar al lugar de trabajo Victor debe irse a pie.


Él está solicitando este crédito para comprar madera y teja de barro para reparar el techo de su casa, le servirá de mucho pues se acerca el invierno y debe estar preparado.


Su sueño es tener ganado pues también le gusta cuidar animales.
texts.en:
Victor, 64 years old, went to school up to the 2nd grade, is married and his wife is a housewife. All of his children have already made their own homes, so only his wife depends on Victor. 

He works growing basic grains, and has done this for the past 40 years. He learned this business from his parents who were very good at it. To get to his workplace, Victor has to go by foot. 

He is asking for this loan to purchase wood and clay tiles to repair the roof on his house. It will serve him well because winter is coming and he should be ready.

His dream is to have cattle because he also likes to take care of animals.

loans.use: to purchase wood and clay tiles to repair the roof on his house.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en: Hilda is applying for a third loan to support her studies through her graduation in December 2015 at the Maharishi Institute. She has provided the following update on her progress since receiving the second loan: “ My loan has helped me with my monthly expenses. I have been doing well in my studies."

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Vuyokazi

texts.en:
Vuyokazi is applying for a third loan to support her studies through her graduation in December 2015 at the Maharishi Institute. 

She has provided the following update on her progress since receiving the second loan: “The Kiva loan gave me an opportunity to achieve my goals and to have a better future after graduating. It has helped me to finish my studies without any financial challenges. I am now able to pay for textbooks, for transportation use, and for personal use."

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Dineo

texts.en:
Dineois applying for a third loan to support her studies through her graduation in December 2015 at the Maharishi Institute. 

She has provided the following update on her progress since receiving the second loan: “The Kiva loan has helped me with my studies in a way that I am still part of the institute. My fees are being paid and I am able to focus on my studies and not worry about my fees. The academic results have been looking good since I got the loan!"

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Arthur

texts.en:
Lehloholono is applying for a third loan to support his studies through his graduation in December 2015 at the Maharishi Institute. 

He has provided the following update on her progress since receiving the second loan: “My studies have progressed in a way that I am happy and satisfied because Kiva money helps and assists me with money to come to school and attend my lectures fully. “

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in rice, beans and corn for her business.

loans.name: Yorlady

texts.es:
Yorlady es una persona que ha tenido que atravesar muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para superarlas y salir adelante junto con sus hijos. 

Hace aproximadamente 3 años inició desesperadamente la búsqueda de una fuente de ingresos para su hogar. 

Fue así como inició la cría y venta de pollos, negocio que le ha venido generando ganancias con las cuales puede sostener los gastos de su hogar. 

Yorlady busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de, pollos, cuido para los pollos, adecuar el corral de sus pollos. Sabe que con la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar puede lograrlo.

Yorlady tiene la esperanza en que el préstamo le permita salir adelante con su negocio. Además, espera que su negocio crezca y genere mayores ingresos con los cuales les pueda ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades de progreso. 

Con un préstamo que hagas hoy podrás mejorar la vida y el negocio de Yorlady!
texts.en:
Yorlady is a person who has had to go through many adversities in her life. However, she has always had the strength to overcome them and get ahead with her children. 

Approximately 3 years ago, she desperately began the search for a source of income for her household.

It was in this way that she began to raise and sell chickens, a business which has been generating income with which she can sustain the household expenses. 

Yorlady looks for a loan to offer her the opportunity to access the purchase of chickens, chicken feed, and fix up the chicken pen. She knows that with the help of Corporación Interactuar she can manage it.

Yorlady has the hope that with the loan, it will allow her to get ahead with her business. In addition, she hopes that her business grows and generates more income with which she can offer her children a better quality of life and better opportunities for progress.

With the loan that you make today, you can improve Yorlady's life and business!

loans.use: to purchase chickens, chicken feed, and fix up the chicken pen.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Wiseman

texts.en:
Wiseman is applying for a third loan to support his studies through his graduation in December 2015 at the Maharishi Institute. 

He has provided the following update on his progress since receiving the second loan: “It has helped me to come to school every day and have money to be able to cover my school’s material and have extra cash to get lunch and transport sometimes and lastly  to buy electricity and my personal things.”

loans.use: to pay one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Shamilla

texts.en:
Shamilla is applying for a third loan to support her studies through her graduation in December 2015 at the Maharishi Institute. 

She has provided the following update on her progress since receiving the first loan: “Since I have received the loan my studies have improved drastically. I am able to concentrate better in class knowing that I won’t be chased out due to non-payment of fees. I get great grades, mostly A’s and B’s."

loans.use: to pay one year of tuition fees at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Manzaneras Group

texts.en:
Surrounded by mountains with lush vegetation in the Western Highlands of Guatemala, Chichicastenango is a picturesque large and busy town with red tiled roofs, narrow cobblestone streets and townspeople dressed in very colorful native “traje” or traditional clothing. The Thursday and Sunday markets are internationally well known and large crowds assemble on those days. There is a lot to see and to buy.

Nine entrepreneurial women have gathered together to form the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Manzaneras.” The ladies are mainly involved in traditional textile production in a variety of brilliant colors. Their goal is to help support the needs of their families.

Juana is a 36-year-old member of the group and with her anticipated loan, she would like to buy all colors of thread to create the typical ornate blouses that the women wear called “huipiles,” as well as “cortes” or skirts, “fajas” or belts and “chalinas” or shawls.  She sells not only in the local market but also in nearby communities. Juana sells at the retail and wholesale levels.

The “Microcredit Plus” program of Friendship Bridge, which combines small loans and education, is very effective. Each month, the ladies learn about everyday topics like health, nutrition, hygiene and how their bodies work. They learn about their rights as women as well as self-esteem. They learn how to dream of a better future and set goals. The group also gains essential business tools learning about planning, budgeting, pricing, accounting and customer service. 

Kiva investors are greatly valued in this effort and the ladies of the “Manzaneras” Trust Bank are grateful. Thank you, Kiva investors!

loans.use: to buy all colors of thread to create the typical ornate blouses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in sweet breads, coffee, sugar, eggs, milk, condiments, candy, rice, beans, and other products for her store.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is married and has three dependents, ages 10, 8 and 6 years old.

Joseph runs a sari-sari (variety) store, selling basic goods like biscuits, seasonings, canned goods, soap and beverages. For almost three years now he has been engaged in this livelihood.

He is asking for a loan to buy assorted stocks for the store like soft drinks and other goods. These goods will enhance the content of his store and enable him to attract more customers. 

He is determined to improve his business as well as support the welfare of his children. His goal is to have a successful and happy family.

loans.use: to buy assorted stocks for the store like soft drinks and other goods.

loans.name: Daniela

texts.es:
Daniela es un hombre de 31 años de edad la cual se desempeña como madre amorosa y como agricultora, en vista de que los ingresos no son suficientes para cubrir los gastos de su hogar, comenzó con una actividad que es la cría y venta de cerdos de engorde con los que intenta mejorar las condición es de vida de su familia ya que debe cubrir los gastos en su hogar por lo que no le queda mucho capital para invertir en su negocio. 

Es por esta razón que requiere un crédito para la compra de cerdos de engorde y concentrados con los que podrá mejorar sus ventas e impulsar esta actividad, teniendo más activas en su micro negocio y haciendo más atractivo a la vista de los clientes pues tendrá más cerdos para ofertar.

Su principal sueño es poder generar buenos ingresos para no ver pasar a su familia ninguna necesidad pues es algo que vivió y que lo afecto de gran manera por esta razón trabaja incansablemente por sus hijos y su esposo.

Apoya a una campesina del campo Colombiano con grandes sueños para su familia!
texts.en:
Daniela is a 31-year-old woman who works as a loving mother and a farmer. Because her income isn't enough to cover the household expenses, she began with a business which is raising and selling fattened pigs with which she tries to improve her family's living conditions and, since it has to cover the expenses of her household, it doesn't leave her much capital to invest in her business.

For this reason, she needs a loan to purchase pigs to fatten and concentrated feed with which she can improve her sales and boost this business, having more activity in her micro-business and making it more attractive in the eyes of the customers since she will have more pigs to offer.

Her primary dream is to be able to generate good income so as not to see her family suffer any needs since it is something she experienced and it affected her a lot. For this reason, she works tirelessly for her children and her husband.

Support a rural resident in the Colombian countryside who has big dreams for her family!

loans.use: to purchase pigs to fatten and concentrated feed with which she can improve her sales.

loans.name: Oscar De Jesus

texts.es:
Comprar vivienda y tener un negocio sostenible son los grandes sueños de óscar, que con su trabajo de transporte de mercancías y encomiendas intenta ganarse la vida día a día.

Trabaja en un vehículo que no es de su propiedad pero tiene la gran oportunidad de comprarlo y es por esto que solicita un préstamo, pues desea ajustar el capital para realizar la compra del camión.

Este carro le dará el sustento que necesitan el su familia, es por eso que la invitación es a que lo ayuden prestándole a su negocio soñado.
texts.en:
To buy a home and have a sustainable business are Oscar's biggest dreams, he tries to make a living day-to-day with his work transporting merchandise and packages.

He drives a truck which he does not own, but he has the great opportunity to buy it. That is why he is soliciting a loan, since he wants to raise the capital to purchase the truck. 

This vehicle will provide him with the means to support his family, so he invites you to help him by lending to the business of his dreams.

loans.use: to purchase a truck for work.

loans.name: Maida

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Maida works hard to support her family.

She has a used-clothing retail business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. 

Maida is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of used clothes to sell to customers.

Maida has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Arbey Enrique

texts.es:
Con mucho empuje y perseverancia, Arbey desea iniciar un negocio de cría y levante de cerdos en su casa ubicada en el municipio de Turbo.

Esta idea surge a partir de la necesidad de generar unos buenos ingresos para colaborar con el sostenimiento del hogar en que vive con sus padres.

Se caracteriza por ser un joven alegre y muy colaborador, cualidades que han hecho que se gane el cariño y respeto de la gente de la vereda.
Con este préstamo podrá dar inicio a este negocio.

El dinero será invertido en la compra de cerdos pequeños y en materiales para construcción de una cochera.
texts.en:
With a lot of drive and perseverance, Arbey wants to undertake a business breeding and raising pigs at his house located in the municipality of Turbo.

This idea came out of the necessity of generating good income to help with sustaining this household where he lives with his parents.

He is characterized by being a happy and helpful young man, qualities which have made him earn the love and respect of the people in the rural settlement. With this loan he will be able to undertake this business.

The money will be invested in the purchase of small pigs and in materials to build a shed.

loans.use: to purchase small pigs and construction materials for a shed.

loans.name: Usha
