texts.en:
Usha is 57 years old and lives together with her husband and daughter. 

While her husband is busy with the rice cultivation, she is keeping goats.  She started 14 months ago with five goats and now she has 14. Besides raising goats, Usha also sells food for extra income for the education and future of her daughter. 

For the raising of goats, Usha has two hectares of land where they can graze. She needs to fence the land. For this, Usha requires a loan of SRD 6,000.

loans.use: to fence the land for her goats.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es: María, tiene 35 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos a su cargo, reside en una aldea del municipio de Gracias, Lempira junto a sus hijos. María lleva aproximadamente 15 años de tener sus propios cultivos de maíz y frijoles, esta actividad es su fuente de ingresos para su familia. La producción que saca la vende en el mercado de la zona. Su plan es mejorar el cultivo y ha decidido solicitar otro préstamo el cual es el octavo ciclo con la institución. este préstamo es por 8,000 lempiras que utilizara para comprar fertilizantes para dar asistencia al cultivo de maíz y también va cultivar mas maíz y frijoles. Su plan es comprar mas terreno para cultivar mas granos básicos.
texts.en: María is 35 years old, a single mother, and has two children in her care. She lives in a village in the municipality of Gracias, Lempira with her children. María has had about 15 years of having her own crops of corn and beans. This work is her source of income for her family. The production which she gets, she sells in the market in the area. Her plan is to improve the crop and she has decided to ask for another loan which is her eighth loan cycle with the institution. This loan is for 8,000 lempiras which she will use to purchase fertilizer to assist the corn crop and also she will cultivate more corn and beans. Her plan is to purchase more land to cultivate more basic grains.

loans.use: to plant corn and beans and purchase fertilizer for the existing crops.

loans.name: Mujeres Chacayense Group

texts.en:
The Mission Statement of Friendship Bridge is “To empower impoverished Guatemalan women to create a better future for themselves, their children and their communities through microfinance and education.”  The organization calls the effective combination of education and small loans “Microcredit Plus.”

The ladies are organized into trust banks with anywhere from ten to 30 in each one. Each month, they meet with a facilitator from the organization. 

Sara, a 19-year-old woman, belongs to the “Mujeres Chacayense” in a rural area of Sololá, in the highlands of the country. She has dreams of continuing her studies in the future but because of the high rate of unemployment for teachers in Guatemala due to lack of funds and schools, Sara decided to put her energy into her traditional textile business. She is requesting a loan to purchase many colors of thread and supplies to meet the demands of her customers. She sews not only on a machine but by hand as well.

The population of the area conserves their indigenous traditions and customs. Most have had little or no formal education and many do not speak Spanish but rather their own indigenous dialect. Each month, a facilitator from Friendship Bridge shares timely information with the trust bank in their own language. Using games, drawings and role playing, the ladies learn about self-esteem, empowerment, setting goals and realizing dreams. They gain information on getting their children ready for school, health, hygiene and nutrition, as well as women’s rights. Finally, they acquire business tools like accounting, budgeting, marketing, pricing and customer service.

These women and their families are poised to step into a brighter and more prosperous future with their small loans and education. In providing the seed money for these essential loans, Kiva investors are greatly appreciated and valued. Thank you!

loans.use: to purchase many colors of thread and supplies to make typical blouses

loans.name: Flor De Chuti Estancia Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Flor de Chuti Estancia” has seven active members who are very grateful to Kiva investors for the support they gave through the group’s first loan cycle in 2014. The women have seen their profits grow and their businesses stabilize. 

The members of “Flor de Chuti Estancia” are asking Kiva investors and Friendship Bridge for a second loan in order to buy raw material for the production of fabrics and, in the case of Sara, to buy agricultural materials.

Sara is 20 years old and said that during the two years she has been in the trust bank, she has been able to experience the many benefits Friendship Bridge has to offer. Sara’s family includes her parents and five sisters. One sister is in the fifth grade. Sadly, Sara was able to study only through the sixth grade.  

Sara helps her parents in growing peas and broccoli, as well as animal husbandry. She also embroiders blouses and belts. All the items are sold.  

Sara is asking for a loan to invest in buying four pounds of seed peas, four trays for broccoli, and 12 sacks of fertilizer. She also needs funds to pay four people to help with planting and harvesting. This young woman’s dream is to have the business grow with more income that will then improve the living conditions for her family.

Many thanks Kiva investors for continuing to support the development of these wonderful hardworking women!

loans.use: to buy four pounds of seed peas, four trays of broccoli, and 12 sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron to build a perimeter wall for her home

loans.name: Alba Aliria

texts.es:
Alba, a sus 30 años de edad, soltera. 
Debido a la falta de oportunidades laborales ha pasado por una situación económica muy difícil; esto la llevó a buscar opciones para salir adelante y desea montar su propio negocio, un cultivo de yuca en zona rural del municipio de Medellín

Por esta razón se motiva para solicitar el crédito, que invertirá en la compra de semillas de yuca, abono, riego, y pesticidas; lo que le permitirá tener una siembra sana y de calidad para la venta.

De esta forma, Alba espera poder recibir los recursos necesarios para salir adelante al lado de su familia, además esto servirá como impulso para avanzar hacia el cumplimiento de su principal sueño que es poder mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Alba, is 30 years old and single.

Due to the lack of work opportunities, she has had a very difficult economic situation. This has brought her to seek options to get ahead and she wanted to open her own business, yucca cultivation in a rural zone in the municipality of Medellín.

For this reason, she is motivated to ask for a loan, which she will invest in the purchase of yucca seeds, manure, pesticides and pay for irrigation, which will allow her to have a healthy and high-quality crop to sell. 

In this way, Alba hopes to be able to get the resources necessary to get ahead alongside her family, In addition, this will serve as a boost to advance toward achieving her primary dream which is to be able to improve the condition of her house.

loans.use: to purchase yucca seeds, manure, pesticide and pay for irrigation, which will allow her to have a healthy and high-quality crop to sell.

loans.name: Jorge Eliecer

texts.es:
Jorge, de 47 años, ha optado por montar un negocio de comidas cerca a su casa ubicada en el municipio de El Carmen De Viboral, en este negocio vende pasteles de pollo, empanadas, buñuelos, entre otros.

Jorge trabaja todos los días durante 5, es un hombre muy responsable, juicioso y aplicado con su negocio.

Entre sus sueños más latentes esta el poder pagar la educación de sus hijos y comprar una vivienda propia.

Enfrenta la gran dificultad de tener una gran competencia en el sector.

El pide un aliento económico para capitalizar su negocio y comprar un carro de comidas nuevo para reemplazar el que tiene actualmente en mal estado.

El crédito impactara su vida y su negocio de un modo muy favorable pues podrá cumplir con su sueño y tendrá una mayor variedad de alimentos para ofrecer a sus clientes, además de que de este negocio dependen sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Jorge, 47 years old, has decided to open his own food business near his house, located in the municipality of El Carmen de Viboral. In this business, he sells chicken pies, empanadas, croquettes, and more.

Jorge works every day for 5, he is a very responsible, wise man and dedicated to his business.

Among his most latent dreams are to be able to pay for his children's education and to purchase his own house. 

He faces the big difficulty of having a lot of competition in the sector.

He asks for a loan to capitalize his business and purchase a new food cart to replace the one he has currently which is in bad condition.

The loan will impact his life and his business in a powerful way because he will be able to achieve his dream and he will have a wider variety of foods to offer his customers, in addition to this, his two children depend on this business.

loans.use: to capitalize his business and purchase a new food cart to replace the one he has now which is in bad condition.

loans.name: Maria Adelaida

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer muy emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante y progresar.

Desde hace 3 años se viene dedicando a la venta de productos por catalogo como ropa, accesorios, artículos de belleza y elementos para el hogar, estos productos los vende principalmente a amigos, vecinos y familiares que conocen a Maria y quieren que también progrese en su actividad.

Desde muy niña sintió gran afinidad con el comercio y las ventas, por lo que hoy en día tiene grandes habilidades en este campo gracias a su simpatía y excelente calidad de servicio.

Solicita un préstamo para comprar surtido de productos de belleza y ropa para aumentar su inventario y mejorar sus ventas, obteniendo así unos buenos ingresos para su hogar

Tiene la esperanza de poder salir adelante gracias al apoyo de las personas de buen corazón que apoyan este tipo de proyectos y al acompañamiento de la Corporación Interactuar.
texts.en: Maria is a very enterprising woman, with great desire to move forward and progress. For three years she has been working selling products by catalog, such as clothes, accessories, beauty items and household objects. She sells these products mainly to friends, neighbors and relatives, who know Maria and who also want her to progress with this activity. Since she was very young, she felt a great affinity to commerce and sales, so now she has great abilities in this field thanks to her empathy and excellent quality service. She is requesting a loan to buy a stock of beauty products and clothes to increase her inventory and improve her sales, obtaining in this way better earnings for her household. She hopes to be able to move ahead, thanks to the support of good-hearted people who support this type of projects, and with the help of Interactuar.

loans.use: to buy a stock of beauty products and clothes to increase her inventory and improve her sales.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma, 48, is a married woman with five children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Wilma has a bicycle taxi business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 16 years. 

Wilma requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy wheels and spare parts for her bicycle taxi.

In the future, Wilma would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy wheels and spare parts for her bicycle taxi.

loans.name: Nonita

texts.en:
Nonita is 55 years old, married, and has two children.

Nonita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for 14 years and also earns an income from food vending. 

Nonita requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

Nonita has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. 

She aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

loans.name: Cinthia Thalia

texts.es:
Cinthia es una mujer muy emprendedora y tenaz, con grandes deseos que ha estado cultivando y tratando de cumplir.

Tiene un pequeño negocio de preparación y venta de alimentos como empanadas y arepas.

Con esta actividad intenta día a día  salir adelante y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia compuesta por su esposo y sus hijos quienes son el motor de su vida y su motivación para luchar diariamente.

Su mayor dificultad es la competencia del sector, pero con su gran capacidad de trabajo es capaz de sostenerse y progresar.

Cinthia solicita un préstamo para realizar la compra un asador nuevo e insumos como maíz para continuar realizando sus arepas.

Con tu ayuda Cinthia Podrá mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda que es uno de sus más grandes sueños!
texts.en:
Cinthia is a very enterprising, tenacious woman, with big dreams she has been nurturing and trying to realize. 

She has a small business preparing and selling foods like empanadas and arepas. 

With this work she tries to get ahead every day and improve living conditions for herself and her family, comprised of her husband and children who are her reason for being and her motivation for struggling every day. 

Her biggest difficulty is the competition in this sector, but with her great work ethic she is able to support herself and progress. 

Cinthia is requesting a loan to purchase a new grill and ingredients like corn to continue making her arepas. 

With your help, Cinthia will be able to improve conditions in her home, which is one of her greatest dreams!

loans.use: to buy a new grill and ingredients such as corn to continue making arepas.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is 49 years old and is married with three children.

Celia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like soap, canned goods, noodles and other personal care products.

Celia has borrowed and paid back 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from farming vegetables.

Celia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like soap, canned goods, noodles and other personal care products.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is 28 years old, married, and has one child who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Estela has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. 

Estela requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

In the future, Estela would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is 54 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

Lucena has borrowed and paid back five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for twenty years and also earns an income from farming vegetables.

She aspires to save money to expand her business and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

loans.name: Santina

texts.en:
Santina is married. Her husband is a teacher. She lives in a very simple house.

She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She has been involving herself in business since 2010. She feels comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day. She also keeps animals like buffalo and pigs. 

A $600 loan is offered to Santina to improve her business. She will buy some additional supplies such as  pillows, blankets, shoes, shirts, pants and bags.

Running a business has made Santina independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

She is happy with this loan because it will enable her to improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: To buy pillows, blankets, shoes, shirts, pants and bags.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe de 43 años de edad, no pudo prepararse académicamente, está casada y su esposo se dedica a trabajar como albañil y es agricultor, tiene 5 hijos de los cuales dos estudian, dos trabajan y uno y se casó.

Guadalupe trabaja en los cafetales, labor que realiza desde muy pequeña y fueron sus padres quienes se la enseñaron y además se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar.

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar abono y pagar mano de obra para cultivar café.

Su mejor sueño es  ver plantada su parcela así como también ayudarle a sus hijos  para un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Guadalupe, forty-three years old, could not complete her education. She is married, her husband works as a bricklayer and farmer, they have five children of which two attend school, two work, and one got married. 

Guadalupe works in the coffee fields, which she has done from a young age. Her parents taught her this work, and she also does the housework. 

She needs the loan to buy manure and pay for the costs of labor to grow coffee. 

Her greatest dream is to see her parcel of land planted, and also to help her children to have a better future.

loans.use: to purchase manure and pay for labor to cultivate coffee.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is 41 years old and is married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Emelita has borrowed and paid back five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from food vending businesses and farming vegetables.

She aspires to save money to expand her business and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes hails from Getafe, Bohol. For almost 11 years she has been engaged in the gasoline vending business. She is a 47-year-old married woman with seven children. Her oldest child is 24 and the youngest is 7. She also runs a sari-sari (variety) store. 

She has requested a loan to buy additional stocks for the store and supplies of gasoline. These tools will enhance the stocks of her store and provide more gasoline for her to sell. 

With the resources available, Agnes would like to expand her business to be more sustainable and continue send her children to school so they may have a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks for the store and supplies of gasoline.

loans.name: Maria Corazon

texts.en:
Maria Corazon is 52 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Maria Corazon has been farming rice for 17 years and also earns additional income from clothing sales.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream; to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru: Мавлуда 49 летняя женщина. Она разведена с мужем. Мавлуда вместе дочери живет на районе Гафуров. У нее одна единственная дочка. Дочке 20 лет. Ее дочь занимается шитьем женской одежды дома. Мавлуда ответственная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она 10 лет своей жизни продвигает торговую деятельность. Мавлуда на рынке района занимается торговлей фрукты и овощи. Она любить свою работу и планирует остаться в этом бизнесе еще надолго. На данный момент у  Мавлуды возникли  финансовые затруднения, по которым она вынуждена обратиться за кредитом. Мавлуда за счет привезет больше фрукты и овощи на продажу. Она с большими надеждами обратилась к Вам за кредитом. Мавлуда знает, что Вы ей поможете, и увеличить товарооборот.
texts.en: Mavluda is a 49-year-old woman. She is divorced from her husband. Mavluda and her daughter live in the Gafurov region. She has one daughter who is 20 years old. Her daughter sews women's clothes at home. Mavluda is a responsible and hard-working woman. She has been a trader for the past 10 years of her life. Mavluda sells fruits and vegetables at the local market. She loves her work and plans to stay in this business for a long time to come. At the moment Mavluda has some financial difficulties due to which she has been obliged to apply for a loan. Mavluda will use the loan to buy in more fruit and vegetables for sale. She has turned to you for a loan with high hopes. Mavluda knows that you will help her and increase her turnover.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables to increase her turnover.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
A $1,000 loan is offered to Angelina to improve her business. She is married, and she has two children. Her husband is a farmer.

Angelina has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as carrots, tomatoes, onions, garlic, vegetables and chilies. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2008. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Angelina independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy carrots, tomatoes, onions, garlic, vegetables and chilies

loans.name: Orlinda

texts.en:
Orlinda is 61 years old and married with four children.

Orlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, coffee, milk and personal care products.

Orlinda has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Orlinda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, coffee, milk and personal care products

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Alicia is 41 years old and her four children are in school.

Alicia has a junk shop business in the Philippines. Alicia requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials and tools needed for her business.

Alicia has been in this business for three years. In the future, Alicia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials and tools needed for her junk shop business

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is 30 years old, and she is married. She has a kiosk to generate income for her family. 

She has been thinking of how to run a big business, but she does not have enough working capital. She felt better when she applied for her first loan, and now she is applying for her second loan of $1,000. She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as a refrigerator, Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sagiko, Sprite, water, beer, noodles, cigarettes, coffee, salt, fish, milk, body lotion, eggs and shampoo.

She is happy that TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator, Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sagiko, Sprite, water, beer, noodles, cigarettes, coffee, salt, fish, milk, body lotion, eggs and shampoo

loans.name: Luzville

texts.en:
Luzville is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Luzville is 36 years old, and her four children are presently in school.

Luzville has a fishing business in the Philippines. Luzville requested a PHP 22,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fishing materials such as fishnet, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business.

Luzville has been in this business for eight years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing materials such as fishnet, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business

loans.name: Ana Liza

texts.en:
Ana Liza is 39 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines.

Ana Liza is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Ana Liza has been raising pigs for one year and also earns additional income from coconut wine vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 54 years old and has three children. She is a widowed woman.

Dolores is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Dolores requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise livestock.

Dolores has been raising pigs for one year now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Dolores would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise livestock.

loans.name: Norlyn

texts.en:
Norlyn is 29 years old and a single woman.

Norlyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Norlyn requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Norlyn has been in this business for five years now. She also earns additional income from rice retailing and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy furniture for the home.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
For the last 10 years, Imelda has operated  a tricycle(motorcycle with side car) transportation service.  She lives in Talibon, Bohol. She is a  married woman with two young dependents.   She  also buys and sells bananas and coconuts to augment her income. 

Imelda  asks for a loan to purchase fuel, a tire, and  maintenance.  She would be able to continue her livelihood and settle her obligations. 

She hopes that she could manage both sources of income to support the needs of her growing  children.

loans.use: to purchase fuel, a tire, and  maintenance.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is a woman with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Elma is 28 years old now.

Elma has an upholstery business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy foam and other materials for her business.

Elma has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy foam and other materials for her upholstery business.

loans.name: Florina

texts.en:
Florina is 34 years old and married with three children who are currently in school.

Florina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Florina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Florina has been in this business for five years now. She also earns additional income from food vending and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a 22-year-old woman with one child who works very hard to provide for them.

Emma has run run a general store for 1 year and requests 6,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ianned goods, eggs, home care products, bread, and other groceries.  She sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Emma would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, eggs, home care products, bread, and other groceries.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a 51-year-old married woman with three children, all attend school.

Gina has raised pigs for 8 years and requests 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She has previously borrowed 3 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Rosa Ines

texts.es:
Rosa es una madre de un pequeño hijo de ya 4 años de edad y por el cual ha luchado incansablemente para sostenerlo y brindarle todo lo que necesita.

Encontró en la venta de mercancía como artículos para el aseo personal, la manera para generar buenos ingresos estando cerca  de su hijo.

Hoy en día está iniciando con un capital muy pequeño y está en etapa de recolección de clientes, por esta razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de productos como cremas de manos, desodorantes, lociones, enjuagues, entre otros, al por mayor y así poder abastecer su pequeño negocio con productos de calidad.

Con la ayuda del préstamo podrá impulsar su negocio y tendrá una mejor variedad de productos para ofertar, logrando así la consolidación de su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa has a little four year old child.  It is for him that she has struggled tirelessly to support and to provide everything that he needs.

Buy selling merchandise like personal grooming items she found the way to generate good earnings while being close to her son.

She is now starting with very little capital.  She is in the stage of collecting from her customers.  For this reason she is requesting a loan to buy in bulk stock of products like hand creams, deodorants, lotions, and rinses, among others.  This way she will be able to stock her small business with quality products.

With the help of the loan she will be able to boost her business, and she will be able to have a greater variety of products to sell.  This way she will manage to strengthen of her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of products like hand creams, deodorants, lotions, and rinses, among others.

loans.name: Daria

texts.en:
Daria has been a tailor for 10 years . She is  a 61-year-old married woman with five  grown children. She also grows seaweed to sell to the local community.

 Daria has requested a  loan in the amount of 12,0000 PHP  to buy a new sewing machine and seaweed seedlings. These items would boost Daria's livelihood. She could provide more tailoring services and  grown more seaweed. She could balance her finances and do some expansion.

Her dream is to improve her business so that is sustainable in the years to come.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and seaweed seedlings

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza is  a married woman with 10 children who works hard to support her family.

She has a retail spice business  and earns additional income selling vegetables.  Esperanza is borrowing 16,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more spices to sell in her food stall.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and requests another loan to further build her businesses.

Esperanza has sustained her business through  5 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream which is to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more spices to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Sydney

texts.en:
Sydney is a 31-year-old married woman with one child, who attends school.  Sydney works very hard to provide for them.

Sydney has run a a general store for 5 years and requests12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase canned goods, shampoo, milk, coffee, drinks, bread,  and  personal care products.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, shampoo, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, and personal care products.

loans.name: Jovencia

texts.en:
Jovencia is a married woman with 4 children who works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business and earns additional income from a general store. Jovencia is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Jovencia has sustained her business through 12 previous  loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream which is to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
Gladis, con 34 años de edad, es casada y madre de 2 hijos. Se caracteriza por ser una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora, una visionaria y buena negociante. 
Siempre ha trabajado como comerciante, vendiendo artículos para el hogar y algunos cosméticos en el municipio de La Dorada y, desde hace 1 año tiene este negocio.  

Ha sabido superar tiempos difíciles en el comercio y sueña con mejorar su casa y tener un negocio que perdure en el tiempo; es por ello que Gladis acudió a solicitar un préstamo, el cual utilizará para comprar surtido e inventario de electrodomésticos y elementos de uso personal para abastecer su inventario. 

Gladis es una mujer muy organizada aunque ha tenido que enfrentar la competencia comercial del sector.  

La suma de todos sus esfuerzos le brindan a toda su familia una calidad de vida excelente.
texts.en:
Gladis is 34 years old, is married and has two children. She is a very responsible and hard working woman, she is a visionary and a good negotiator.
She has always worked in business. For a year she has been selling household items and some cosmetics in the municipality of La Dorada.

She has known how to overcome difficult times in business and she dreams of improving her house and having a business that will last. This is why Gladis is asking for a loan which she will use to buy stock and inventory of household appliances and personal use items to stock up her inventory. 

She is a very organised woman although she has had to face business competition in the sector.

All of her efforts have given her whole family an excellent quality of life.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of household appliances and personal products to stock up her inventory.

loans.name: Munisa

texts.ru:
Муниса красивая и молодая, 25 летняя жительница города Душанбе. Она живет в городе  вместе  отцом и матерью. Она шустрая и активная девушка. Муниса 2 года назад освоила  кройку и шитьё женской одежды. Сейчас она занимается шитьем женской одежды на заказ дома. Швейное дело для  неё  является основной деятельностью, потому что ее доходы от этой работы. Муниса зарабатывает и помогает родителям обеспечить семью. Скоро  у Мунисы свадьба, но у нее нет ювелирные изделия для украшения на свадьбы.  
У нас есть такой обычай, что невестка должна иметь приданное и в обязательном порядке   были украшения из золото. Поэтому Муниса обратилась за кредитом. За счет кредита она хочет купить ювелирные изделия для свадьбы.
texts.en:
Munisa is a young and beautiful, 25-year-old resident of Dushanbe. She lives together with her mother and father. She is a smart and active girl. Two years ago, she learned to become a dress-maker of women’s clothes.

She is now sewing women’s clothing on order at home. Garment business is her primary occupation and the main source of her income. Munisa’s earnings help her parents to provide for the family. Munisa is going to be married soon, but she doesn’t have the jewelry as adornment for the wedding. 

There is a custom that the bride has to have a dowry and jewelry made of gold. That’s why Munisa is requesting a loan. With the borrowed money, she wants to buy wedding jewelry.

loans.use: to buy jewelry for her wedding

loans.name: Ciriaco

texts.en:
Ciriaco hails from the town of Talibon, Bohol. He earns a living by operating a tricycle (motorcycle with side car) transportation service. He transports passengers from one place or barrio to the other in his community.

He is 43 years old and is a married man with six dependents. His oldest child is 18 and the youngest is 7 months old.

He has been providing tricycle transportation services for 7 years now. Aside from that, he also raises and sells hogs.

He  is asking for a loan to buy pigs, pig feed and supplements. These will help Ciriaco and his family improve their way of living. Then he will be able to raise and sell more quantities of hogs in a few months.

He is determined to handle his livelihood properly to be able to finance the schooling of his children and able to provide them with good food and better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy pigs, pig feed and supplements.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase condiments, such as salt, chili peppers, and tomato paste

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia has been engaged in a food vending business for almost 11 years now. She prepares native bread and sell it to the locals in her place. She is 55 years old and is a married woman with six children. Her youngest child is 19. She lives in Talibon, Bohol. 
 
She is asking for a loan to buy supplies like flour, sugar, leavening agent and cooking oil. These ingredients will be used in making bread. Thus, slowly her income will augment and she will be able to provide her family with good food and better shelter to live in.

Her desire is to expand her business and then to use the resources available for the improvement of her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy supplies like flour, sugar, leavening agent and cooking oil.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is thankful that she was granted a 10,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. Through her earnings, she was able to send her child to school and meet the daily living expenses. 

She would now like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles, and frozen foods that she sells on a retail basis. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales, and thus, increase her earnings. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her and for a good return on her investment, for it will surely sustain her needs and fund her child's tuition fees. 

Celia dreams of having a bigger general store to improve their economic status. She wants to see her child finish her college education and see her become a professional someday. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Lourdesita

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Lourdesita works hard to support her family.

She has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  Lourdesita is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy containers and other items for her coconut wine vending business.

Lourdesita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy containers and other items for her business.

loans.name: Jigi

texts.en:
Jigi is a 35-year-old married woman three children, all attend school.

Jigi has grown vegetables for 10 years and requests 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

She has previously borrowed 6 times  NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a 44-year-old married woman with seven children, two attend school. Lolita works very hard to provide for them.

Lolita has run a general store for 1 years and requests 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy canned goods, beverages, personal care products, home  care products, and groceries.  She sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Lolita would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy  canned goods, beverages, personal care products, home care products, and  groceries.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda works hard to support his family. Merlinda is married and has had a retail personal collection business for 3 years.

Merlinda requests 11,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more personal collection products to sell.

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more personal  products.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 54 years old and married with nine children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines and is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins and other supplies to raise livestock.

Maria has been raising pigs for 30 years and also earns additional income from coconut wine vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins and other supplies to raise livestock.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 53 years old and married with eight children. With two children still in school, Josephine works very hard to provide for them.

Josephine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items to sell.

Josephine has been in this business for 10 years.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 43 years old and has four children. Marilou is married, and three of her children are currently in school.

Marilou is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Marilou requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies for her pig.

Marilou has been in this business for three years now.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies for her pig

loans.name: Nora Orfilia

texts.es:
Nora inicio la venta de variedades específicamente accesorios, hace 12 años, actividad aprendida gracias a una amiga, buscó esta actividad como una alternativa de generar dinero y como mujer pujante y emprendedora busca desesperadamente el sustento para su hogar conformado por sus 6 hijos.

Debido al costo de vida tan alto, Nora se ve en la necesidad de generar un mayor volumen de ingresos, es por este motivo que necesita un apoyo económico que la ayude a mejorar la variedad de productos que exhibe y que diariamente ofrece a sus clientes. 

Trabaja sola todos los días durante 8 horas.

Solicita un crédito para la compra de accesorios y lociones para añadirlos a su portafolio de productos de uso personal.

Su principal sueño es poder convertirse en la propietaria de un almacén con gran variedad de productos y sabe que está por buen camino de la mano de la Corporación Interactuar.
texts.en:
Nora began selling various items, and especially accessories, 12 years ago. She learned this job thanks to a friend, and sought it as an alternative way to earn money. As a dynamic and proactive woman she desperately searches for ways to maintain her family, made up of her 6 children. 

Because the cost of living is so high, Nora needs to generate a higher volume of income. For this reason she needs financial assistance that will help her increase the variety of products she shows and offers to her clients on a daily basis. 

She works alone for 8 hours each day.

She is requesting a loan to buy accessories and lotions to add to her portfolio of personal products. 

Her biggest dream is to become the owner of a store that offers a wide variety of products, and she knows she is on the right path hand-in-hand with Interactuar corporation.

loans.use: to buy accessories and lotions to add to her portfolio of personal products.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 59 years old and a married woman who has five children.

Merlita is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Merlita requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies for her pig.

Merlita has been in this business for five years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies for her pig

loans.name: Lizeth Maria

texts.es:
Lizeth, es una joven de 24 años de edad que desde hace algún tiempo se ha dedicado a diversas actividades laborales pero siempre con un deseo en su mente que era el incursionar en el área comercial, fue así como desde inicios del año 2014, monto su negocio ofreciendo accesorios de ferretería y repuestos. 
Trabaja sola durante 8 horas todos los días.

Lizeth se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora, amable, con visión y muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por esta razón que se anima a solicitar un crédito, para invertirlo en la compra de mercancía como accesorios, protectores de motor, mangueras, tornillería, entre otros, con el fin de darle una mejor imagen al negocio, que logre atraer más clientes y así ofrecerles una variedad de productos que satisfagan las necesidades y gustos de todos los que visiten el negocio. 

De esta manera logrará obtener ingresos para continuar aportando a la economía de su hogar y ahorrar para montar varias sucursales de su negocio y así tendrá un futuro más próspero, donde podrá mejorar notoriamente su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Lizeth is a young woman. She is 24, and has been working in different places for some time, but she is always thinking of becoming a saleswoman. This is why last year she decided to start a business selling hardware and replacement parts. She works alone, eight hours every day.

Lizeth is an enterprising, kind, and visionary woman, with a strong will to get ahead. This is why she decided to request a loan to buy accessories, engine protectors, hoses, screws, etc. This will improve her store’s reputation and will attract more customers. She will be able to offer them a wider variety and fulfill their needs and preferences.

In this way, her income will improve and she will be able to better contribute to the family’s economy and save to open more stores in the future. This will result in a brighter future for her, and the radical improvement of her and her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy accessories, engine protectors, hoses, screws, and other products for her store.

loans.name: Soeurt's Group

texts.en:
Soeurt is 31 years old and a mother of four children. She is living in Battambang province. Growing rice and working for other farms for a fee have been the sources of her family’s income for five years, and it earns her about 29,700 KHR per day. 

Because of the natural disaster that happened in her village, her farm was flooded. Now she faces a problem of lacking funds to do farming. She is leading a group to take a loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, to buy fertilizer and seeds, and pay for the plowing fee. She hopes to earn more money to support her family and expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds, and pay for the plowing fee

loans.name: María Antonia

texts.es:
María de 42 años de edad, solo estudió hasta segundo grado pues tuvo que dedicarse a trabajar en los cafetales, está casada y su esposo trabaja como vigilante en una gasolinera, tiene 5 hijos pero solo 4 asisten a la escuela. 

María toda su vida se ha dedicado a los cafetales, cultiva café ya que es una actividad que le enseñaron sus padres, su esposo y sus hijos le ayudan a cultivar siempre que pueden. 

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar insumos para el cultivo de café.

Ella sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales y construir su casa de bloque.
texts.en: María is 42 years old. She only studied up to Grade 2 as she had to work in the coffee fields. She is married and her husband works as security in a gasoline station. She has 5 children and only 4 of them go to school. María has worked all her life in coffee plantations, growing coffee is the business that her parents taught her. Her husband and children always help her when they can. She needs this loan to buy inputs for her coffee crops. She dreams of her children becoming professionals and constructing a cinder block house.

loans.use: to buy inputs for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
As a parent of two children, Gina works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Gina is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net for her fishing business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her business

loans.name: Kledis Lisseth

texts.es:
Kledis de 24 años de edad, no pudo prepararse académicamente pues sus padres no la apoyaron, está casada y tiene 4 hijos de los cuales solo dos están estudiando.

Ella posee una tienda en la cual vende productos básicos, se dedica a este negocio desde hace 2 años, además su esposo se dedica a la pesca y ella sale a vender al mercado el producto que su esposo extrae de la laguna.

Kledis utilizará el crédito para comprar arroz, aceite, azúcar, frijoles, bebidas, etc. para surtir su tienda. 

Kledis sueña con mejorar su casa y ampliar su negocio para darles mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Kledis is 24 years old and didn’t have access to academic preparation because her parents didn’t support her. She is married and has 4 children, of which only two go to school. 

She has a store where she sells basic household goods, and has been running this business for 2 years. Her husband is a fisherman and she also sells the products he fishes in the lagoon in the market. 

Kledis will use this loan to buy rice, oil, sugar, beans, drinks, etc., to stock her store. 
 
Kledis dreams about improving her house and expanding her business so she can offer better service to her clients.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, sugar, beans, drinks, etc., to stock her store.

loans.name: Yuris Cristina

texts.es:
Yuris es madre soltera de una hija de 9 años de edad; desde hace aproximadamente 4 años se dedica a trabajar como comerciante independiente, actividad que aprendió trabajando en otros almacenes y desde ahí surgió de la necesidad de generar recursos para el sustento de su familia; ofrece todo tipo de productos como ropa, perfumería, cremas corporales, accesorios, entre otros y cuenta con la ventaja de que diariamente conoce nuevas personas a las que les puede ofrecer su mercancía, mejorando cada día sus ventas. 

Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar mercancía al por mayor como blusas, jeans, zapatos, accesorios, perfumería, entre otros, así podrá abastecerse con más variedad para satisfacer la demanda mejorando su nivel de ingresos.

Yuris, con empeño y dedicación, desea seguir trabajando para sacar adelante su negocio, ya que para un futuro cercano, sueña con tener la posibilidad de montar un almacén en un local comercial donde pueda ofrecer mayor variedad de artículos y que le genere una rentabilidad y una estabilidad económica favorable para dar a su hija una excelente educación y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Yuris is a single mother to a 9 year old daughter. For approximately four years, she has been dedicated to working as an independent trader, work that she learned working in other stores and since then arose the necessity to earn income to support her family. She offers all kinds of products like clothing, perfume, body creams, accessories, among other items and has the advantage that she meets new people on a daily basis to whom she can offer merchandise improving her sales each day.

Currently, she is requesting support of a loan to buy merchandise at wholesale like blouses, jeans, shoes, accessories, perfume, among other things so she will be able to stock more variety to satisfy the demand thus improving her level of income.

Yuris, with hard work and dedication, wishes to keep working to get her business ahead since for the near future she dreams of having the possibility to start a store in a commercial space where she can offer a greater variety of items and generate profits and economic stability to give her daughter an excellent education and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise at wholesale like blouses, jeans, shoes, accessories, perfume, among other items.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase condiments, such as chili peppers, salt, and tomatoes

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Agée de 29 ans, Ama est une femme mariée et mère de deux enfants. Pour exercer ses activités, Ama vit à Adamavo et vend des mèches, des tissages et des produits alimentaires dans son quartier pour ainsi gagner son revenu. Ama s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché local. Pour commander des mèches, Ama demande ce crédit pour réaliser son achat et trouver le gain nécessaire pour aider son mari à soutenir les charges de la famille.
texts.en: Ama, aged 29, is a married woman and the mother of two. To operate her business, she lives in Adamavo and sells hair extensions, weaves, and grocery items in her neighborhood in order to earn an income. She gets her supplies three times a month at the local market. To put in an order for hair extensions, Ama is asking for this loan to realize her purchase and make the profit necessary to help out her husband covering family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase 10 hair extensions and 13 weaves

loans.name: Gloria Amparo

texts.es:
Con su gran manera de trabajar, su amor por sus hijas, su convicción de salir adelante y la fe que tiene en sus sueños, Gloria ha tenido la fortaleza para trabajar en su finca con la cría de cerdos.

Esta es una actividad que le ha dado muchas oportunidades y que le ha permitido darle un sustento digno a su familia.

Hoy en día sus animales necesitan un lugar mejor para albergarlos, es por ello que solicita un préstamo para comprar los materiales necesarios para la construcción de una marranera.

Con el apoyo del crédito podrá comprar estos materiales y es por eso que busca ayuda en los prestadores de kiva y en el apoyo de Interactuar.
texts.en:
With her great way of working, her love for her daughters, her conviction to get ahead and the faith she has in her dreams, Gloria has had the strength to work on her farm raising pigs.

This is an activity that has given her lots of opportunities and has allowed her to provide dignified support to her family.

Today, her animals need a better place to be housed so she is requesting a loan to buy necessary materials for the construction of a pigsty.

With the support of the loan, she will be able to buy these materials and it is for this that she is seeking help from the Kiva lenders and the support of Interactuar.

loans.use: to buy the necessary materials for the construction of a pigsty like wood, nails, among other items.

loans.name: Carol Estefany

texts.es:
Carol, con 18 años de edad, es madre de una hija y responsable de su hogar junto con su esposo. 

Desde hace 2 años, se dedica a trabajar en su propio negocio, una sala de belleza que inició como alternativa para generar recursos que le permitieran velar por el bienestar de su familia, trabaja sola todos los días, la actividad la aprendió a través de una cuñada que le enseño el oficio y poco a poco fue adquiriendo más conocimientos y perfeccionando sus técnicas, lo que le ha permitido darse a conocer en el sector por la calidad de su servicio. 

Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar una vitrina, un lavacabezas y utensilios e insumos al por mayor como tratamientos capilares y tinturas así estará en la capacidad de generar un empleo directo y además podrá prestar un mejor servicio, pues los clientes estarán más cómodos, lo que le ayudará a mejorar sus ventas y los ingresos que percibe. 

Carol, con su perseverancia y proyección hacia un futuro, desea hacer crecer su salón de belleza, en el que pueda generar más oportunidades de empleo para madres cabezas de familia, dando como resultado un mejor bienestar no sólo para su familia, sino que aportará para que otras personas puedan disfrutar de mejores condiciones para vivir.
texts.en:
Carol, 18 years old, has one daughter and together with her husband is responsible for her household. 

She has worked in her own business for the last two years. It is a beauty salon that she began as an opportunity to generate income that would allow her to contribute to her family’s well being. She works alone, everyday, doing this job that she learned from a sister-in-law. Little by little she has increased her knowledge and perfected her techniques. In this way she has become well known in the sector for the quality of service she provides. 

Currently, she is requesting help through a loan to buy a display case and a sink for washing hair as well as utensils and products in bulk, such as hair treatments and colors. In this way she can create a direct job and can also improve her service because her clients will be more comfortable. This will help her increase sales and the income she generates.  

Carol, with her perseverance and vision for the future, would like to continue expanding her salon so she can create more opportunities for jobs for single mothers, that will increase well being not only for her family but also allow other people to enjoy better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a display case and a sink for washing hair as well as utensils and products in bulk, such as hair treatments and colors.

loans.name: Paula Andrea

texts.es:
Paula, a sus 36 años de edad vive con su esposo y su hijo.  

Desde que era joven, ella comenzó a laborar en el campo de la confección, comenzó a tomar clases de capacitación en estas áreas hasta que pudo tener la oportunidad de graduarse.
Con gran alegría y mucha emoción por lo que había aprendido se independizó y montó su taller con gran empuje; afianzó su taller con la esperanza de que las ventas aumentaran y así fue, comenzó a conseguir contratos con terceros. 

De esta forma ha obtenido los ingresos para el sustento de su familia. 
Con el crédito que solicita desea comprar tela al por mayor, con el fin de brindarle a sus clientes una prenda bien elaborada y con excelente terminación, así aumentará los su inventario y podrá generar mayores ingresos para poder cumplir el sueño de tener una línea propia, además de brindar oportunidades de empleo a otras  personas. 

Ella sabe que Interactuar es un gran apoyo para el crecimiento de su empresa!
texts.en:
Paula at 36 years old lives with her husband and son. Since she was young she started to work in the sewing business. She comments that she took training classes in the field until she had the opportunity to graduate. She was very happy and very moved by what she learned and went out on her own and opened her own workshop. She financed her shop in the hopes that her sales would increase and this happened. She started to get contracts from third parties. In this way she obtained the income to sustain her family.

With the loan she is requesting she wants to buy fabric wholesale with the goal of providing her clients more elaborate clothing and excellent finishing. . In this way she will increase her inventory and be able to generate greater income to be able to realize her dream of having her own line of clothing. She can also provide employment opportunities for other people. She knows that Interactuar is a great support for growing a business!

loans.use: to buy fabric wholesale to provide her clients with more elaborate clothing.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 33 ans, Abla est une femme qui vit avec trois enfants à sa charge. Abla habit e à Adamavo et vend des pagnes et détergents en se promenant dans le quartier afin d’avoir le bénéfice nécessaire pour leur épanouissement. Pour parvenir à ses fins, Abla s’approvisionne dix fois par mois chez ses fournisseurs. Pour commander des pièces de pagnes, Abla demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et disposer d’un revenu afin d’aider ses enfants dans son éducation.
texts.en: Abla, aged 33, is a married woman who lives with three children she supports. She lives in Adamavo and sells 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) and detergents by going door to door in her district, so as to make the profits necessary for them to thrive. To reach her goals, Abla gets her supplies ten times per month from her supplies. To put in an order for lengths of ‘pagne’ cloth, Abla is asking for this loan to realize her purchase and to have the income for helping her children with their education.

loans.use: to purchase 2 lengths of 'pagne' cloth

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is thankful for the previously accessed 10000 PHP loan that she used for spare parts and accessories of her tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her high school child and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 10000 PHP loan to pay for tire replacement, fuel and other spare parts of her tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Erlinda hopes to increase her business to improve her income. She aims to send her child to college and see her become professional someday. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance on her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Georges Kankoe

texts.fr: Georges est un homme de 40 ans. Il est marié. Georges est père de 02 enfants de 06 et 03ans. Georges travaille comme couturier depuis un certain temps. Il achète des tissus et des pagnes sur les marchés appropriés à Lomé pour la confection des habits prêt à porter. Georges a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des tissus et des pagnes pour la confection des habits. Il souhaite créer une autre activité et assurer le bien - être de la famille.
texts.en: Georges is a 40-year-old man who is married. He is the father of two children, aged 6 and 30. He has been working as a clothier for a certain amount of time. Georges purchases fabrics and 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) at the markets of the Lomé area to make ready-to-wear clothing. He has requested three WAGES loans to purchase fabrics and lengths of ‘pagne’ cloth for making clothing. He would like to start another business and ensure his family’s well-being.

loans.use: to purchase 'pagne' cloth

loans.name: Leonita

texts.en:
Leonita is 41 years old and married with one child who is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Leonita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Leonita has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, noodles and other groceries.

In the future, Leonita would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, noodles, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like fishing.

Mylene dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
As a married woman, Maria works hard to support her family.

She has a personal care products business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from coconut wine vending. Maria is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like lotion, roll ons, lipstick, etc., for her personal care products business.

Maria has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like lotion, roll ons, lipstick, etc.

loans.name: Mylen

texts.en:
Mylen is 38 years old and has two children. Mylen is married and has one child in school.

Mylen is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Mylen has been raising pigs for 8 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mylen would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Banco Mujer Söswak Group

texts.es: Banco Mujer Söswak está integrado por seis señoras de la misma comunidad rural llamada Sepecue. Son mujeres organizadas indígenas que buscan el mismo objetivo de ayudarse entre si y mejorar las condiciones de vida de ellas y sus familias. Todas viven en fincas que son reservas indígenas heredadas por sus familiares. Ahi la mayoria cultivan sus productos para consumo propio. Para llegar a esa comunidad se debe ir por el río en bote y está ubicada en la Alta Talamanca. Éstas socias escogieron éste nombre en idioma Bribrí que significa "Mujeres Trabajadoras". Es primera vez que solicitan financiamiento a la Fundación y se sienten contentas con la ayuda brindada, para seguir luchando en crecer en sus actividades productivas. Marlen es la presidenta del banco mujer, es una señora con 38 años de edad, tiene tres hijos y vive en unión libre con su compañero. Dos de sus hijos son mayores de edad y cursan la secundaria, el otro es menor y está en primaria. Se dedica hace varios años a la cría de pollos para luego venderlos a la comunidad, ella siente la necesidad de generar ingresos sin descuidar a su familia, para ayudar en su hogar, debido a que su compañero trabaja como agricultor en la finca y lo que percibe por las ventas de sus siembras es muy poco. Junto con Marlen están cinco socias más que van a invertir en actividades de comercio y agropecuarias como es una pulpería, la siembra de banano y plátano, además de criar pollos y cerdos.
texts.en:
The Banco Mujer Söswak Group is made up of six women from the same rural community called Sepecue. They are organized indigenous women who are looking for the same objective of helping each other and improving living conditions for themselves and their families. All of them live on farms that are indigenous reserves inherited by their relatives. Most people there cultivate their crops for their own consumption. 

To reach that community you should go down the river by boat to Alta Talamanca. These women used the Bribri language to choose their name which means “Working Women.” This is the first time they have asked the foundation for a loan and they are happy for the support offered so they can keep fighting to grow in their work.

Marlen is the president of the Banco Mujer. She is a 38 year old lady, has three children, and lives with her life companion. Her two older children are in secondary school and the other younger one is in primary school. For several years she has been raising chickens and then selling them to the community. She feels the need to earn money without neglecting her family to help out at home, as her companion works as a farmer in the field and what he earns from the sales of his crops is very little.

There are five other members with Marlen and they are going to invest in commerce and in agricultural work such as a grocery store, planting bananas and plantains, and raising chickens and pigs.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Ma. Welina

texts.en:
Ma. Welina is a 43-year-old married woman with four dependents aged 18 to 4 years old.

For almost four years now, Ma. Welina has been a dealer of Avon products. She sells items like lotion, body spray, cologne and other beauty products. In addition, she also engages in selling Herbalife products like multivitamins.

She is asking for a loan to purchase more supplies of Avon and Herbalife products, such as beauty soap and a variety of multivitamins. These would really help Ma. Welina cater to the orders of her respective customers. Thus, her income will be augmented.

With the additional capital, which she is grateful for, she can now continue to expand her direct-selling business to support the needs of her children and improve the family's living conditions as well.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies of Avon and Herbalife products.

loans.name: Akouavi

texts.fr: Revendeuse de trousseau bébé et liqueurs, Akouavi demande un premier crédit pour s'approvisionner enfin de subvenir aux besoins des clients. Âgée de 36ans, elle souhaite agrandir son activité et assurer le bien - être de la famille.
texts.en: A retailer of baby accessories and liquor, Akouavi is asking for an initial loan to stock up on merchandise in order to meet customer needs. She is 36 years old and would like to expand her business and ensure her family’s well-being.

loans.use: to purchase baby accessories and liquor

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a resident in the town of Getafe, Bohol. She engages in a food vending business.  She sells home meals, snack food and many other items. She has been engaged in that kind of business for 4 years now.  Aside from that, she also engages in selling locally known as "guinamos" (fermented fish). She is married with one dependent.

She is asking for a loan to buy more supplies of fermented fish. With these, she can produce and deliver orders to her respective customers. Thus, it will augment her income, and continue expand her business.

Lourdes would is determined to expand her business for sustainable living.

loans.use: to buy more supplies of fermented fish

loans.name: Nelita

texts.en:
Nelita is 59 years old and married with five children. Nelita works very hard to provide for them.

Nelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, candies, personal product care and other groceries.

Nelita has been in this business for 8 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Nelita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, candies, personal product care and other groceries

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosalina is 26 years old and has one child in school.

Rosalina has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy containers of coconut wine to sell.

Rosalina has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Rosalina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Oscar David

texts.es:
Oscar, tiene una venta de pan, compra el pan y sale a vender, sus recorridos son de 5:00 a.m. a 8:00 p.m., ya tiene clientes en diferentes zonas el riesgo es la delincuencia que existe. Tiene una familia integrada por su esposa y dos hijos, todos son dependientes y no cuenta con ayuda económica de familiares.
Necesita capital para comprar variedad de pan dulce, francés, etc., cada día que realizase sus recorridos, su objetivo es llegar a vender su producto a otros lugares para que sus ingresos sean mayores y pueda cancelar su deuda.
Sus sueños son tener una panadería propia elaborar el pan y distribuirlo, también aspira a dar una vida más digna a su familia.
texts.en:
Oscar has a business selling bread. He purchases the bread and goes out to sell it. His rounds are from 5am to 8pm. He already has customers in different areas. The risk is the delinquency that exists. 

He has a family made up of his wife and his two children. They are all dependents and he does not rely on any financial help from relatives.

He needs capital to purchase a variety of sweet bread, French bread, etc. each day that he makes his rounds. His objective is to come to sell his product in other places so that his revenue can be greater and he can settle his debt. 

His dreams are to have his own bakery, make the bread and distribute it. He also aspires to give his family a more dignified life.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of sweet bread, French bread, etc. each day that he makes his rounds.

loans.name: Sarim's Group

texts.en:
Sarim, 50, is a mother of one child living in Battambang province.

Rice farming, coconut sales and house construction are the sources of her family’s income. She has been involved in these businesses for 25 years, and she can earn about 33,000 KHR per day on average.

Due to lack of funds, she is now leading a group to apply a new loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, to buy more coconuts for sale. She hopes she can earn more money and improve her family’s standard of living through this loan.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts for sale

loans.name: Edennilson De Jesús

texts.es:
Edennilson tiene 33 años de edad, en su primer hogar tuvo 3 hijos y en el actual tiene 1 y siempre apoya económicamente a sus hijos.

Edennilson se dedica al cultivo de café, su madre tiene parcelas y es donde él cultiva, además en ocasiones realiza siembra de maíz y frijol.

Él solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes y pagar mano de obra para el cultivo de café.

Su sueño es mejorar su vivienda y cultivar en lo propio para obtener ganancias y apoyar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Edennilson is 33 years old. In his first home he had three children. In the current one he has one, and he always supports his children financially. 

Edennilson works cultivating coffee. His mother has some plots of land and that is where he grows.  On occasions, he also grows corn and beans.

He is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor for his coffee cultivation. 

His dream is to improve his dwelling and grow on his own, to profit and support his children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor for his coffee cultivation.

loans.name: Lucia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Lucia, de 31 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, está acompañada  y su pareja trabaja en un taller de estructura metálicas, tiene una hija que vive con ellos y no estudia, su suegra vive también con ella,  pero solo su hija depende económicamente de ella.

Lucia, vende tortillas desde hace 2 años, aprendió a hacer tortillas cuando era pequeña porque su mamá le enseño, fue así como decidió dedicarse a eso, su pareja también le ayuda económicamente, antes trabajaba como empleada doméstica en casas particulares, su negocio está a una cuadra de distancia desde su casa y viaja a pie, su suegra le ayuda y su horario es de 8:00 a.m. hasta las 2:00 p.m.

Lucia, necesita el crédito para comprar leña y maíz para hacer las tortillas.

Sus sueños son, vender más y que el local donde vende sea más grande, además espera que su hija estudie y se gradué de una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Lucia, 31, has a fourth grade education. She has a partner who works in a metalworking shop. They have a daughter who lives with them and is not studying yet. Her mother also lives with them but only her daughter depends on her financially.

Her partner also helps her economically. Lucia used to work as a maid in private homes. For the past two years, Lucia has sold tortillas. She learned to make tortillas when she was little because her mother taught her. She was dedicated to pursue her business. Now, her business is located a block away from her home traveling on foot. Her mother helps her and her hours are from 8 am until 2 pm. 

Lucia needs to buy firewood and corn to make tortillas. Her dreams are to sell more tortillas and that she will have a larger business locale. She hopes her daughter will go to school and graduate from college.

loans.use: to purchase firewood and corn to make tortillas

loans.name: Suo Sdey's Group

texts.en:
Living in Battambang Province, Suo Sdey is a 33-year-old mother of 3 children who are all in school. For the past 10 years, her family's main source of income has been selling groceries. 

Due to lack of funds, Suo Sdey is now leading a group to take a new Kiva loan via VisionFund so she can buy more grocery items for resale. She hopes her business will be expanded with help from this loan.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items for resale

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn is a 42-year-old married woman with three children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Rosalyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. She has been in this business for 13 years. 

In the future, Rosalyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
