Celestina, 40, is a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Alejandro, a carpenter, and their children are already working. She manages their household while also operating her business. She works hard to augment their income and meet her family’s basic needs.

Celestina has a laundry brush business. She buys several pieces of fishing nets then cuts and makes them into laundry brush nets. Most Filipino households don't own a washing machine. They manually wash their clothes and use a laundry net to thoroughly clean and brush the stains from the clothes. Their laundry net is replaced almost every week. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 700 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Celestina is requesting a 19,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy additional fishing nets to make more laundry brush nets. She thanks God and you in advance for both the financial help that will be extended to her and a good return on her investment which will surely help cover their daily expenses.

Celestina hopes to grow her business and prosper in life. She prays for a happy and victorious life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase nets, nylon, and needle and thread to make laundry brush nets to sell.

loans.name: Jairo De Jesus

texts.es:
Jairo con 49 años de edad es casado y padre de 5 hijos a los cuales adora con toda su existencia. Toda su vida fue criado en el campo, donde ha realizado actividades agropecuarias la mayor parte de su vida.  

Actualmente posee un cultivo de papa y complementa con la producción de leche, de algunas vacas que son de su propiedad, tanto la cosecha de papa, como los litros de leche que ordeña a diarios, son vendidos en el mercado de El Carmen De Viboral, así logra obtener los recursos suficientes para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar. 

Jairo es un hombre serio, responsable, comprometido con su familia y su trabajo, por ello siempre quiere seguir avanzando es busca de un futuro mejor, por esta razón solicita un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas como abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas con el fin de continuar con el cuidado de sus cultivos y poder sacar una cosecha en óptimas condiciones; todo esto le ayudará a seguir adelante, mejorando poco a poco su nivel de vida y la de sus hijos, a los cuales les podrá ofrecer mejor educación para que tengan un futuro próspero y lleno de éxitos.
texts.en:
Jairo, 49, is the married father of five children, who he adores with his entire being. He has spent all of his life in the countryside, where he was raised. He has been a farmer for most of his life.

He currently grows a grip of potatoes. He also produces milk. He owns a few dairy cows in addition to his potato crops. He milks them daily and sells gallon of milk in the markets of El Carmen de Viboral. He manages to earn sufficient resources for the daily sustenance of his home. 

Jairo is a serious, responsible man committed to his family and his work. He has always wanted to progress. He is looking for a better future, therefore, he is requesting a loan to invest in agricultural inputs such as fertilizers and pesticides in order to continue to care for his crops so that he can reap an optimal harvest. This will help him progress, gradually improving his family’s standard of living, especially for his children, which can offer them a better education to have a prosperous and successful future.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs for his potato crops

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
As a parent of two children, Rosario works hard to support her family.

She has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice. Rosario is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy abaca fiber and other items for her abaca weaving business.

Rosario has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream, which is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy abaca fiber and other items for her business

loans.name: Alix Eugenia

texts.es:
Alix encuentra en su tienda y sus pollos esa oportunidad que siempre ha soñado de poder pagar una educación de calidad para sus hijos y tener el sustento diario para sobrevivir.

Hoy en día se siente muy orgullosa de lo que ha podido construir hasta ahora gracias a su dedicación, esfuerzo y trabajo duro.

Solicita un crédito para compra los materiales necesarios para la adecuación del galpón de sus pollos, además de comprar algunos pollos para la cría y gallinas ponedoras.

Es una actividad realizada con todo el cariño y empeño que solo una madre puede tener.
texts.en: Alix found in her store and with her chickens, the opportunity she had always dreamed of, being bale to pay for a quality education for her children and make the daily sustenance to survive.Today she is very proud of what she has created up to now thanks to her dedication, efforts and hard work. She is requesting a loan to buy the materials needed to re-fit her chicken coop as well as buy some chickens to raise and laying hens. This is a business done with care and determination that only a mother can have.

loans.use: to buy the materials needed to re-fit her chicken coop and buy some chickens and laying hens.

loans.name: José Adrian

texts.es:
José tiene 39 años de edad estudió Mecánica Automotriz, está casado y tiene 4 hijos de los cuales solo 3 estudian, su esposa es ama de casa y cuida de sus hijos.

Desde muy pequeño, José se ha dedicado a trabajar en el cultivo de café, además tiene varios años trabajando como motorista haciendo viajes a personas que lo solicitan.

Él necesita este crédito para pagar mozos que le ayuden a cavar la tierra para sembrar las plantas de café.

Él sueña con que sus hijos sean trabajadores y es por eso que está inculcándoles buenos valores.
texts.en:
José is 39 years old. He studied to be an automotive mechanic. He is married and has 4 children, three of which are in school. His wife is a homemaker and takes care of their children.

From the time he was young, José has been working in the cultivation of coffee. He has also worked for several years as a driver, making trips for people who request his services. He needs this loan to pay porters to help him prepare his land to plant his coffee crops. He dreams that his children will be hardworking, which is why he is instilling them with good values.

loans.use: to pay for the preparation of his coffee plants

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
This woman's name is Michelle, and she is 26, and a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ariel, a gardener, and they have a child who is still in the elementary level in school. Michelle manages their household while operating the business, in order to augment their income and meet their everyday expenses

She has an ornamental plant business. She grows garden plants that are native to the Philippines like ylang-ylang, golden shower and dahlias, and also a variety of hanging plants and other specimens. Her regular customers are local tourists, neighbors and the nearby community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,500 in sales every day.

To help her expand her farm, she is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan which she will use to buy fertilizer, gardening tools and various kinds of garden seedlings to grow healthy ornamental plants. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Michelle thanks God for the financial help that will be given to her, and for a good return on her investment, as it will surely help to cover their daily needs and to fund her child's education. She dreams of expanding her ornamental plant farm, and her aim is to complete the construction of her house. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members*  to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizers, gardening tools and pots for her ornamental plant business.

loans.name: Rukhshona Group

texts.en:
This is Rukhshona Group. It is composed of Ruzigul and Latofat. They live in the city of Kulob with their families. Ruzigul is 55 while Latofat is 32 years old, and they are related. 

Together, Ruzigul and Latofat are engaged in sewing on the same sewing machine. Through their work, they earn their livings and are very happy. 

Since they have only one sewing machine, which is also very old, they want to buy a new one. If they were to buy another machine, their work would be easier and they would be able to sew more dresses and earn more income. 

Their main problem is lack of capital. For this reason Ruzigul and Latofat have applied for a loan. They hope for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is grateful that he was previously granted a 50,000 PHP loan which he used to purchase feed and hogs for his hog-raising business. His earnings helped support his family, and he was able to also buy scrap materials to resell to factories as his second business, as shown in his photo above.

Jonathan would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy baby pigs and feed so he can raise healthy hogs for resale. He thanks God and you in advance for both the financial help that will be given him and for a good return on his investments which will surely cover his family's daily expenses and his child's education costs. 

Jonathan aims to grow his backyard business. He dreams of having a full family and hopes to send his child to college. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members weekly to share stories of his work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase feed and additional hogs.

loans.name: Luis Bernardo

texts.es:
Luis, con 60 años de edad, es un hombre casado. 
Nació y se crió en el campo, donde aprendió las labores agrícolas al lado de su padre; gracias a ello, hoy en día tiene cultivos de frijol, cuya cosecha es vendida y de esta manera obtiene los recursos para llevar el alimento a su hogar. 
El prestatario es un hombre pujante, luchador, dedicado a su familia y a su trabajo, eso lo motiva para trabajar largas jornadas y tratar de salir adelante; día a día lucha para sobrepasar los obstáculos que se le presentan, ha pasado por situaciones económicas difíciles debido al bajo precio del frijol en el mercado, lo que afecta el precio de su producto. 

Luis solicita su crédito en la Corporación Interactuar para invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas (abono, fertilizantes, pesticidas), con el fin de darle continuidad a su negocio y preparar sus cultivos para cosechar un producto de muy buena calidad.

Luis sueña con mejorar sus cultivos, ampliarlos para obtener de estos una buena renta mensual.
texts.en:
Luis is 60 years old and married. He was born and raised in the country where he learned agricultural labor at the side of his father. Thanks to this today he has beans crops, whose harvests he sells and in this manner obtains the resources to provide food for his household.

The borrower is a forceful man, a fighter, dedicated to his family and his work. This motivates him to work long days and try to get ahead, day by day striving to overcome the obstacles that occur. He has had some difficult economic times due to the low price of beans in the market, which affects the price of his product.

Luis is requesting a loan from the Interactuar Corporation to invest in the purchase of agricultural inputs (manure, fertilizer and pesticides). He has a goal of continuing his business and preparing his crops to harvest a high quality product. Luis dreams of improving his crops, expanding them to obtain a good monthly income from them.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs (manure, fertilizer and pesticides).

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru: Гулахор 26 летняя не замужняя девушка. Она жительница района Рудаки. На районе Гулбахор проживает вместе двумя братьями и матерью. Гулбахор самостоятельная и целеустремленная девушка. Она предоставляет услуги портнихи у себя дома более 10 лет. Гулбахор опытная швея своей работе. У нее имеется ученики, которые они помогают Гулбахору на работе. Гулбахор всегда старается зарабатывать и помочь родителям обеспечить семью. Ее доходы от швейной деле. Сейчас Гулбахор решила расширить деятельность. Она надеется с увеличением деятельностью увеличиться доход, и такими планами Гулбахор обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en: Gulbahor is a 26-year-old unmarried lady. She is a resident of the Rudaki region. Gulbahor lives with her two brothers and her mother. Gulbahor is an independent and ambitious woman. She has been providing her services as a seamstress from her home for more than ten years. Gulbahor is an experienced in sewing work. She has students who help Gulbahor in her work. Gulbahor always tries to make money and help her family in providing for the family. Her income comes from the sewing business. Now Gulbahor has decided to expand her business. She hopes that increasing her business will increase her income, and with such plans Gulbahor has applied for a loan.

loans.use: to expand her sewing business and increase her income.

loans.name: Mamlakat

texts.en:
Mamlakat is a hardworking woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1971, and she lives in a remote district with her family. She is a widow and has two children. 

Mamlakat has many years of experience doing business in a vineyard. However a vineyard is seasonal and so additionally, when it is not the planting season in the vineyard, she does business buying and selling vegetables and fruits in a domestic market. 

She has a certificate for keeping and planting a vineyard. Each season she attracts a lot of customers because of her vines and grapes. This coming season she wants to increase her working capital in her vineyard, so she has requested a loan from Kiva lenders to buy fertilizer, seeds to plant and natural chemicals for a new harvest. She hopes to have a good harvest and the best quality grapes.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds to plant and natural chemicals for a new harvest in her vineyard

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
For a year now, Juditha has run a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells commodities ranging from canned goods to cooking oil, soft drinks, chips, powdered soap and many others. She is a 41-year-old married woman with five children aged 2 to 20 years. She also engages in farming and grows rice.

Juditha has requested a loan to buy stock for the store, piglets and fertilizers for the farm. These purchases are very essential in augmenting her livelihood. With these, she can now improve her sales and start to settle her obligation.

In the future, she dreams of expanding her business to make it productive and to continue supporting her growing children.

loans.use: to buy stock for the store, piglets and fertilizers for the farm

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
As a married mother of 7 children, Fe works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, though she also earns additional income from buying and selling fish. 

Fe is borrowing 23,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation so she can buy additional fishing nets for her fishing business. She has successfully repaid her previous loan, and she is now ready to take her next loan to further build her businesses. 

Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets.

loans.name: Shahloi

texts.ru: Шахлои молодая, красивая и активная девушка. Ей всего 21 лет. Она не замужем. Шахлои на районе Яван живет вместе младшим братом и матерью.  2 года назад Шахлои научилась  кроить и шить женскую одежду, и по сей день продолжает свое любимое дело. Она быстро освоила все навыки, чтобы скорее начать зарабатывать и улучшить условия жизни семью. Шахлои просит кредит для купли новую швейную машинку модели «YAMATA», чтобы ускорить процесс работы и привлечь больше клиентов. В будущем у Шахлои мечта стать хорошем  портнихой.
texts.en: Shahloi is a young, beautiful and active woman. She is just 21 years old. She is unmarried. Shahloi lives with her younger brother and mother in the Yavan region. Two years ago, Shahloi learned how to cut and sew women's clothes, and continues doing this favorite work to this day. She quickly mastered all the skills in order to start earning and to improve her family's living conditions. Shahloi is asking for a loan to buy a new Yamata brand sewing machine in order to speed up her work and attract more clients. In the future Shahloi's dream is to become a good seamstress.

loans.use: to buy a new Yamata brand sewing machine.

loans.name: Ruhsatoi

texts.en:
Ruhsatoi is a hardworking woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1976. She is living in a remote district with her family. She is married and lives happily with her family. 

For more than three years, she has been trading in the domestic market. She is planning to buy furniture and appealed to IMON for a loan. This loan will help Ruhsatoi to do business and earn money to cover family expenditures such as food and clothing. She awaits Kiva lenders' kindness.

loans.use: to buy furniture to sell

loans.name: Zulhiya

texts.ru: Это Зулхия. Она из района Яван. Ей 39 лет. Зулхия семейная женщина. Ее муж занимается земледелием в родном районе. Дети еще маленькие. У нее прекрасная и не большая семья. Зулхия очень трудолюбивая и честная женщина. Зулхия любить растение, и по этой причине она выбрала растениеводство. Она занята своей любимой делом уже 5 лет. Ей на работе помогает муж. Зулхия хочет готовить почву земли для посева урожай. Ей нужно минеральные удобрения для обработки землю. Минеральные удобрения помогает получить богатый и качественный урожай. Зулхия просит кредит для приобретения минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: This is Zulhiya. She is from the Yavan region. She is 39 years old. Zulhiya is a married woman. Her husband is a farmer in his native region. Their children are still small. She has a wonderful little family. Zulhiya is a very hard-working and honest woman. Zulhiya likes plants, and so she has chosen crop farming. She has been engaged in her favorite business for the last five years. Her husband helps her in her work. Zulhiya wants to prepare a plot of land for sowing crops. She needs artificial fertilizer in order to treat the soil. Artificial fertilizer will help her to get a rich, good quality harvest. Zulhiya is asking for a loan in order to buy the artificial fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy artificial fertilizer and treat her land with it.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita works hard to support her family. She has a pig fattening business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling recycled materials. 

Estelita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to improve her pig fattening business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Estelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream, which is to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Luz Eneida

texts.es:
Luz Eneida es una mujer de 41 años de edad que se ha desempeñado gran parte de su vida como panadera, trabajando en negocios parecidos, hasta que se tomó el atrevimiento de iniciar su propia empresa, en la foto pueden ver la maquinaria con la que cuenta un horno, en el realiza ricas preparaciones a base de mucho queso que han gustado a sus clientes, este trabajo lo hace con amor porque sabe que ha representado la mejora continua de la calidad de vida para su familia conformada por su pareja y sus 4 hijos, dos mujeres de 19 y 16 y dos hombres de 13 y 6 años de edad, sus hijos representa todo para ella, su meta es que estudien se capaciten y se conviertan en unos profesionales o personas de bien, son su mayor orgullo.

Ella es una madre amorosa, responsable y protectora se empeña tanto en mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia que en vista de que ve, que los recursos no alcanza para la consecución de sus sueños busca la manera de ganar entradas extras de dinero, por ello quiere iniciar una tienda de abarrotes que complemente sus servicios de panadería.

Como no cuenta con el capital quiere solicitar un préstamo el cual invertirá en la compra de vitrinas, estanterías, abarrotes, pollo, productos de aseo personal, y así iniciar sus caminos como vendedora de abarrotes, donde tendrá gran ayuda de su hija mayor.
texts.en:
Luz Eneida is a 41-year-old woman who has spent a great part of her life as a baker. She has now had the boldness to start her own business. In the photo, you can see her machinery: she has an oven where she makes delicious cheese-based foods that her clients have loved. She does her work with love because she knows that the business has provided a good quality of life for her family: her partner and four children. She has two daughters ages 16 and 19, and two sons ages 6 and 13. Her children are her all. Her goal is for them to study, get training, and to become professionals and good people. They are her greatest pride.
She is a loving, responsible, and protective mother. She works so hard to improve their quality of life. She sees that she doesn't have the resources to reach her dreams, so she is looking for a new source of income. For this reason, she wants to start a grocery store to complement her bakery.
As she does not have the capital for this, she wants to request a loan to invest in the purchase of display cases, stands, groceries, chicken, and toiletries. This is her first step as a grocery store owner. Her eldest daughter will help her greatly in this business.

loans.use: to buy display cases, stands, groceries, chicken, and toiletries to start her grocery store.

loans.name: Delcy

texts.es:
Ni el alto costo de los insumos ni la competencia que se vive en sector porcicola, hacen que Delcy se rinda en el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.

Delcy es una madre de tres hijos que trabaja fuertemente en beneficio de estos, pudiendo así darles el sustento y educación que necesitan sin descuidar en ningún momento el amor y el cuidado que una madre puede ofrecer.

Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de cerdos de levante para capitalizar su negocio, ya que es este su único medio de trabajo y supervivencia.

Con este crédito podrá sacar adelante a su familia y su actividad.
texts.en:
Neither the high cost of supplies nor the competition in the pork sector will prevent Delcy from achieving her goals and dreams.
Delcy is a mother of three. She works hard for them, to give them an education and to provide for them without ever neglecting to provide the love and care of a mother.
She is requesting a loan for the purchase of hogs to raise for her business. This is her only work and source of income.
With this loan, she will be able to support her family and succeed in her business.

loans.use: to buy hogs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase grains

loans.name: Sandra Yesenia

texts.es: Sandra es una joven trabajadora que cuenta con 37 años de edad y vive junto a sus 2 hijas una de 2 años y una de 4 meses de edad, a las que está sacando adelante como madre soltera. Sandra se dedica a la corta de jocotes y plátanos, los cuales vende después en el mercado municipal por mayoreo, lo que le permite llevar el sustento diario. Sandra no cuenta con terrenos de cultivo, pero compra el derecho de corte, con lo que se gana la vida, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI el cual invertirá en compra de derecho de corte de jocotes y plátanos, para venderlos por mayoreo y de esta manera seguir sacando adelante a sus hijas con su negocio de venta de jocotes y plátanos.
texts.en: Sandra is a young 37-year-old worker who lives with her two daughters, ages 2 years and 4 months. She is supporting them as a single mother. She cuts jocotes and plantains to sell in the wholesale market. This allows her to support her family. Sandra does not have land to cultivate; she buys the right to cut. This is how she makes a living. She is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of cutting rights for plantains and jocotes so that she can sell them wholesale and continue to support her daughters.

loans.use: to buy cutting rights for jocotes and plantains.

loans.name: Ligia Elena

texts.es:
Ligia tiene 32 años de edad es divorciada tiene dos hijos vive con ellos en Guaranda provincia de Bolivar.
Ella tiene una tienda de abastos, solicita el credito para la compra de productos para aumentar el negocio ya que es la unica actividad que realiza, las compras realiza en Ambato en el mercado mayorista, su sueño es comprarse un carro para asi salir a verder los abastos en las comunidades e incrementar su negocio, en su tiempo libre le gusta escuchar música.
texts.en:
Ligia is 32 and divorced. She has two children and lives with them in Guaranda, Bolivar province.
She has a grocery store and is requesting a loan to purchase products for her business. This is her sole source of income. She makes her purchases in Ambato at the wholesale market. Her dream is to buy herself a car for selling her products in the nearby communities, thus increasing her income.
In her free time she enjoys listening to music.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items.

loans.name: Maria Graciela

texts.es:
María es una mujer soltera, no tiene hijos ni pareja, es independiente se desempeña como confeccionista a terceros, una empresa con la cual sostiene sus gastos y busca mejorar sus condiciones de vida continuamente, genera un empleo de tiempo completo, ella es muy buena jefe, da incentivos, alimento y trata de pagarle justamente para que su empleada siempre este contenta trabajando con ella, una metodología que le ha servido bastante para crear un vínculo muy sólido con su empleada.

Ella aprendió de la confección gracias a unas clases que pago, desde entonces se ha ingeniado la manera de conseguir sus clientes, mostrando sus trabajos y la calidad de sus productos terminados.

Su gran sueño es comprar una vivienda propia, dejar de pagar arriendo y tener en esta un taller por lo menos con 10 operarias, comprar carro, viajar sueños de una mujer libre que pelea por su futuro.

María se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual quiere invertir en la compra de insumos de confección, mantenimiento de máquinas, el préstamo será muy importante, ya que sus máquinas en el momento presentan molestias que si no se atienden pueden generar un daño a futuro mayor y estaría en compromiso su puntualidad de entrega en los pedidos, este préstamo ayudara María a generar confianza en los clientes y agrado con la empresa.
texts.en:
María is a single woman with no children. She is independent and she works as a seamstress. Her business covers her costs. She is continually looking to improve her living conditions. She has a full-time employee. She is a very good boss and gives incentives and food. She tries to pay fairly so that her employee will always be happy to work for her. This method has served her well and created a solid bond with her employee.
Maria learned sewing from some classes she invested in. She has followed up with her clients, showing off her work and the quality of her finished product.
Her greatest dream is to buy her own home, to stop paying rent and to have a workshop with at least ten operators. She wants to buy a car and travel; these are the dreams of a free woman who is working for her future.
Maria is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of sewing supplies and machine maintenance. This loan is very important, because her machines are having problems at the moment, which if left unattended will create damage in the future and compromise the punctuality of her orders. This loan will allow Maria to generate client confidence and trust in her business.

loans.use: to purchase sewing supplies and repair her machines.

loans.name: Janine Grace

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Janine Grace works hard to support her family.

She has a retail charcoal business in the Philippines, and also earns income from rice farming and rice retailing. Janine Grace is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Janine Grace has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Samar

texts.en:
Samar`s story is one of an ambitious and patient woman. She is a 46-year-old married woman with three children either in school or university. 
Although she worked as an employee in public security, Samar thought she could and should do more to support her husband and their family financially. She then made the choice to open her own coffee shop, and that was just the start. Samar retired from her work, and she opened another business, which is a laundry. 

Samar wants to be a productive woman and be an example of those women who work and get a salary. Because she hopes to be one of the success stories, she needs to expand her work. Therefore, she applied for a loan to help her develop her laundry. She will buy new supplies and a new washer.

loans.use: to develop her laundry sevice by funding new supplies and a new washer

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as determined. She operates a retail business where she sells soft drinks. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. 

Joyce will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of soft drinks. Her business goal is to have a bigger shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of soft drinks

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy different types of potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es:
Maria, a sus 20 años de edad es una mujer con visión, emprendedora y muy activa; por falta de experiencia laboral le ha sido difícil conseguir oportunidades de trabajo, por lo cual ha decidido iniciar su propio negocio de venta de mercancía y productos Amway, para lo cual requiere el crédito, con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de surtido al por mayor (cremas corporales, productos de aseo personal, entre otros) con el fin de aprovechar los descuentos que le ofrecen y así tener variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes que inicialmente serían familiares, vecinos y amigos del sector.

Con esto podrá obtener ingresos para aportar al sustento de su hogar y podrá invertir más en su negocio así, podrá ir avanzando para convertirse en una líder del negocio, ser altamente productiva y muy competitiva a nivel comercial, así podrá mejorar su nivel de ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is 20 years old and is a woman with a vision. She is an entrepreneur and very active, but because of her lack of professional experience, it has been difficult for her to find work opportunities and so she has decided to start her own business selling Amway merchandise and products. To do this, she needs a loan, so that she can invest it in buying wholesale stock (body creams, personal hygiene products etc) so she can take advantage of the discounts that they offer and have a variety of products to offer her clients, who will at first be made up of her family, neighbours and friends in the area. 

By doing this, she will be able to make earnings to contribute to supporting the household as well as investing more in her business. By keeping developing to become a leader in the business, being highly productive and very competitive at a business level, she will improve her level of investments and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale stock (body creams, personal hygiene products etc)

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar, de 58 años de edad, solo estudio hasta quinto grado, debido a la pobreza no pudo continuar en la escuela, él tenia que trabajar para ayudar en los gastos del hogar; hoy en día está acompañado y su pareja se dedica al cuidado del hogar, tienen 10 hijos, pero seis ya tienen sus propios hogares y 4 están en la casa.

Oscar, se dedica a la agricultura y la ganadería desde su juventud, este oficio lo aprendió gracias a su papá, debido a que no estudio, no tuvo más opciones y el deseo de él era sacar adelante a su familia, ahora siembra maíz, pipían y maicillo, su cultivo lo siembra a medio kilómetro de su casa y su horario de trabajo comienza a las 4:00 a.m. porque se levanta temprano para ordeñar  unas vacas que tiene y luego las conduce al potrero, donde aprovecha a quedarse trabajando en el cultivo hasta las 12:00 a.m. y por la tarde recoge su ganado ara que tome agua y para que coma, sus días son muy agitados pero está contento con Dios.

El crédito que está solicitando es para comprar, semilla, abono, y preparar la tierra donde sembrara maíz y maicillo. 

Su sueño es, ver a su hija convertirse en una doctora y ver que cada hijo tenga su propia casa y su propio ganado.
texts.en:
Oscar is 58 years old. He only studied until the fifth grade as due to poverty he could not continue school. He had to work to help with the household expenses. Now he is accompanied and his partner takes care of the household chores. They have ten children but six of them already have their own homes and four of them are at home.

Oscar has been working in agriculture and livestock since he was young. He learned this work thanks to his father. Since he couldn’t study, he didn’t have other options, and since his desire was to support his family now he plants corn, squash and sorghum. He plants his crops a half of a kilometer from his home and he starts work at 4:00AM because he gets up early to milk some cows he has. Later he leads them to pasture where he takes advantage of staying to work with the crops until 12:00. In the afternoon he rounds up his cattle and gives them food and water to eat and drink. His days are hectic but he is happy with God.

The loan he is requesting is to buy seed and fertilizer, and to prepare the land where he grows corn and sorghum. 

His dream is to see his daughter become a doctor and see each of his children have their own house and their own cattle.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer and to prepare the land where he grows corn and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself as determined. He operates a carpentry business where he makes sofa sets, chairs, tables and other items. He has been involved in this business for 20 years. His business is located in a strategic place and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge as inadequate working capital. 

Joseph will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more stock of carpentry materials. His business goal is to open another business outlet within five years. This is his sixth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of carpentry materials

loans.name: Rubel Divier

texts.es:
Rubel un humilde agricultor que cada mañana sale a trabajar en su campo, dedicado en pleno a su trabajo, este hombre solo piensa en progresar y entregar un buen producto pues sabe que muchas personas lo consumen y por ello cada gota de sudor que sale de su frente es el empeño que pone para que su productos salgan puros y de calidad, vive con su madre (Ver Foto) y es la persona a la cual le debe todo en su vida.

Como todo buen agricultor, quiere siempre implementar arreglos y mejoras para a sus cultivos pero sabe que estos arreglos o implementaciones son muy costosos por esta razón solicita un crédito para adecuar sus campos comprar insumos como abono, pesticidas, riegos, herbicidas, entre otros, con el único propósito de mejorar su manera de cultivar, hacer más fácil su trabajo y darle al cliente final un producto de calidad
texts.en:
Rubel is a humble farmer who sets out to work in his fields every morning. He is completely dedicated to his work. This man only thinks about moving forward and delivering good products, since he knows that many people consume them. Therefore, every drop of sweat that falls from his forehead is proof of the effort that he puts forth to ensure that he produces pure, quality products. He lives with his mother (see photo), and she is the person to whom he owes everything in his life.

As a good farmer, he always wants to perform fixes and improvements for his crops, but he knows that these fixes and improvements are very expensive. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to better his fields. He will buy supplies such as fertilizers, pesticides, irrigation systems, and herbicides, among others, for the only purpose of improving his cultivation technique, making his work easier, and giving his final customers quality products.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as fertilizers, pesticides, irrigation systems, and herbicides, among others.

loans.name: Oscar De Jesus

texts.es:
El señor Oscar es un veterano de mil batallas vividas a lo largo de su vida, vive en el municipio de Uramita solo pero tiene una hija.

El es un hombre muy trabajador y desde hace algún tiempo viene trabajando en el negocio de la venta de granos. 
Trabaja todos los días durante 6 horas.

Su negocio consiste en la compra y venta de frijol, garbanzo, lenteja, arveja, entre otros granos. 

Manifiesta que es un negocio muy difícil a su edad.
El solicita un préstamo para compra de granos al por mayor para abastecer asi su inventario y poder mejorar sus ingresos.

El préstamo le dará la oportunidad de capitalizar su negocio y de darle un impulso considerable a su actividad, permitiéndole obtener recursos para la universidad de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Oscar is a veteran of the many battles that he has fought throughout his life. He lives in the Uramita district of Columbia and has one daughter. 

He is a very hard-working man and for some time he has been working in the seed-selling business. His business consists of buying and selling beans, chickpeas, lentils, peas etc. He points out that his business is very difficult for someone of his age.  

He is requesting a loan to buy wholesale seeds to stock his inventory and be able to make a better profit. The loan will give him the opportunity to capitalise his business and give his work a considerable impulse, allowing him to save up enough money to send his children to university.

loans.use: buy wholesale seeds to stock his inventory and improve his profits.

loans.name: Andrés

texts.es:
Andrés de 47 años de edad, no pudo estudiar debido al nivel pobreza que vivía en ese entonces, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y con ella ha procreado una hija.


Andrés se dedica a la agricultura desde muy pequeño, ya que su padre le enseñó dicha actividad, además tiene otra actividad lo cual es la crianza de ganado, y le sirve para obtener leche para la alimentación familiar.

Él necesita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes y abonos para el cultivo de maíz.


Él sueña con tener un negocio ganadero bien establecido, para mejorar sus ingresos y poder superarse.
texts.en:
Andrés is 47 years old, he could not study because he lived in poverty at the time. He is married and his wife works maintaining their house, together they have a daughter. 

Andrés has earned a living from agriculture since he was little, his father taught him what he knows. He also raises cattle, from which he uses the milk in order to feed his family. 

He needs the loan in order to buy fertilisers to cultivate maize. His dream is to have a well established cattle business, in order to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers to cultivate maize

loans.name: Julian Esteban

texts.es:
Julián es un hombre soltero de 27 años de edad, tiene un pequeño de 3 años, cada semana le manda dinero a la madre para el sostenimiento, alimentación y educación del niño.

Julián es un cerrajero todo lo relacionado con acero él es el hombre, tiene su negocio ubicado en uno de los barrios de Medellín, trabaja por contratos o por encargos que le piden en su barrio, su insumo principal es el taladro, es la herramienta que usa en cada trabajo que realiza.

Julián vive actualmente con sus padres, no solo apoya a su hijo si no que es la fuente principal de ingresos en su casa, él paga la cuenta de servicios y la alimentación,  igualmente paga el arrendo de su local, es un hombre muy juicioso que trabaja siempre para mejorar.

Su principal menta es comprar una vivienda propia, agradece mucho a sus padres por acogerlo pero quiere conseguir por sus propios méritos su vivienda propia.

Julián solicita un préstamo para la compra de un taladro inalámbrico esta herramienta por su usabilidad le traerá muchos beneficios, comprara acero y hierro que son sus insumos principales para el trabajo.
texts.en:
Julian is a single 27 year old man, he has a 3 year old child and every week he sends money to the child's mother in order to help to care for, provide food and for the education of the child. 

Julian is a locksmith and works with anything related to steel, his business is located in the neighbourhoods of Medellin. He works by means of contracts or when he is commissioned by someone in his neighbourhood. His main tool is his drill, which he uses every day to work. 

At the moment he lives with his parents, he not only helps his child but is also the main source of income in his household. He pays the bills and also for the food,  he also pays to lease his workshop. He is a very wise man that always works to improve.

His main goal is to buy his own house, he is very grateful for his parents for putting up with him but he wants to work for his own achievements and his own house. 

Julian is asking for a loan to purchase a wireless drills, it would benefit him very much due to its usability, and also to purchase steel and iron which are essential for his work.

loans.use: to buy a cordless drill because it will be highly beneficial for him, he also wants to purchase iron and steel which are the man inputs for his work

loans.name: Philes

texts.en:
Philes is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells flour, cooking fat, sugar, salt and other items. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

Philes will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, cooking fat, salt, flour and other items. 

She hopes that in the future she will be successful. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, cooking fat, salt, flour and other items

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail business where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for five years. His primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

Joseph will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. 

He hopes that in the future he will be successful. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann is a Kiva borrower. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be transport. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable business. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of potatoes, bananas and other vegetables

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Elizabeth works hard to support her family. She has a food production business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a coffee shop.  

Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 48 years old and married. She has eight children.

Rita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Rita has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for twenty years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Rita aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lilly

texts.en:
Lilly is 50 years old and married.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell dry goods business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of dry goods to sell like umbrellas, shirts, shoes, etc.

Lilly has borrowed and paid 1 loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell dry goods business for 1 year and also earns an income from farming rice.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of dry goods to sell like umbrellas, shirts, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 35 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Lilibeth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items of groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for one year.

She would like to save money to provide and secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items of groceries to sell

loans.name: Marinella

texts.es:
Mariela es una mujer luchadora, trabajadora, verraca, ella se separó de su esposo quedando como madre cabeza de familia, en un hogar conformado por ella y sus 4 hijos, su negocio es la cría de aves, tiene unas buenas cocheras, con muy buena distribución, el negocio lo inicio en el año 2014, ante una necesidad latente de generar recursos para llevar el pan a su mesa.

En el momento Mariela presenta una necesidad, el mantenimiento de su familia le ha costado y su negocio no da la rentabilidad que ella desea, puesto que la venta pollos por la competencia ha mermado, pero este es el negocio en el que deposita todas sus esperanzas y a este le apuesta todo.

Quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de 200 pollos para abastecer sus cocheras, realizar algunas reparaciones y comprar concentrado que es el alimento del pollo, lo comprara para 6 meses.
texts.en:
Mariela is a fighter; a hardworking and veracious woman. She separated from her husband and is now the head of the family, which is made up of herself and her 4 children. She has a business breeding birds and she is equipped with some good sheds and a very good distribution. 

She started her business in the year 2014 due to her dire need to make an income to put food on the table. 

At the moment Mariela needs to keep supporting her family but her business doesn't make as much profit as she would like because the chicken sold by the competition is now being sold at a reduced price. However, she has put all her hope and efforts into her business.

She would like to request a loan to buy 200 chickens to stock her sheds, carry out some repairs and buy chicken feed to last for 6 months.

loans.use: to buy 200 chickens to stock her sheds, carry out some repairs and buy chicken feed to last for 6 months.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a married man. He has 6 children with ages ranging from 1 year to 14 years. He describes himself to be reliable. He operates a garage where he repairs motor vehicles. He has been involved in this business for 9 years. His business is located in an area with lots of customers and his primary customers are motor vehicle owners. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. He will use the KES 120,000 loan to buy more motor vehicle repair tools. His business goal is to expand the garage within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be self-sustainable. This is his sixth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully He will use the anticipated profits to reinvest in the garage.

loans.use: to buy more motor vehicle repair tools.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en: Henry is a Kiva borrower. He has 5 children. He describes himself to be committed. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using a motor vehicle. He has been involved in this business for 7 years. His business is located in a suitable area and his primary customers are the general public. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to service and maintain his motor vehicle. His business goal is to expand the business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to service and maintain his motor vehicle.

loans.name: Maximiliano Antonio

texts.es: Maximiliano de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos (maíz, frijol y maicillo) tiene más de 25 años de dedicarse  a esa actividad la época en que siembra es en invierno y comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde reside, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y así poder tener una mejor producción de sus cosechas para darle  su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maximiliano is 47 years old and lives in his own house with his family. He works growing basic grains (corn, beans and sorghum). He has been doing this for 25 years. He plants in the winter and sells his product in the areas surrounding where he lives. He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, pest control, etc. In this way he will have greater production in his harvest to provide his family with a better quality of living.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Brian

texts.en: Brian is a married man. He has 4 children. He describes himself to be committed. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using a motor vehicle. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a suitable area and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be changes in fuel prices. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to service and maintain his motor vehicle. His business goal is to own a bus within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to service and maintain his motor vehicle.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a Kiva borrower. He has 3 children. He describes himself to be committed. He operates a retail business where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a suitable area and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be transportation costs. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. His business goal is to own a large scale business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a married woman. She describes herself to be trustworthy. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes, curtains, duvets and other items. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes, curtains, and duvets. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved living standards. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes, curtains, and duvets.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a Kiva borrower. He operates a farm where he grows tea. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. 

Patrick will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of tea to sell. 

He hopes that in the future he will be successful. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tea to sell

loans.name: Norisa

texts.en:
Her name is Norisa. She is 36 and a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Anthony, a watchman, and has one child. Norisa works hard to provide for the everyday needs of her family.

Norisa has been in the sewing business for a number of years already. She makes dresses, school uniforms and curtains.  She is known to be a good sewer in their area and has grown her customer base through word of mouth. She earns a minimum of PHP 6,000 a month from her services. 

To help her continue and expand her business, she is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan to buy more fabric, thread and other items needed for her sewing business. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. Her earnings are a big help in sustaining her family's daily needs and sending her child to school. 

Norisa aims to grow her business. She dreams of having their own house and being able to travel abroad. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

 *All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabrics to sew clothes and curtains.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a married woman. She has 1 child. She describes herself to be trustworthy. She operates a retail business where she sells bananas, potatoes, onions and other vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of potatoes, bananas and other vegetables. Her business goal is to have a larger grocery store within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of potatoes, bananas and other vegetables.

loans.name: Verlin

texts.en:
Verlin is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase gasoline, fishing net, bamboo, etc for her fishing business.

Verlin has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from a buy-and-sell fish business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline, fishing net, bamboo, etc

loans.name: Maria Neressa

texts.en:
Maria Neressa is 45 years old, married, and has eight children.

Maria Neressa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Maria Neressa has borrowed and paid loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from e-loading and a buy-and-sell vegetable business.

Maria Neressa aspires to save money so she could afford her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Ruby works hard to support her family. She has a business selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fish vending. 

Ruby is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables to sell.

Ruby has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, etc for her food vending business.

Jean earns more income from farming rice and a general store. She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, etc

loans.name: Rechel

texts.en:
Rechel is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rechel is 33 years old and has five children who are still in school.

Rechel has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Rechel has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Johnamay

texts.en:
Johnamay is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like farming rice. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Johnamay dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Mailyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Mailyn works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.  

Mailyn is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell for her buy-and-sell rice business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Mailyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell for her business

loans.name: Esha

texts.en:
Esha is married with two school-going children. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operates a khanga (women wrap cloth) selling business, selling from home and door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of a lack of capital to expand her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of khangas to sell. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of khangas (women's wrap cloth) to sell

loans.name: Ana Carolina

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer con toda la energía y disposición para enfrentar el mundo y superarse.

Desea iniciar un negocio de venta ropa, accesorios, cosméticos, entre otros.
Es una mujer muy aplicada tiene deseos de salir adelante y ser profesional.

Solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido al por mayor de jeans, camisetas, accesorios, entre otros.

Con este préstamo puede cumplir su sueño de ser independiente y darle a su familia todo lo que necesiten, además de poder pagar sus estudios y progresar gracias al apoyo de Kiva y la Corporación Interactuar.

Apoya el proyecto de una mujer emprendedora Colombiana!
texts.en: Ana is a woman with total energy and the disposition to face the world and excel. She wants to start a business selling clothing, accessories and cosmetics amongst others.She is very industrious and wants to get ahead and become a professional. She is requesting a loan to buy a variety of jeans, t-shirts and accessories amongst others. With the loan she can fulfill her dream of being independent and provide her family with all they need as well as pay her studies thanks to the support of KIva and the Interactuar Corporation. Support the project of an enterprising Colombian woman!

loans.use: to buy a variety of jeans, t-shirts, accessories and amongst others, wholesale.

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.en:
Elisabeth is 28 years old and she is now applying for a loan of $1,500 to improve her business. She is married and has a food stall.   
She opened her business in 2003 with her own working capital of $70.  She earns a good income from her business.

She will use her loan to buy buffalo meat, pork and chicken.

Elisabeth is a very hard working woman, and doing business has become her regular activity for the past 12 years. She wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: To buy buffalo meat, pork and chicken

loans.name: Shahlohon

texts.en:
Shahlohon is a hardworking woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan into a family of farmers. Shahlohon lives in a remote district with her family. She is married and, for the past six years, has been a librarian in a secondary school. Her husband is a taxi driver. 

Shahlohon is well known among teachers and students. She is a kind, responsible and honest person. She is planning to buy a refrigerator for personal use. The season is warm and her food is spoiling without a refrigerator. She is asking financial support from KIVA lenders and IMON to buy a refrigerator. She awaits KIVA lenders' kindness.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of eleven children, Erlinda works hard to support her family. She has a business making dried fish in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and raising pigs. Erlinda successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to make dried fish.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 8 years, she has had a fishing business in the Philippines. She earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish. 

Victoria successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials such as wood, nails, bamboo, etc. to make a boat for her business. 

Victoria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials such as wood, nails, bamboo, etc. to make a fishing boat

loans.name: Luis Alejandro

texts.es:
Luis en su búsqueda por un futuro prometedor y unas buenas oportunidades para salir adelante, decidió iniciar un negocio que según él le dará todo eso que siempre ha soñado.

Montara un negocio de tienda de abarrotes en su casa en el municipio de Marinilla, con el cual planea sostener a su familia compuesta por su hijo y su esposa.

Su principal dificultad es la falta de capital para trabajar.

Para lograr esto necesita la ayuda de un préstamo con la Corporación Interactuar que le permita comprar un enfriador, estanterías, vitrinas y surtido de productos básicos de la canasta familiar como abarrotes, granos, galletas y otros alimentos para abastecer e iniciar su negocio.

Apoya a los sueños emprendedores de un Colombiano con un préstamo hoy!
texts.en:
In his search for a promising future and some good opportunities to get ahead, Luis decided to open a business that according to him will give him all he ever dreamed of.

He is opening a grocery store in his home in the town of Marinilla with the plans of supporting his family consisting of his son and wife.

His main difficulty is the lack of working capital and to obtain it he needs the help of a loan from the corporation Interactuar so he can buy a cooler, shelves, display cases, and basic food supplies such as groceries, grains, cookies and other food to stock and start his business.

Support the entrepreneurial dreams of a Colombian today!

loans.use: buy a cooler, shelves, display cases, groceries, grains, cookies and other food to stock and start his business.

loans.name: Angie Tatiana

texts.es:
Angie es una joven de 20 años de edad, radiante, bella, con ganas de trabajar, de salir adelante, ella se dedica a la venta de mercancía como ropa, accesorios, lociones, lo hace porque quiere generar sus propios recursos, pagar sus educaciones, aprender a hablar inglés, tiene la determinación de progresar y sacar su familia adelante.

Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar mercancía como lo es ropa para hombre y dama como faldas, Jean, blusas y camisetas, comprar lociones, accesorios como aretes, pulseras, manillas en acero.

Este préstamo le permitirá tener existencias para promocionar sus productos como esta acostumbrada a familiares, amigos, compañeros de estudio y en las calles.
texts.en:
Angie is 20 years old. She is radiant and beautiful, and wants to work and progress in life. She makes a living selling merchandise, such as clothes and lotions because she wants to earn her own income, pay for her education and learn to speak English. She is determined to do well in life and help her family to get ahead.

Angie is applying for a loan in order to buy merchandise, including men's and women's clothes such as skirts, jeans, blouses and shirts, and to buy lotions and accessories such as steel earrings, bracelets, and bangles.

This loan will give Angie what she needs to promote her products to relatives, friends, fellow students, and in the streets.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, including men's and women's clothes such as skirts, jeans, blouses and shirts, and to buy lotions and accessories such as steel earrings, bracelets, and bangles.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos tuvo una infancia ligada al negocio de sus padres una tienda de víveres, él ayudaba en las labores del negocio y creció en cuna de comerciantes y tenderos.  Aprendió todo el manejo de éste formato de negocio por lo que decidió abrir su propia tienda, ubicada en un barrio del municipio de Barranquilla. Carlos está muy consolidado y cuenta con un manejo muy amplio, tiene 2 años de estar funcionando y una experiencia de toda la vida. Sus compras las genera de contado a mayoristas en el centro de la ciudad, es muy cuidadoso con la escogencia de sus proveedores para garantizar una mejor oferta de precios a sus clientes y excelentes márgenes de ganancia.   En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en la compra de víveres como arroz, aceite, panela, azúcar, legumbres, productos lácteos y carnes, para optimizar el inventario, puesto que estos productos son de fácil rotación y consumo. Carlos considera que es muy importante tener bien surtido su negocio para que el cliente encuentre todo en un mismo lugar.  Carlos de 28 años de edad es un comerciante muy organizado y comprometido, sus metas a largo plazo son comprar su casa y su local propio.
texts.en:
Carlos spent his childhood at his parents’ business, a grocery shop. He helped out at the business and grew up surrounded by traders and shopkeepers. He learned how to manage this type of business and therefore decided to open his own shop in the municipality of Barranquilla.

Carlos’ business is well established and well managed. The business has been going two years and is being run with a life time of experience. Carlos buys his products in bulk in cash in the city centre. He is very careful about which suppliers he uses in order to offer his customers good prices, and to earn good profits.

Carlos is currently applying for a Kiva loan, his first through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, in order to buy supplies such as rice, oil, brown sugar loaf, vegetables, dairy products and meat. He wants to increase stock and there is a quick turnover on these goods.

Carlos believes that it is important to have his business well-stocked so that his customers can find everything that they need in the same place.

At 28 years old, Carlos is a very organised and dedicated trader. His long-term goals are to buy a house and to have his own premises.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as rice, oil, brown sugar loaf, vegetables, dairy products and meat.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 38-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She requested a loan for her husband’s green grocery business. He has been selling vegetables for many years; he sells seasonal fresh vegetables in his hometown. He has been using a four wheel manual cart to carry the vegetables from one place to another. Now he has established a shop for selling vegetables, but does not have enough cash in hand to buy the initial inventory to run his shop in a good manner. 

Their young children are growing and their needs as well. To cope with the rapid increase in the school fees, books, utility bills and household expenses, Rukhsana's husband wants to establish his business, but he does not have enough savings to buy initial inventory in the form of seasonal vegetables for his newly opened shop. Therefore, Rukhsana has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy fresh and seasonal vegetables to sell.

loans.use: in purchasing fresh inventory for green grocery shop.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 39 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Erlinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell. She has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothing for her husband's clothing business.

loans.name: Mwanamkuu

texts.en: Mwanamkuu is married and the mother of two school-aged children. She lives in her own house which is equipped with electricity and plumbing. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. She earns a living by selling Khanga (a wrap cloth for women) from her home, door to door and to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge in the seasonality of her business where she lives. She is requesting a loan to buy new bales of Khanga to resell, and decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy bales of cloth for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet metal, 2x4's, nails, and wire to improve her house's sheet metal walls

loans.name: Rossana

texts.en:
Rossana is a married woman with two children, both in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rossana is 38 years old.

Rossana has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a 14,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries like sugar, soap, noodles and other items. Rossana has been in this business for six years. 

In the future, Rossana would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like sugar, soap, noodles and other items.

loans.name: Virginita

texts.en: Virginita, 41, is married with two children, both of whom are in school. For ten years, Virginita has been raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 22,000 PHP loan through Kiva's partner, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. She has borrowed 24 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Virginita would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is 44 years old and married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell.

Geraldine has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Mwanahalima

texts.en:
Mwanahalima is a widowed woman and has been blessed with two children, both of whom attend school. Together with her children, they live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a fish selling business for over five years, selling from her home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish to resell. 

She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish to resell

loans.name: Azhra

texts.en: Azhra is 35 years old poor and poor. Sadly, she and her family live in miserable conditions, and her husband has not yet picked a field to work in and cycles through many different jobs from time to time. A few months ago he was working as a laborer for very low wages. Now he wants to drive a rickshaw which he owns, but cannot do this because the body of the vehicle is damaged. Azhra wants her husband to drive it for a living, and has requested this loan to encourage her husband to get it repaired and work in this business. She hopes that her husband will be happy in this profession and work in it for a long time. She is very grateful for the help she is receiving from Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw body.

loans.name: Maua

texts.en:
Maua is a single woman and has been blessed with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives together with her children in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a fish selling business for over 10 years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil is a 24-year-old married man from Khan Younis city. 

He works as an employee where he gets a low income. This income is not enough to cover all his family's needs. Khalil wants to find an additional job to improve his family living conditions.

Khalil took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw to start transferring goods on it. By taking this loan, Khalil's income will increase.

Khalil appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw to start transferring goods on it.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
