As a married parent of two children, Susana works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns income from buying and selling dried fish and running a general store.

Susana has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Susana is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials for her fishing business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her business

loans.name: Bibihafiza

texts.en: Bibihafiza is a generous woman who was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1986. Now she lives in a small town with her husband and two children. She is hardworking and responsible as well as kind. Her husband works seasonally in construction while she is a teacher in a secondary school. Bibihafiza is well known and does her work accurately, but wants to earn additional income by going into agriculture. She has requested this loan from IMON and KIVA to buy livestock. She is grateful for the support she has received.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: May Gemma

texts.en:
May Gemma is 37 years old and married. 

May Gemma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

May Gemma has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, noodles, and other groceries. 

In the future, May Gemma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Roselle

texts.en: Roselle is 25 years old, single and a very hardworking entrepreneur who earns a living by selling fish in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan from NWTF to buy more fish to sell. Roselle has been in this business for two years, and her goal for the future is to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Jarana

texts.en: Jarana is a hardworking entrepreneur and mother of seven children, four of whom are in school. She earns a living by selling seedling trees in the Philippines, and has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 from NWTF to buy new seedlings, fertilizer and plastic containers for her business. She supplements her income by buying and selling dried fish. Jarana dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to send her children to college

loans.use: to purchase new seedlings, fertilizers and plastic container

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en: Jacinta is married and is living in town with her family. Her husband in a farmer. She opened her store in 2009 with her own money, and the store has generated good income for her. A $1500 USD loan is offered to Jacinta to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy rice to sell. After years of business experience, she has been thinking of running a larger business. She is happy with this loan to improve her future living condition.

loans.use: to buy rice to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in sweet bread, cheese, coffee, chocolate, rice, beans, sugar, milk, sweets, etc. for her store

loans.name: Edgar Antonio

texts.es: Edgar cuenta con 43 años de edad, y es un hombre trabajador que vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus 2 hijos de 14 y 12 años de edad, a los que apoya para que estudien, esperando puedan optar a una mejor calidad de vida. Cada día Edgar despierta desde muy temprano para salir a trabajar, ya que desde hace 5 años se desempeña como motorista de una empresa cercana, en la que le tiene mucho aprecio y respeto los cuales se ha ganado por ser muy responsable y atento en su trabajo. La calidad de vida que tiene Edgar no es la que él desea pero poco a poco espera mejorarla, actualmente no cuenta con energía eléctrica, lo que le dificulta a sus hijos tener un mejor desarrollo, por lo que Edgar desea instalarla y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: alambre eléctrico, caja térmica, toma corrientes y poliducto  para instalar energía eléctrica y mejorar el desarrollo de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Edgar is 43 years old. He is a hard-working man who lives with his life companion and their 2 children, who are 14 and 12 years old. He supports them in their studies, hoping that they can achieve a better quality of life.

Every day, Edgar wakes up very early to go to work. For 5 years now, he has made a living as a driver for a nearby company. He is very appreciated and well-respected there, which he has earned by being very responsible and attentive in his work.

The living conditions that Edgar has are not what he wants, but he hopes to change them little by little. Right now he doesn't have electricity, which makes it harder for his children to better themselves. Edgar wants to install electricity, so he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy electric wire, a circuit breaker, power outlets, and polyethylene pipe to install electricity and improve his children's development.

loans.use: to buy electric wire, a circuit breaker, power outlets, and polyethylene pipe to install electricity and improve his children's development

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: María tiene 19 años de edad es soltera vive con sus padres en Guaranda provincia de Bolivar, Ella se dedica a la venta de productos Yanbal que son cosméticos y joyas, solicita el credito para comprar mas productos para asi obtener un capital de trabajo ya que en algunas ocaciones estos productos estan de oferta y eso ella quiere aprovechar y comprar para obtener mas ganancias para no tener que depender de sus padres, los pedidos realiza dos veces al mes, su sueño es llegar a ser una gran empresaria, en su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte y salir a buscar clientas para vender sus productos.
texts.en:
Maria is 19 years old, is single, and lives with her parents in Guaranda in the province of Bolivar. She is dedicated to selling Yanbal products, including cosmetics and jewelry. 

She requests the loan to buy more products. In this way, she will have working capital, since sometimes these products are on sale, and she wants to take advantage and buy products so that she can have more earnings so that she doesn’t have to depend on her parents. She makes orders two times per month. 

Her dream is to become a major businesswoman. In her free time, she likes to play sports and go to find clients to sell her products to.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Diana Patricia

texts.es:
Diana Sonríe por que tiene trabajo, Diana Sonríe porque genera progreso, Diana esta alegre porque su tienda de productos de la canasta familiar ha representado progreso para su familia que se vio afectado al separarse de su esposo quedando como cabeza de familia de dos hijos menores de edad, pero ellos cuentan con una gran mujer que ha dado cuerpo y alma por mantenerlo y darles una buena calidad de vida.

Su única ambición es poder pagar la educación de sus hijos, que ellos sonrían al igual que ella y mejorar su calidad de vida.

En el momento Diana ha logrado consolidar muy bien su negocio y para lograr fidelización de sus clientes quiere tener el servicio de domicilio gratuito, por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar una motocicleta, el principal beneficio es que podrá generar un empleo.
texts.en:
Diana smiles because she has a job. Diana smiles she is making progress. Diana is happy because her grocery store has represented progress for her family that was set back by her separation from her husband. She was left as the head of a family of two small children, but they have in her a great woman who has given her heart and soul to support them and give them a good quality of life.

Her only goal is to pay for the education of her children, so that they can smile as she does and improve their quality of life.

Up to now, Diana has succeeded in establishing her business very well. To gain customer loyalty, she wants to have free home delivery services. She is requesting a loan to buy a motorcycle, the main benefit being that she will be able to create a job.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle, the main benefit being that she will be able to create a job

loans.name: José Carlos

texts.es:
José tiene 29 años de edad, pudo estudiar hasta noveno grado, actualmente está acompañado y su esposa trabaja en un vivero, solamente tiene dos hijos que son menores de edad.

José es quien administra el vivero, él aprendió ese trabajo gracias a sus padres que se dedicaban a lo mismo, ya tiene 8 años como encargado de darle mantenimiento a dicho vivero, además realiza siembra de granos básicos como maíz y frijol.


Él necesita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes y pagar mano de obra para la siembra de granos básicos. 

Él sueña con tener un agroservício que le sirva para obtener más ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Jose is 29 years old. He was able to study until ninth grade. At present, he is in a relationship, and his wife works in a nursery. He only has two children, who are young.

Jose manages the nursery. He learned this work thanks to his parents, who did the same thing. He has already spent 8 years as the manager of this nursery. Additionally, he grows basic grains, such as corn and beans.

He needs the loan to buy fertilizers and to pay workers to sow basic grains.

His dream is to have an agricultural service business, which will help him have a higher income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay workers to sow basic grains.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cashew seeds to store up.

loans.name: Nelsie

texts.en:
Nelsie is a 39-year-old married woman with two children, who are both in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

She has a personal care products business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more personal care products to sell.

Nelsie has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more personal care products to sell

loans.name: John Jairo

texts.es:
John, con 24 años de edad y es soltero
Actualmente se dedica a la venta de mercancía, con esto ha logrado obtener recursos para aportar al sostenimiento de su hogar durante el tiempo que lleva realizando dicha actividad. 

Es un hombre emprendedor, con visión, dedicado y comprometido con su familia y su trabajo, siempre busca oportunidades que le permitan progresar, por esa razón solicita el crédito, con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de mercancía al por mayor como camisetas, jeans, ropa interior, entre otros, para aprovechar los descuentos que le realizan y ofrecer más variedad que satisfaga los gustos y necesidades de sus clientes y así poder tener mejor margen de utilidad por las ventas. 

De esta manera, John podrá avanzar hacia el cumplimiento de su objetivo primordial, que es ampliar su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
John is 24 years old and is single. At present, he is dedicated to selling merchandise. With this, he has succeeded in obtaining resources to support his household during the team that he has been doing this work.

He is an enterprising man with vision. He is dedicated and committed to his family and his work. He always looks for opportunities that will allow him to progress. 

For this reason, he requests the loan, with the goal of investing it in buying more merchandise wholesale, including shirts, jeans, and undergarments, among other things, to take advantage of the discounts and to offer more variety to satisfy the wants and needs of his clients. Thus, he will be able to have a better profit margin for his sales.

In this way, John will be able to advance toward completing his main goal, which is to grow his business and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise wholesale, including shirts, jeans, and undergarments, among other things.

loans.name: Lodely

texts.en:
Lodely is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 38 years old and has two children who are in school.

Lodely has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock of clothes to sell.

Lodely has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Maria Consuelo

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 46 años, casada, con dos hijos y su negocio es la venta de artículos de uso personal y algunos comestibles.

Ella es emprendedora, independiente, generosa, sensible, responsable y trabajadora. 

Su negocio lo desarrolla en el municipio de Argelia; un área estratégica porque tiene un alto flujo comercial; es una vitrina de la producción de la pequeña y mediana empresa, la zona es una muestra del panorama típico comercial e industrial de la ciudad. 

Actividad que realiza en un pequeño espacio en su casa.

Su sueño es incrementar sus ingresos económicos para abrir un almacén, ella desea realizar la compra de lociones, cremas, desodorantes al por mayor con el préstamo solicitado, para ofertar mayor variedad a sus clientes y aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Maria is a 46-year-old woman. She is married, with two children. Her business is selling personal products and some groceries. 

She is enterprising, independent, generous, sensible, responsible, and hard working.

Her business is located in the municipality of Argelia. This is a strategic area, because it has a high commercial flow. It is an example of small- and mid-sized business production. The area is an example of the typical state of commerce and industry in the city.

She does her work in a small space in her house.

Her dream is to increase her income to open a store. With the loan requested, she wants to buy lotions, creams, and deodorants wholesale to offer a better variety to her clients and to increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy lotions, creams, and deodorants wholesale.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 26-year-old single man from Khan Younis city. His father works as an employee where he gets a low income. This income is not enough to cover all the family needs. Mohammad wants to find a job to improve his family's living conditions.

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw to start transferring goods on it. By taking this loan, Mohammad will increase the family income.

Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw to start transferring goods on it

loans.name: Murad

texts.en:
Murad is a 28-year-old single man from Khan Younis city. He works as an employee in the public sector. Murad gets a low income, which is not enough to cover all the family needs. He would like to improve his family's living conditions and buy all that they need.

Murad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water purification machine for the family house. This will enable him to provide clean water for his family.

Murad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for the family house.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 58 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Emily has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries like canned goods, noodles and other groceries.

Emily has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like canned goods, noodles and other groceries.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Lucia works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice and raising pigs. Lucia is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more items to sell like soap, shampoo, canned goods, chips, etc. for her general store business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Lucia has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like soap, shampoo, canned goods, chips, etc.

loans.name: Marta Cecilia

texts.es:
La señora Marta tiene gran experiencia en el área de panadería, hace algún tiempo inicio con su propia panadería que hasta ahora le ha generado muy buenos resultados.

Siempre ha preferido trabajar independiente, trabaja todos los días desde las 8:00 Am hasta las 9:00 Pm

Actualmente necesita un auxilio para aumentar su capital de trabajo comprando ingredientes como harina, queso, levadura, azúcar, entre otros.

El préstamo le permitirá trabajar en unas mejores condiciones y podrá garantizar la calidad de sus preparaciones.

Su mayor sueño es poder tener una gran panadería que surta diferentes tiendas.

Con esta ayuda podrá trabajar de una manera más organizada.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marta has a lot of experience in baking. Some time ago, she started her own bakery, which through this point has generated very good results for her.

She has always preferred to work independently. She works everyday from 8:00am until 9:00pm.

At present, she needs a loan to increase her working capital to buy ingredients, such as flour, cheese, yeast, and sugar, among other things.

The loan will allow her to work in better conditions and will guarantee the quality of her food.

Her big dream is to be able to have a large bakery that supplies different stores.

With this help, she will be able to work in a more organized way.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, such as flour, cheese, yeast, and sugar, among other things.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food, broth, drinks, sweets, etc. to supply his store.

loans.name: Fawziya

texts.en:
Fawziya is a 32-year-old married mother of two children, who has been working selling fresh milk since 2013, to help her husband in increasing their family's living.

Fawziya is a hardworking woman who puts so much effort in increasing her income by developing her business and introducing her customers to new services.

Today, Fawziya is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to start a new business to increase her income. She will buy mobile phone prepaid cards, and start selling them as a first step towards opening her own mobile phone selling shop.

Fawziya is a very supportive wife, mother and a hardworking woman. Her dream of developing her family's living has no limits.

Today, she works by selling fresh milk. Her future plan is to open a mobile phone selling shop.

loans.use: To start a new business through selling mobile phone prepaid cards.

loans.name: Union Y Fuerza Group

texts.es:
Adda es una mujer de 50 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y su negocio es la sastrería.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, constante, optimista, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona sur de la ciudad, la región de mayor industrialización, representada principalmente por la producción agropecuaria y forestal, es la zona más importante de producción hidrocarburífera. Situada a una altura de 437 metros sobre el nivel del mar, de clima cálido tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-34 grados centígrados.
Adda es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello castaño los usa corto tipo melena, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna s el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (al centro, viste solera a rayas horizontales naranja y negro). Su vida la comparte con sus familiares que trabajan, viven en un cuarto propio construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su anhelo de superación la impulsó a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; taller de frenos, venta de comida, arreglo de uñas, venta de sábanas, venta de zapatillas, panadería y venta de productos lácteos, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus negocios. Su negocio es la sastrería; a través de una entrevista con el cliente, selecciona el diseño textil, toma las medidas, realiza los moldes y procede a cortar, ajustan los detalles, y realiza la entrega de la prenda, "la sastrería es como una pasión, cada día tenemos en mente que nuevo diseño o arreglo podemos crear…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que por los años de experiencia que tiene en el negocio cuenta con una cartera de clientes establecida, la desventaja es la falta de capital de inversión para la compra de tela. Su sueño es abrir una tienda de ropa para vender sus propias creaciones, ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de tela por rollo para la confección de vestidos de niña. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 28 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Adda solicita un préstamo para la compra de rollos de tela para la confección de vestidos para abrir una tienda de ropa propia.
texts.en:
Adda is 50 years old, single, she has no children, and her business is tailoring. She is an enterprising woman, independent, tenacious, and optimist. She is responsible and she works very hard.

Her business is located in the southern zone of the city, the most industrialized region, represented mainly by agriculture, livestock, and forestry production. It is the most important hydrocarbon production zone, situated at 437 meters above sea level, with a hot, tropical climate and daytime temperatures ranging from 21 to 34 degrees centigrade.

Adda is olive-skinned, with brown eyes and short brown hair that she wears bobbed. She is short of stature with a robust build. Her mother tongue is Guaraní which is spoken at home, and she also speaks Spanish in the community and for her work. (She is in the center of the photo, wearing an orange and black top with horizontal stripes).

She shares her life with her family members. They work. They live in their own room built of brick and cement with a corrugated metal roof, and have potable water, electricity, and a sewage system.

Adda's desire to improve her work led her to form a group of business owners so they could request a loan and improve their businesses, which include a brake repair shop, food sales, nail salon, bed sheet sales, slipper sales, bakery, and dairy sales.

Adda works as a tailor. She meets with the client to select the textile design, takes the measures, prepares the patterns, and proceeds to cut. After final adjustment of details, she delivers the finished garment. "Tailoring is like a passion, every day we keep in mind what new design or alteration we might create", she comments.

Her advantage in this business is that she has an established customer base due to her years of experience. Her disadvantage is the lack of capital to invest in the purchase of fabrics. Her dream is to open a clothing store where to sell her own creations. 

Adda wants to expand her business by purchasing rolls of fabric to make girls' dresses. This is her first loan with the institution in the 28 years that she's been doing this work. She is requesting the loan to buy rolls of fabric that she will use to make dresses and open her own clothing store.

loans.use: to buy rolls of fabric to make dresses in order to open her own clothing store.

loans.name: Inoyat

texts.en: Inoyat is a wise woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan into a family of farmers. She is living in a remote district with her family. She is married and has four children. She is busy in agriculture and plants agricultural products such as vegetables, cereal and corn. Her son wants to help his parents and decided to go to Russia to earn money. Inoyat wants to support her son in his decision and appealed to IMON asking for financial support to buy a ticket. She hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders and give an opportunity to her son to help his parents financially.

loans.use: to buy a ticket for her son.

loans.name: Luz Urbina

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer muy entregada a su familia, trabaja incasablemente todos los días de la semana de lunes a domingo en su negocio de producción de alimentos típicos como tamales. 

Madre de 2 hijos  y ve una oportunidad de una entidad que le brinda la confianza de tener un crédito para mejorar su negocio y soñar con su fábrica de producción de alimentos y hacerle creer que es posible alcanzar este sueño. 

Le dedica 8 horas diarias a su negocio.

Solicita un crédito para la compra de ingredientes como maíz y carne al por mayor.

Con la ayuda de este crédito la señora Luz producirá mas alimentos y le permitirá obtener mejores ingresos para cada día darle mejores oportunidades de vida a sus dos hijos
texts.en:
Luz is a woman who is very committed to her family. She works tirelessly every day of the week from Monday to Sunday in her business making traditional food, such as tamales.

She is the mother of 2 children and sees an opportunity in a bank that offers her the confidence to have a loan to improve her business. She dreams about having a food production factors, and she has to grow to make this dream possible.

She spends 8 hours per day working on her business.

She requests a loan to buy ingredients, such as corn and meat wholesale.

With the help of this loan, Luz will produce more food, which will allow her to earn a better income so that each day, she given better opportunities to her two children.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, such as corn and meat, wholesale for her business selling tamales.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.

She has operated a café business for the past two years, selling cooked food at the market and in the community. She mentioned seasonality as a major challenge in her place of operation.

With the loan, she wants to purchase rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, cooking oil, and beans. She decided to join Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, cooking oil, and beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bags of baking flour to bake bread and sell to customers

loans.name: Helen Evelyn

texts.es:
Helen, estudio hasta segundo grado, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, tiene 2 niñas de 13 y 11 años de edad, las cuales van a la escuela.

Helen, se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenia 15 años de edad, aprendió todo con sus padres, porque ellos son agricultores, antes se dedicaba a lavar ropa ajena y aún lo hace, pero no de forma permanente porque tiene que estar pendiente de sus cultivos, sus sembradíos están a 6 kilómetros de distancia y le ayuda su esposo y sus hijas cuando no están en la escuela, ella trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m. hasta las 2:00 p.m. el el cultivo. 

Helen, necesita el crédito para comprar 6 sacos de fertilizantes y pagar el alquiler de la tierra donde sembrará. 

Su sueño, es poder darles el estudios a sus niñas, también desea comprar un terreno y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Helen studied until second grade. She is in a relationship, and her husband is dedicated to agriculture. She has two daughters, who are 13 and 11 years old; they go to school.

Helen has been dedicated to agriculture since she was 15 years old. She learned everything from her parents, because they were also farmers. Previously, she was dedicated to doing other people’s laundry, and she still does it but not permanently because she has to be looking after her crops. Her crops are 6 kilometers away, and her husband and daughters (when they are not in school) help her. She works from 6:00am until 2:00pm on the farm.

Helen needs the loan to buy 6 sacks of fertilizers and to pay the rent for the land where she sows.

Her dream is to be able to provide an education to her daughters. She also wants to buy land and improve her life conditions.

loans.use: to buy 6 sacks of fertilizers and to pay the rent for the land where she sows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new engine for her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Elnora

texts.en:
Elnora is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dressmaking business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 45,000 through NWTF to buy cloth and other dressmaking materials for her businesses.

Elnora has been in this business for ten years. She earns additional income from gowns rental. She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Elnora has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy cloth and other dressmaking materials for her business.

loans.name: Celestinha

texts.en:
Celestinha is applying for a loan of $1,000 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is 34 years old. She is running a kiosk in front of her house, and she will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as beer, Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko, biscuits, coffee, sugar, salt, eggs, water, fish, milk and slippers.

Celestinha is making good money from selling, and she wants to apply for bigger loan in the future. She lives in a town nearby the school; her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people come to shop, including students.

loans.use: To buy beer, Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko, biscuits, coffee, sugar, salt, eggs, water, fish, milk and slippers

loans.name: Feryal

texts.en:
Feryal is a 28-year-old married woman from Khan Younis. She is a mother of two sons and one daughter. Her husband works as an employee in a local firm and also has a rickshaw for transferring goods. It is a good business, but still not enough to cover all the family’s needs.

Feryal took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her husband to buy a new engine for his rickshaw. By taking this loan, Feryal's husband will be able to get back to work.

Feryal appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay university fees for this semester

loans.name: Maxelinda

texts.en:
Maxelinda owns and operates a water refilling station. She sells purified drinking water to the locals in her area. She is a 57-year-old married woman with one grown child. She has been engaged in that kind of business for three years. She lives in Antequera, Bohol.

She is asking for a loan to buy additional water containers and to pay for the repair of the delivery truck. These are very essential tools that would help augment her income. With these, she would be able to expand her business.

Maxelinda's goal is to improve her business to become more sustainable in the years to come.

loans.use: to buy additional water containers and to pay for the repair of the delivery truck

loans.name: Thekrayat

texts.en:
Thekrayat is student at the age of flowers; she only needs financial help to achieve her dreams. She is a simple girl who lives with her family in Zarqaa, and she is 22 years old. 

Thekrayat is studying at a university majoring in computer information systems. She chose this major for her believes that there are many job opportunities in this field. She wants to graduate and find good work with a good salary, but the financial problems faced by her family are an obstacle standing in front of her. For this reason, she decided to apply for an education loan to be able to cover her university fees and achieve her goals.

loans.use: to be able to cover her university fees and achieve her goals.

loans.name: Ma. Juliet

texts.en:
Ma. Juliet earns a living by providing manicures and pedicures to the locals in her community. She is a married woman with six children and is from Antequera, Bohol. Her oldest child is 20, and the youngest is 2. She also engages in selling dry goods and processed foods, to have supplemental income.

She has requested a loan to buy a manicure/pedicure set and additional supplies of goods. With these, she could continue to provide better services to her customers. Thus, her income will increase, and she will provide her family with healthy meals.

She is dedicated to expand both of her sources of livelihood to become successful.

loans.use: to buy a manicure/pedicure set and additional supplies of goods.

loans.name: Gerlie

texts.en:
Gerlie is 34 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, coffee, etc. Gerlie has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future Gerlie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Joaninha

texts.en:
A $1,000 loan is offered to Joaninha to improve her business.  She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as flour and a machine.

She has been involving herself in business activities since 2013. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.
Running a business has made Joaninha independent because she can be responsible for herself and also for helping her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy flour and a machine

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosalinda is 40 years old and has three children who are in school.

Rosalinda has an ice cream business in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her ice cream business.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 23 years. In the future, Rosalinda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her ice cream business

loans.name: Diosa

texts.en:
Diosa works hard to support her family. Diosa is 30 years old and has two children who are in school. She has a bamboo-weaving business in the Philippines.

Diosa requested a PHP 18,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more stocks of bamboo to weave.

Diosa has been in this business for ten years now.

In the future, Diosa would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of bamboo to weave.

loans.name: Samah

texts.en:
Samah is a 22-year-old, caring mother of two children and, like most mothers, she is always searching for a way to provide her children with the basic needs and a way to help her husband to fight hard circumstances.  

She started commerce, selling blankets in her home in order to help her husband. Day by day, the needs of her children are increasing. Now, she’s seeking to further improve her business. 

Samah applied for a youth loan to expand and develop her work by buying more blankets, to increase her products and to improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: to expand and develop her work by buying more blankets to increase her products.

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil is a 21-year-old Palestinian man and a married father of one child. Due to the low financial and social living conditions of Palestinians in Lebanon and their limited access to jobs, he started almost four years ago working as a blacksmith from his house to cover the needs and expenses of his family.

Khalil is a hard worker and ambitious man who has a good reputation in his region. He manufactures braziers and has professional skills in this domain. Today, he is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a welding machine, which will increase his production and allow him to provide his customers with quick service.

Khalil hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a welding machine, which will increase his production.

loans.name: Kurbonbi

texts.ru:
Курбонби из района Яван. Она как другие жители района занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельностью. У нее во дворе имеется не большой земельный участок, где она выращивает растение. Кроме растениеводство Курбонби выращивает скота. Курбонби очень трудолюбивая женщина. Она любить сельскохозяйственную работу и любить трудиться. 
Курбонби 57 лет. Она имеет двоих сыновей. Младший сын находится загранице, чтобы зарабатывать и помочь маме. Старший сын женат, и отец двоих детей. Он вместе женой и детьми живет с матерью. Курбонби сейчас закончила посев и ей необходимо обработать землю минеральными удобрениями, чтобы получить качественный урожай. Она хочет купить достаточного количества минеральных удобрений для завершения сева урожай, но для завершения данной операции у нее нет денежных средств. Вы можете помочь ей с финансовыми трудностями.
texts.en:
Kurbonbi comes from the region of Yavan. Like other residents of this region, she is an agricultural worker. She has a small plot of land where she grows plants. In addition to doing horticultural work, Kurbonbi raises cattle. Kurbonbi is a very hardworking woman. She truly loves work and enjoys agricultural work. 
Kurbonbi is 57 years old. She has two sons. Her younger son is staying abroad in order to earn money and help his mother. Her elder son is 30. He is married and is a father of two children. His family lives together with his mother. Kurbonbi has now finished sowing and needs to cultivate the land with mineral fertilizers in order to get a high quality crop. She wants to buy enough fertilizer to finish planting the crop, but she has no cash required to complete this operation. You can help her solve her financial problems.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Rubylinda

texts.en:
Rubylinda is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Rubylinda is 36 years old and five of her children are in school.

Rubylinda has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more seafood to sell in her food stall.

Rubylinda has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: BETTY: Es una señora jovial de 50 años de edad, de la comunidad de Saupuka, que se localiza a 8 kilómetros del municipio de Waspam, pertenece a la etnia mayagna. Está casada con 6 hijos: 1 mayor de edad y 5 adolescentes que estudian su secundaria. Con el propósito de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, está solicitando financiamiento para iniciar la construcción de su vivienda de minifalda (Concreto y Madera). Con el préstamo va comprar cemento, bloque y hierro. Ella sueña con tener una casa bonita, con mejores condiciones de seguridad y mejor ambiente para  sus hijos.
texts.en: Betty is a cheerful 50 year old woman from Saupuka. Saupuka is located 8 kilometers from Waspam and is of the mayagna ethnicity. She is married with 6 children: 1 is an adult and 5 minors who study in secondary school. With the goal of improving her quality of life and that of her family, she is seeking financing to begin construction of her home with concrete and wood.  With the loan she is going to buy cement, block, and iron. She dreams of having a beautiful home with improved safety conditions and better environment for her children.

loans.use: to begin construction of her home with concrete and wood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy airtime, telephones, and SIM cards to sell to the customers

loans.name: Darlin

texts.es: DARLIN: Es una señora alegre de 32 años de edad, originaria de la comunidad Klar, que se localiza a 14 kilómetros del municipio de Waspam-Rio Coco, pertenece a la etnia miskita. Madre soltera de 2 hijos en edad escolar. Trabaja como docente de educación primaria en la escuela de su comunidad. Con el propósito de brindarle  a sus hijos una vivienda digna y segura, está solicitando financiamiento para iniciar la construcción de su vivienda de tambo y madera.  Con el préstamo va comprar postes de concreto, madera, clavos y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Ella sueña con tener una casa bonita, con mejores condiciones de seguridad y mejor ambiente para  sus hijos.
texts.en: DARLIN: Darlin is a happy 32 year old woman originally from Klar, which is located 14 kilometers from Waspam-Rio Coco. She is of mixed ethnicity. She is the single mother to 2 school-age children. She works as a teacher in the school in her community. With the goal of providing her children a safe and dignified home, she is seeking financing to begin construction of her raised home (on stilts off the ground) and wood. With the loan she will buy cement posts, wood, nails, and cover the cost of labor. She dreams of having a beautiful home with improved security and better environment for her children.

loans.use: to begin construction of her raised home (on stilts off the ground) and wood

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married woman and is blessed with four children, all of whom attend school. They live ing a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

Christine has been operating a honey-selling business. She cites seasonality and stiff competition from other operators to be her major challenge. 

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase more bottles for packing her honey for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more bottles for packing her honey for resale

loans.name: Odely

texts.es: ODELY: Es una señora alegre de 30 años de edad, de la comunidad de Saupuka, que se localiza a 8 kilómetros del municipio de Waspam, pertenece a la etnia mayagna. Está casada con 2 hijos adolescentes que estudian su primaria. Trabaja como docente de educación primaria. Con el propósito de brindarle a sus hijos una vivienda segura y digna, solicita financiamiento para iniciar la construcción de su vivienda de tambo y madera. Con el préstamo va comprar: postes de madera, madera cepillada, clavos, zinc y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Ella sueña con tener una casa bonita, con mejores condiciones de seguridad y mejor ambiente para  sus hijos.
texts.en: Odely is a cheerful 30-year-old woman, from the community of Saupuka, located 8 kilometers from the town of Waspam, belongs to the Mayagna ethnic group. She is married with two teenage children who go to school. She works as a primary school teacher. In order to provide her children a safe and decent house, she is requesting a loan to begin construction of her wooden stilt house. With the loan she will buy studs, planed timber, nails, and corrugated metal roofing sheets, and cover labor costs. She dreams of having a nice house, with better security and a better environment for her children.

loans.use: to begin construction of her wooden stilt house.

loans.name: Emita

texts.es: EMITA: Es una señora amable de 37 años de edad, de la comunidad de Saupuka, que se localiza a 8 kilómetros del municipio de Waspam, pertenece a la etnia mayagna. Está casada con 5 hijos: 3 adolescentes que estudian su primaria y 2 menores de edad. Con el propósito de brindarle a su familia una vivienda digna y segura, está solicitando financiamiento para construir un anexo de madera, que será utilizado como cuarto para sus hijos. Con el préstamo va comprar madera cepillada, clavos, zinc y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Ella sueña con tener una casa bonita, con mejores condiciones de seguridad y mejor ambiente para  sus hijos.
texts.en: EMITA: Emita is a friendly 37 year old woman originally from Saupuka, which is located 8 kilometers from Waspam. She is of mayagna ethnicity. She is the married with 5 children: 3 adolescents in elementary school and 2 additional minor children. With the goal of providing her children a safe and dignified home, she is seeking financing to build an annex of wood which will be used as a room for her children. With the loan she will buy wood, nails, zinc, and cover the cost of labor. She dreams of having a beautiful home with improved security and better environment for her children.

loans.use: to build an annex of wood which will be used as a room for her children.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.es: LORNA: Es una señora luchadora de 41 años de edad, originaria de la comunidad Bilwaskarma, que se localiza a 12 kilómetros del municipio de Waspam-Rio Coco. Ella pertenece a la etnia Mayagna. Madre soltera de 3 hijos: 1 mayor de edad y 2 adolescentes que estudian su primaria y secundaria. Con el propósito de brindarle a su familia una vivienda digna y segura, está solicitando financiamiento para iniciar la construcción de su vivienda de tambo y madera. Con el préstamo va comprar madera cepillada, clavos, zinc y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Ella sueña con tener una casa bonita, con mejores condiciones de seguridad y mejor ambiente para  sus hijos.
texts.en: LORNA: Lorna is a hard-working 41 year old woman originally from Bilwaskarma, which is located 12 kilometers from Waspam-Rio Coco. She is of the Mayagna ethnicity. She is the single mother to 3 children: 1 grown adult and 2 minors who study in primary and secondary school. With the goal of providing her children a safe and dignified home, she is seeking financing to begin construction of her raised home (on stilts off the ground) and wood. With the loan she will buy wood, nails, zinc, and cover the cost of labor. She dreams of having a beautiful home with improved security and better environment for her children.

loans.use: to begin construction of her raised home (on stilts off the ground) and wood.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz es una mujer de 52 años de edad, ella vive muy feliz con su pareja y sus dos hijos, no es ninguna mantenida, ella aparte de las labores como ama de casa, se desempeña como confeccionista a terceros, genera un empleo  fijo y con este trabajo aporta para el mejoramiento continuo de la calidad de vida en su casa.

Su meta junto con su esposo es pagar la educación de su hijo, le dan trabajo temporalmente para que se gane su dinero y compre el mismo sus cosas, pero la matricula la pagan mitad ella y mitad su esposo y se dividen los gastos familiares.

Beatriz se encuentra solicitando un apoyo financiero para la compra de insumos de confección, como lo son hilos, agujas, broches, remaches, botones y tela para dar los primeros pasos de línea propia de ropa.

Este préstamo impulsara el deseo de Beatriz de sacar una línea de blusas y pijamas que iniciara ofertando a personas cercanas mirando que impacto tiene sobre ellos.
texts.en:
Beatriz is a 52-year-old woman.  She lives very happily with her husband and her two children.  She isn’t at all reliant on them; besides her work as a homemaker, she works as a third-party seamstress.  She has a fixed arrangement, and with this work she takes care of the ongoing improvement of the quality of life in her home.

Together with her husband, her goal is to pay for her son’s education.  He works seasonally to earn money and afford his own things, but she pays for half of his educational expenses and her  husband pays half.  They divide up the family expenses.

Beatriz finds herself asking for financial support for the purchase of dressmaking supplies such as thread, needles, fasteners, rivets, buttons, and fabric in order to take the first steps towards her own line of clothing.

This loan is driven by Beatriz’s desire to create a line of tops and pajamas that she will offer to people close to her, keeping an eye on the impact the line has on them.

loans.use: to buy dressmaking supplies such as thread, needles, fasteners, rivets, buttons, and cloth, in order to take her first steps towards her own line of clothing.

loans.name: Eleonor

texts.en:
Eleonor is 25 years old, married with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

She has a buy and sell cashew nuts business in the Philippines. Eleonor requested a PHP 23000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase sacks of cashew nuts to sell.

Eleonor has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Eleonor would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of cashew nuts to sell and thus ensure the future of her family

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 54-year-old woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, with her spouse and seven children. Her son has been running a small printing press for three years. 

Flex is a sheet of polythene widely used to deliver high quality digital prints for outdoor hoardings and banners, mainly printed by large color plotters. These prints are used instead of hand written banners for their low cost and durability. Her son, who is solely responsible for his own children and his parents, prints advertisement banners and logos on order. 

Because Shehnaz is sick, she has to spend most of the income on medical treatment. Her son wants to grow his business to generate additional income so he can better care for his children and bear the medical expenses of his parents. Therefore, Shehnaz has requested a Kiva loan so her son can buy polythene sheets and colors plotters to print more flex. In this way, he can easily generate additional income for his family. 

Shehnaz deserves Kiva's support, and she is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan for this opportunity.

loans.use: assist her son in purchasing polythene sheets and colors plotters

loans.name: Nakhuan Group

texts.en:
Soulichan’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  

Soulichan and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits.  

Soulichan and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like Soulichan’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters, so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Lerk Group

texts.en:
Vieng understands the difference the water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families.  Vieng knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  

The water filter Vieng purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.    

Vieng is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Monrad

texts.es: MONRAD: Es un señor sonriente de 36 años de edad, originario de Waspam-Rio Coco. Está casado con 4 hijos: 3 adolescentes que estudian su primaria y un pequeño de 2 años. Trabaja como docente de escuela de educación primaria. Con el propósito de brindarle a sus hijos una vivienda segura y digna, solicita financiamiento para iniciar la construcción de su vivienda de Concreto. Con el préstamo va comprar cemento, bloque y hierro. El sueña con tener una casa bonita, con mejores condiciones de seguridad y mejor ambiente para  sus hijos.
texts.en: MONRAD: Monrad is a smiling 36 year old man originally from Waspam-Rio Coco. He is married and has 4 children: 3 school aged children in primary and secondary school and 1 little child that is 2 years old.  He works as an elementary school teacher. With the goal of providing his children a safe and dignified home, he is seeking financing to begin construction of his concrete home. With the loan he will buy cement, block and iron. He dreams of having a beautiful home with improved security and better environment for his children.

loans.use: to begin construction on his concrete home.

loans.name: Nigina

texts.ru: 42 летняя женщина Нигина. Нигина жительница района Яван. Она живет вместе мужем и сыном. Сын находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. 12 лет назад Нигина начала заниматься сельскохозяйственной деятельности. У нее имеется не большой участок земли во дворе. В течение 12 лет Нигина постоянно сажает урожай. Для нее данная деятельность является единственным источником дохода. Она каждый сезон вместе с мужем сажают урожай. Сейчас Нигина закончила посев, и хочет отработать землю минеральными удобрениями. Цель данного кредита является развитие растениеводство. Нигина решила взят кредит и за счет кредита хочет приобрести минеральных удобрений, чтобы получить богатый урожай.
texts.en: Nigina is a 42-year-old woman who lives in the region of Yavan. She lives with her husband and their son. Her son currently works in Russia in order to earn money. Twelve years ago Nigina got involved in agriculture. She has a small plot of land in her yard. In the past twelve years Nigina has planted crops. This work is her only source of income. Every season Nigina and her husband plant crops. Nigina has now finished sowing and would like to treat her plot of land with mineral fertilizers. Nigina will use the loan to enhance horticultural crop production. She decided to apply for a loan in order to buy mineral fertilizers and harvest a rich crop.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Glecy

texts.en:
Glecy is 45 years old, married and has 5 children. She wants to help her husband in providing a living, so she engaged in a buy and sell business to earn income.  She needs financial assistance in financing her in expansion of her business to have more sales.  This is why she borrowed a loan again to purchase additional cosmetics to sell.

Glecy plan in the future to invest in other business to increase her family income.

loans.use: To purchase additional cosmetics to sell, to increase her family income

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene is 29 years old, a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Mylene has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Mylene requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Mylene has been in this business for five years. In the future, Mylene would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell so as to expand her business

loans.name: Athan

texts.es: ATHAN: Es una señor luchador de 43 años de edad, originario de la comunidad Klar, que se localiza a 14 kilómetros del municipio de Waspam-Rio Coco, pertenece a la etnia miskita. Trabaja como docente de educación primaria en la escuela de su comunidad. Está casado con 3 hijos adolescentes que estudian su secundaria. Con gran esfuerzo, poco a poco desde hace 3 años inicio la construcción de su vivienda de tambo y madera, sin embargo con su salario no le cubre para realizarle algunas mejoras como terminar de techar su vivienda. Es por eso que solicitan un préstamo para poder hacer esta mejora. Con el préstamo va comprar madera, zinc, clavos y pagar la mano de obra. El sueña con tener una casa bonita, con mejores condiciones de seguridad y mejor ambiente para  sus hijos.
texts.en:
ATHAN is 43 and is a man with a fighting spirit. He comes from the community of Klar, which is 14 km from the town of Waspam-Rio Coco. He is part of the Miskita ethnic population. He is a primary-school teacher in his community's school. He is married and has 3 adolescent children who are studying in secondary school. With substantial effort, he slowly began building his wooden stilt house 3 years ago. However, his salary doesn't cover the cost of all the work such as completing the roof.

This is why he is asking for a loan: so he can carry out this improvement. He will use it to buy wood, zinc and nails, as well as hiring workers. His dream is to have a nice house with improved security and the best environment for his children.

loans.use: to finish the roof on his wooden stilt house.

loans.name: Lathbuak Group

texts.en:
Phad is excited the filter was available on an affordable payment plan.  Phad and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.  

The water filter Phad and her group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years.  Phad and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Phad and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Houysung Group

texts.en:
Pao’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Pao and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  

Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits.  Pao and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like Pao’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Johannah

texts.en:
Johanna is applying for a second loan to support her studies through his graduation in December 2015 at the Maharishi Institute. She has provided the following update on her progress since receiving the first loan: 

“Since I have been receiving a Kiva stipend, my studies have progressed in a good way because right now I am no longer having problems with transport money and as a result I am able to study to my full potential. There is no obstacle anymore”.

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda is 56 years old and married with nine children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines and is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins and other supplies to raise livestock.

Rosenda has been raising pigs for 25 years and also earns additional income from coconut wine vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins and other supplies to raise livestock. This will secure a future for her family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Allah Rakhi

texts.en:
Allah Rakhi is a 44-year-old woman who lives with her spouse and seven children in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a general store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, and biscuits. He manages to cover his household necessities from his own store.

Her husband speaks with an even tone, which is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his good behavior, he has built up very good relations with his customers. As a result, his sales have increased a lot. Unfortunately, he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand.

Therefore, Allah Rkhi has requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He will use it to buy sacks of rice, sugar, flour, soaps, detergent, bread and jam. She is very glad after taking this loan. Hopefully it will help to successfully fulfill each customer request so they will not be disappointed.

She is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, and assures that she will pay all due installments on time and with regularity.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, rice, sugar, flour, soaps, detergent, bread and jam.

loans.name: Nakham Group

texts.en:
Chansee is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.  Chansee and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  

Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.  The water filter Chansee and her group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years.  Chansee and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Chansee and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in electric wire, a breaker box and flexible conduits so she can install electricity.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 33 years old and married with four children. All of her children attend school.

Marites works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Marites has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from frozen foods.

Marites aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Jesusa

texts.en:
Ma. Jesusa is 33 years old, married woman with four children. Three of her children are in school, she is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Ma. Jesusa has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Ma. Jesusa requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Ma. Jesusa has been in this business for three years. In the future, Ma. Jesusa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell, so that may expand her business

loans.name: Thamer

texts.en:
Thamer is a capable man who was born in the northern part of Jordan in 1995. Single and living with his parents, he is a university student majoring in accounting. Jordan is well known among friends and students.

Aside from school, he works in a sweet shop to secure his daily pocket money, and to help his father with the household expenses.

Thamer lacks sufficient funds to pay his tuition fees. He is ambitious and empowered, not wanting to stand up without doing anything. Therefore, he requested a loan to help pay for his university fees so that he may achieve his dreams. He hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Tshepo

texts.en: Tshepo is applying for a third loan to support his studies through his graduation in December 2015 at the Maharishi Institute.He has provided the following update on his progress since receiving the second loan: “ The loan has helped me in a good way because I live far, so it is good for my transport and I am very thankful for the opportunity that was given to me".

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Kagiso

texts.en: Kagiso is applying for a third loan to support his studies through her graduation in December 2015 at the Maharishi Institute. He has provided the following update on her progress since receiving the first loan: “ My studies have been increasing since last I got a loan from Kiva because now I can be able to pay my monthly transport to go to school. I don’t have to stress about transport anymore and I am very happy that Kiva helped me on that. I hope Kiva will keep on helping more and more students so that they can be able to study

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Keketso

texts.en: Koketso is applying for a third loan to support her studies through her graduation in December 2015 at the Maharishi Institute. She has provided the following update on her progress since receiving the second loan: “Since I received my second loan my studies have improved, as I am no longer have to stress much about where I will get my taxi fare from. The only thing that matter and plays a vital role in helping me to obtain my degree is having money to get to school. Kiva is helping me with that ,,,,thanks Kiva".

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Khankeo Group

texts.en: Khamchan’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Khamchan and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits.  Khamchan and her village also understand the impact that unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for two years. Within this period, Khamchan’s family identified a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Zenayda Jholiveth

texts.es: ZENAYDA JHOLIVETH: Es una señora luchadora, originaria de Waspam-Rio Coco. Madre soltera, de 3 hijos: 1 mayor de edad y 2 adolescentes que estudian su primaria. Trabaja con enfermera de medicina natural. Con el propósito de brindarle a sus hijos una vivienda segura y digna, solicita financiamiento para iniciar la construcción de su vivienda de Concreto. Con el préstamo va comprar cemento, bloque y hierro. Ella sueña con tener una casa bonita, con mejores condiciones de seguridad y mejor ambiente para  sus hijos.
texts.en:
Zenayda Jholiveth is a persevering woman from Waspam-Río Coco.  She's the single mother of three children: one adult and two teenagers who attend school.  She works in natural medicine as a nurse.

She wants to give her children a safe and decent home, so she's requesting a loan to start building a concrete house.  She's going to buy cement, cinderblocks, and rebar with the loan.

Zenayda Jholiveth dreams of having a nice house with better security and a better environment for her children.

loans.use: to start building a concrete house

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is a 59-year-old married woman with six grown children, from Antequera, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store, selling assorted items like biscuits, seasonings, beverages, toiletries and soft drinks. She has been running a sari-sari store for 8 years now.

She is asking for a loan to buy various stocks like rice, feed, drinks and groceries. These will help to improve the content of her store and attract more buyers. With these, she could handle her business and settle her obligations. She could now start to do some expansion.

Her desire is to improve her sari-sari, hopefully leading to sustainable living in the years to come.

loans.use: to buy rice, feed, drinks and groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials such as wood, cement, steel laminate, etc.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 66 years old, a widow with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Lydia has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Lydia has been in this business for 23 years. In the future, Lydia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking oil, slippers, candles, flour, and other products

loans.name: Khamseeda Group

texts.en:
Khamseng’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  

Khamseng and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits.  Khamseng and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like Khamseng’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan es un joven soltero, tiene 26 años de edad, Juan vive con sus padres y hermanos, Juan comenta que sus padres no tienen los recursos economicos para seguir pagando los gastos de estudio de sus hermanos y suyos. Juan se dedica a la crianza de animales animales ya que su madre le enseña que esta actividad si es buena, Juan tambien trabaja de ayudante de abañil, Juan necesita el dinero del credito para comprar chanchos, Juan tiene la aspiracion de seguir trabajando, comprar mas chanchos y mejorar su negocio. Juan necesita mejorar sus ingresos para cubrir sus gastos y para ayudarle a sus padres con lo que pueda para que por lo menos sean sus hermanos menores quienes sigan estudiando ya que Juan no lo pudo hacer.
texts.en: Juan is a single, 26 year old man. He lives with his parents and siblings. Juan comments that this parents don't have economic resources to continue paying his and his siblings educational expenses. Juan works raising animals, which is work his mother taught him and is good work. Juan also works as a bricklayer assistant. Juan needs a loan to buy pigs. Juan aspires to continue working, to buy more pigs and improve his business. Juan needs to improve his income in order to cover his expenses and be able to help his parents as much as he can so that at least his younger siblings can continue studying even if Juan can no longer do so.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Kipma Group

texts.en: Lai understands the difference the water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families.  Lai knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Lai purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.    Lai is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.
