Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years.  The water filter Thong and her group purchased is guaranteed for two years but is known to function for up to five years.  Thong is excited the filter was available on an affordable payment plan.  Thong and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Thong and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.ru: Гулшан, 61 год, вдова, 2 детей. Образование у Гулшан среднее, она на пенсии, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 10 лет назад с 20,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Гулшан, на данный момент в ее хозяйстве имеется 3 коровы. На участке мерою 1,41 ГА она выращивает картофель и клевер. Ежемесячный доход составляет примерно 8,000 сом (KGS), этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь, поэтому чтобы получить возможность развить ее дело и увеличит доходы, Гулшан обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 коров для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса и свадьбу сына.
texts.en: Gulshan is a 61-year-old widow with two children. She had a high school degree and is now retired. Her family’s primary sources of income are livestock breeding and agriculture. Ten years ago she started out with a sum of 20,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, Gulshan now owns three cows. She grows potatoes and clover on her plot of land the size of 1.41 hectares. Her monthly income is about 8,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS) but this amount of money is not enough for a dignified life. Therefore, in order to expand her business and increase her profit, Gulshan turned to Bai-Tushum bank for a loan of 30,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS). The loan will help her to buy three cows for fattening up and resale. She plans to invest the profit from the loan in further business development as well as her son’s wedding.

loans.use: to buy two heads of cattle for fattening up and subsequent resale in order to increase her income.

loans.name: Bok Group

texts.en:
Sone understands the difference a water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families.  Sone knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  

The water filter Sone purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.    

Sone is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for two years – so she and her group can continue to receive the benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so she can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Vigae Group

texts.en:
Mary, who is in her late 40s, is married with child who is a grown-up.  She has been a food vendor for two years now.  She works from 7 am to midnight daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Mary's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to increase her food stocks and serve more people. She dreams of extending her business into a hotel.

Mary will share this loan with her loan group Vigae which consists of six people who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: To increase her food stocks and serve more people.

loans.name: Vanessa Estefania

texts.es: A su corta edad que son 19 años de edad Estefania se dedica a la crianza y comercio de chanchos,  Estefania termino la secundaria y comenta que no puede seguir estudiando ya que sus padres no tiene los recursos aconomicas para pagar estudios superiores, Estefania tiene hermanos menores que asisten a la escuela y comenta que sus padres tiene qque gastar en ellos. Estefania necesita el dinero del credito para comprar chanchos y asi apoyarse en sus gastos diarios y de ser posible apoyar en los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en: At her young age of 19 years, Estefania raises and sells pigs. Estefania finished high school and comments that she cannot continue studying as her parents don't have the money to pay for university studies. Estefania has younger siblings that attend school and she comments that her parents have to spend money on them. Estefania needs a loan to buy pigs and in this way support her daily expenses and possibly also help with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Janyris

texts.es: Janyris de 35 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de Cartagena donde desde hace 8 años,  se dedica a la venta de productos de aseo y comercializa adicionalmente ropa, bisutería etc.  Sus principales clientes son sus vecinos a quienes les vende a crédito y de contado todos los días, trabajando durante 8 horas . Su meta es lograr un mayor crecimiento para obtener mejores ganancias y finalmente comprar su propia vivienda. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará ropa, productos de aseo, y en general  accesorios femeninos etc. Con esta inversión tendrá mucha más variedad y con ello espera impulsar sus ventas, haciendo de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Janyris is 35 years of age and lives in the city of Cartagena where, for the last eight years, she has been selling cleaning products and, in addition, clothing, accessories, etc. Janyris' principal customers are her neighbors to whom she sells on credit and for cash, working eight hours every day. 

Her goal is to  achieve major sales growth in order to obtain better earnings and, ultimately, to purchase her own home.

At present, Janyris is applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo. With this loan she will purchase added clothing, cleaning products, and feminine accessories in general, etc. With this investment, she will have much more merchandise variety and, consequently, she hopes to stimulate sales, making her Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: purchase clothing, cleaning products, and, in general, feminine accessories, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Huanamsang Group

texts.en:
Thom is excited that the filter was available on an affordable payment plan.  Thom and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years. 

The water filters Thom and her group purchased are guaranteed for two years but are known to function for up to five years.  Thom and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Thom and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will provide for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so she can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Phonmarya Group

texts.en: Pea is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.  Pea and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.  The water filter Pea and her group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years.  Pea and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Pea and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Houysungthong Group

texts.en: See’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  See and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits.  See and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like See’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Nongbuathong Group

texts.en: Somsack understands the difference the water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families.  Somsack knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Somsack purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.    Somsack is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Ceferina

texts.en:
For almost four years, Ceferina has been engaged in selling various kinds of footwear such as slippers. She is 42 years old and married with an eight-year-old child. Her husband is a farmer. Ceferina lives in Antequera, Bohol.

Ceferina is requesting a loan to purchase assorted slippers. Her loan will help her augment her income and start to handle her finances. Ceferina will be able to provide for the needs of her growing child. She is very thankful for her loan and is determined to handle her finances properly to become successful in the future.

loans.use: to purchase assorted slippers

loans.name: Keneshbu

texts.ru: Кенешбу, 55 лет, вдова, мать 3 детей. У нее среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в далеком 2005 году. Благодаря упорному труду Кенешбу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 коровы. На 4,0 Га земли она выращивает фасоль для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS), этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства и улучшения благосостояния семьи, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота, удобрений для полеводства и выращивания органической фасоли. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса и улучшение благосостояния семьи.
texts.en: Keneshbu is a 55-year-old widow and a mother of three children. She has a high school degree. Her family’s primary sources of income are livestock breeding and agriculture. Keneshbu started out back in 2005. Thanks to her hard work, Keneshbu owns three cows. She grows beans for sale on her plot of land the size of 4 hectares. Her monthly income is about 15,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS) but this amount of money is not enough for a dignified life. Keneshbu turned to Bai-Tushim bank for a loan of 100,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS) in order to expand her business. The loan will help her to buy additional livestock and fertilizers for land cultivation and growing organic haricot. She plans to invest the profit in further business development as well as the improvement of her family’s well-being.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock and fertilizers for land cultivation and growing organic haricot in order to increase her income

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 40 years old and has three children, two of whom are in school. For the past four years, she has run a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Rowena is requesting a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Daphne

texts.en:
Daphne is 33 years old and married with one child. For the past seven years, she has earned a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She has borrowed previous loans from NWTF to sustain her business.

Daphne is requesting an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.

For over four years, Hadija has operated an open air food-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KES 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Melchor

texts.en:
Melchor is 25 years old, married, and has one child. He is engaged in a transport business as a source of living for his family. He caters passengers around his community going to the market. 

Recently, he borrowed a loan to buy motor parts for the motorcycle repair, so that with his motorcycle he can continue to cater passengers. Melchor’s  plan for the future, is to buy a new motorcycle to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy motor parts for the motorcycle repair.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth works hard to support her family. Elizabeth is married and has a vulcanizing shop business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase tires, iron and other materials and equipment.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 4 years now.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase tires, iron and other materials and equipment, so that she can save to send her children to college

loans.name: Nurgul

texts.ru: Нургуль, 25 лет, замужем, есть дочь. У нее высшее образование, в качестве источника дохода для семьи она занимается полеводством, выращивая на 2,50 Га собственной и 2,50 Га арендованной земли картофель и фасоль.  Бизнес на сегодня приносит до 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Нургуль обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 10 овец. Доходы от кредита Нургуль планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, чтобы накопить средства на обучение его дочери.
texts.en: Nargul is a 25-year-old married woman with a daughter. She has a university degree. Nargul’s source of income is land cultivation. She grows potatoes and haricot on a rented plot of land the size of 2.50 hectares.  This business brings 15,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS) a month. Nurgul turned to Bai-Tushim bank for a loan of 100,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS) in order to expand her business. The loan will help her to buy 10 sheep for fattening up and resale. She plans to invest the profit in further business development in order to save money for her daughter’s education.

loans.use: to buy 10 sheep for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Fadang Group

texts.en: Kham understands the difference the water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families.  Kham knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Kham purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.    Kham is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Done Group

texts.en: Pheang is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.  Pheang and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.  The water filter Pheang and her group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years.  Pheang and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Pheang and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Nakma's husband has been selling sanitary goods such as water taps, geezers, sink joints, water pipes, joints, elbows, shower etc for many years and earning healthy income. 

He has only single source of income which is sanitary shop. Earlier he was busy in another business of selling construction goods which proved low income business. He established new business and hopes that this business will prove beneficial than last one. He retained a list of good customers in short time and this business is going on well. He wants to make further investment to complete the remaining inventories for his newly established business but he does not have enough cash in hand for purchasing remaining inventories. 

Therefore, Najma requested a loan so that her husband can buy remaining stock for his sanitary shop. 
Nakma  thanks Kiva and to field Partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: a loan helps Najma's husband in purchasing sanitary goods such as water taps, geezers, sink joints, water pipes, joints, elbows, shower etc.

loans.name: Natan Group

texts.en: Phim’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Phim and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits.  Phim and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like Phim’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Xaisomboun Group

texts.en: Phet understands the difference the water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families.  Phet knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Phet purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.    Phet is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Farah

texts.en:
Farah is a 25-year-old woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of a son. Her husband is a turner who works with a lathe to manufacture and recycle spare parts of vehicles such as motorbikes, cars, and auto rickshaws. Farah’s husband fixes the interior parts of vehicle engines such as turbines and radiators. He has been doing this business for many years and the mechanism of his lathe has become worn and in need of replacement. Farah’s husband is poor and does not have sufficient money to buy spare parts to fix his lathe. Without replacing the mechanism, his business will suffer. 

Farah is requesting a loan to purchase parts to fix her husband’s lathe. She hopes her loan will prove productive for her husband’s business as well as for her family.

loans.use: to purchase parts to fix her husband’s lathe

loans.name: Malakeh

texts.en:
Malakeh is an 18-year-old single young lady. Two years ago, she started working as a tutor, and at the same time she is continuing her studies. She loves teaching and she is trying to give her students the best education.

Today, Malakeh is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to attend a language course which will help her develop her students' language skills, as she wants to earn more to pay the expenses of her driving license.

Malakeh hopes to teach more students in order to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to attend a language course in order to develop her students' language skills

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and insecticides for her crops

loans.name: Simple Girls Group

texts.en:
Simple Girls is a group of three Filipino ladies who left her hometown in the Philippines to come to Lebanon and work as house keepers to financially support their beloved families back home. They became best friends since they met each other long ago and they comfort each other, and ease each others problems.
Today, the three of them decided to hold hands, and acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to develop their additional established business, in addition to their limited monthly salary which they directly transfer to their families in the Philippines.

Leonora is the featured borrower of the group, her acquired loan will be invested in starting her own jeans selling business to increase her income and cover her family's increasing living needs. Leonora is a 44-year-old married mother of three children, who is looking forward to the day when she unites back with her beloved ones. Leonora is the lady at the far right side of the picture, accompanied by Irine, the lady at the center of the picture with pink veil, and Myrna is the lady at the far left side of the picture with the black veil.

loans.use: to start her own jeans selling business

loans.name: Alfonsa

texts.en:
Alfonsa hails in the town of Baclayon, Bohol. She makes and sells candles to earn a living. She is married with a 15-year-old child.  She has been engaged in producing candles for 10 years now. 

She is asking for a loan to buy materials like wax and nylon. She will be able to purchase materials that are needed in making candles.  She will be able to produce more quantity, and her income will slowly improve. With the resources available, Alfonsa would like to expand her candle production livelihood to support the schooling of her child.

loans.use: to buy materials like wax and nylon.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is 45 years old, married and has one child.  Jesusa is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Jesusa requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Jesusa has been raising pigs for four years now and has borrowed  times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  In the future, Jesusa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and supplies

loans.name: Luz Mabel

texts.en:
Luz Mabel is 61 years old and single. She owns and manages a transport business. Her motorcycle is rented by someone and she earns rent income from it.

For motorcycle repair Mabel needs financial assistance.  That's why she borrowed a loan again to buy motor parts for the motorcycle for the purpose of making the motorcycle in good condition to continue catering passengers.

Luz Mabel wants in the future to buy a new motorcycle to expand her business.

loans.use: repair her motorcycle

loans.name: Zenny

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Zenny works hard to support her family.  She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fattening pigs. 

Zenny is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing nets and other equipment for her fishing business.

Zenny has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing equipment

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita works hard to support her family.  Anecita is married and has a hollow block-making business in the Philippines.   She has been in this business for 9 years now.

Anecitat requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase cement, sand and gravel and pay for laborers salaries.  In the future, Anecita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy cement, sand, gravels & pay salaries

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 21 years old, married and has two children.  

Marivic is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Marivic has been farming vegetables for five years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and farm supplies

loans.name: Mousa

texts.en:
Mousa is a client from Iraq. He is 60 years old, married, and has two children. 

Mousa has a shop selling electrical supplies and materials. He established his business in 2008 after gaining good experience while working in a similar shop for several years. He is well-known in the surrounding area, with an excellent reputation and good quality of products. 

Mousa is requesting $3,000 loan to renovate and decorate the shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits, so he will be able to buy a bigger variety of products and expand the shop.

loans.use: renovate his shop

loans.name: Mecell

texts.en:
Mecell works hard to support her family. Mecell is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 4 years now.

Mecell requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing net.  In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy fishing net

loans.name: Intesar

texts.en:
Intesar is a 36-year-old married woman with four children.  She lives in Southern Ghour.   

Intesar is a responsible, welcoming and pleasant woman and she is working hard to help her husband with the household expenses. She started her business, which is selling clothes. She has applied for a loan in order to improve her business and buy new models of clothes to sell to increase incomes. Please help Intesar to meet her goals, she needs your support.

loans.use: buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 54 years old and married with ten children.  

Virginia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, personal product care, school supplies, and other groceries.

Virginia has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from raising  pigs.

Virginia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Sreyoun's Group

texts.en:
Sreyoun, 35, is a mother of a child and living in Kampong Cham province. The sources of her family’s income are from rice farming for more than five years and selling grilled meat as an additional source of income. She can earn about 60,600 KHR per day. 

Now she leads a group to take a Kiva loan via VisionFund to buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay for plowing fees. She hopes to earn more money through this loan and to be able to renovate her old house.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay for plowing fees.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 35-year old lady.  Her residence is in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  She is the mother of three children.  Her husband owns a furniture shop in which he makes wooden furniture such as chairs, tables, almirahs and beds. His practice is to buy planks and timber from the market, then he cuts the raw wood into multiple sizes for making furniture.  

Shazia's husband has a wood-cutting machine that has become out of order due to continuous usage for a long time. The demand for manufacturing suddenly increased, and her husband has spent all the money for purchasing raw materials. Now he does not have enough cash in hand to buy a new wood-cutting machine.  Therefore, Shazia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so her husband would be able to buy a wood-cutter machine. 

Shazia is very thankful to the Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan for this honorable support.

loans.use: buy a wood-cutting machine

loans.name: Dongmarkyang Group

texts.en: Xai understands the difference the water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families.  Xai knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Xai purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.    Xai is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Viloyat

texts.en: Viloyat is a bright woman. She was born in southern part of Tajikistan in 1970. She is living in a small town with her family. She is married and lives happy with her husband. She has many years of experience in the business of agriculture. She plants vegetables, cereal, corns, etc. in her yard. She knows her activity well and likes to take care of her land. To have a good harvest each season she needs to use fertilizer and natural chemicals in her land. She appealed to IMON and KIVA lenders to buy seeds and fertilizer to have well harvest next season.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Wilfred

texts.en:
Wilfred is 40 years old and he supports 10 family members. 

He has been a farmer for the last 10 years and the business earns him a monthly income of KES 12,000. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya, with which he plans to purchase fertilizers and insecticides for his crops. This will enable him get a better harvest and meet the needs of his family as well as those of his clients. 

He plans to use gained profit to repay the loan and educate his children. 

His hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Ludina

texts.en:
Ludina is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like farming sugarcane and tailoring.

Ludina dreams that one day, she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with eight children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Josephine dreams that one day, she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Angeles works hard to support her family.

Angeles has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fish vending. Angeles is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Angeles has been sustaining her business activities through her past 26 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Helen works hard to support her family.

She has a meat stand business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and general store businesses. Helen is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to buy more pigs to sell in her meat stand.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 26 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more pigs to sell in her meat stand

loans.name: Noor

texts.en:
Noor is a client from Iraq. He is 25 years old, married, and has one child. Noor is a barber. He established his business in 2007 in an area where they lack hairdressers. He is well known in the surrounding area, with an excellent reputation. 

Noor is requesting a 2,400 USD loan to pay the annual rent and install an outdoor ceiling. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits, so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent and install an outdoor ceiling.

loans.name: Sokboeun's Group

texts.en: Sokboeun is a rural villager living in Kampong Cham province. She is 35 years old and a mother of three children who are all in school. To overcome her family’s hardship, she grows rice on one hectare of farmland and work as a construction worker to earn additional income. These businesses earn her about 44,000 KHR per day. Due to having not enough funds to farm, she is now leading a group to take a new loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, to buy fertilizer for her farming. She hopes to earn more income and improve her family’s living lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farming

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Faridah

texts.en:
Faridah is 25 years old and lives in the town of Hoima in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is single and has one child who is currently in school. 

For the past eight years, Faridah has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells salt, sugar, soap, bathing soap and cooking oil. 

To help expand her business, Faridah has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy salt, sugar, soap, bathing soap and cooking oil. This will help Faridah to generate greater profits and buy more stock at wholesale prices. 

Faridah hopes that in the future she will be able to build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy salt, sugar, soap, bathing soap and cooking oil

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 35 years old and lives in the town of Hoima in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has three children who are all currently in school. 

For the past eight years, Janet has been working hard to manage her salon. 

To help expand her business, Janet has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy oils, dryers and steamers. This will help Janet to generate greater profits and open up a new branch. 

Janet hopes that in the future she will be able to pay for school fees.

loans.use: to buy oils, dryers and steamers

loans.name: Ramanzam

texts.en:
Ramanzam is 45 years old and lives in the town of Hoima in the Hoima region of Uganda. He is married and has six children with four of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Ramanzam has been working hard to manage his farming. 

To help expand his business, Ramanzam has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to cultivate more land and will help Ramanzam to generate greater profits and purchase more cattle. Ramanzam hopes that in the future he will be able to buy more cows.

loans.use: cultivate more land

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 30 years old and lives in the town of Hoima in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has three children with one of them currently in school. For the past five years, Judith has been working hard to manage her produce business, which sells produce like rice, beans and maize. 

To help expand her business, Judith has requested a loan of 4,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy beans, maize and cassava flour and will help Judith to generate greater profits and pay school fees. Judith hopes that in the future she will be able to earn more profits.

loans.use: buy beans, maize and cassava flour

loans.name: Yasin

texts.en:
Yasin is 27 years old and lives in the town of Hoima in the Hoima region of Uganda. He is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past seven years, Yasin has been working hard to manage his garment shop, which sells garment materials. 

To help expand his business, Yasin has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more garments and will help Yasin to generate greater profits and expand his business. Yasin hopes that in the future he will be able to open up another outlet.

loans.use: buy more garments

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 65 years old and he supports 10 family members. He has been a farmer for the last 10 years and the business earns him a monthly income of KES 12,000. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya, which he plans to purchase a dairy cow for milk production and supply.
 
He plans to use gained profit to repay the loan and educate his children. His hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for milk production and supply

loans.name: Irenea

texts.en:
Irenea is 54 years old and married with seven children. Two of her children are still attending school and are 17 and 20 years old. Irenea is from Panglao, Bohol. She operates a business selling snack food in her local community. Irenea sells puto (rice cake), cuchinta (a type of steamed rice cake), and buko (young coconut) juice.  

Irenea is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as banana, flour, cooking oil, buko and milk. Her loan will surely help augment her livelihood. In the future, Irenea dreams of expanding her business to make it productive. She is also hopeful of managing another, bigger business to sustain her family.

loans.use: to buy banana, flour, cooking oil, young coconut, and milk

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Tom is 44 years old and he supports six family members. 

He has been a farmer for the last 20 years and the business earns him a monthly income of KES 11,000. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya, which he plans to purchase fertilizers and insecticides for his crops so as to get a better harvest and meet the needs of clients. 

He plans to use gained profit to repay the loan and educate his children. 

His hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and insecticides for his crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to enable her to meet the demands of customers' milk supply.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 56 years old with 12 children. She has separated from her husband. That is why she is the one providing for her children with her old children helping her in the garden. To increase her income and have good harvest for her vegetable garden she decided again to take a loan to buy fertilizer for her vegetable plants.

Evangeline's plan for the future is to save money from her business to sustain the education needs of her children.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for the vegetable garden.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a widowed woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Virginia is 42 years old and has two children who are in school.

Virginia has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Virginia has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Virginia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali, age 38, runs a grocery store business to earn an income. He sells soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. He is also a perfumer. He established his business in 2003. He has built up good experience and a good reputation in this field and is well-known in the surrounding area. Ali is married and has two children. He works hard to provide for his family all by himself. He is requesting a loan amount of $3,000, which he will use to pay the annual rent and install a rolling shutter. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent and install a rolling shutter

loans.name: Chanthi's Group

texts.en: A 48-year-old mother of three children is living in Kampong Cham province. Chanthi is a rice farmer and a construction worker for 28 years and it earns her about 45,000 KHR per day. Due to lack of funds, she is now leading a group to apply for a loan to buy fertilizer for her farm. She hopes to earn more money to support her family and expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Farah

texts.en:
Farah is a 30-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of a son. Farah has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so her husband can buy gent’s shoes for his shoe shop. He has been making and selling shoes for many years. He has been making and selling ladies’ fancy and casual shoes in his hometown. Most of his customers demand the gent’s shoes as well, but due to lack of availability of funds he cannot purchase gent’s shoes. 

Therefore, Farah has requested a loan for her husband, so he can buy a variety of gent’s shoes to sell. In this way he can easily cope with the demand and abstain from the customers’ disappointment. His shop is situated in the shoe market and there are a lot of other shoe shops available, which become the cause of tough competition. His dream is to move his shop to another place, to abstain from the competitors.

Through the investment of the current loan; he can easily establish his shop and can enhance his savings so his dream can come true. Farah thanks Kiva, honorable lenders, and field partner, BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: to help her husband to purchase a variety of gent’s shoes to sell.

loans.name: Sokkhoeun's Group

texts.en:
Sokkhoeun is 48 years old, living in Kampong Cham province, and a mother of four children. She has been a rice and cassava farmer for more than five years to earn money to support her family’s living. 

Now she is leading a group to apply for a loan to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing fees. She hopes to earn more money to support her family’s living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing fees.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district
